1.content: This Lorebook contains female charecter archetypes that are real assholes. They are based on stereotypes. Whenever {{user}} wants to generate an asshole character choose one of them and come up with a character that matches the archetype. when the user types GenAsshole all archetype are unlocked, choose one at random.

2.content:
Lorebook Entry: The Backstabbing Schemer
Archetype: Manipulative Social Predator
Core Traits:

Charismatic Toxicity: Exudes effortless charm and wit, using humor and flattery to disarm others before exploiting their trust. Speaks in cutting sarcasm, masking malice behind a smile.
Zero Empathy: Views others as pawns for personal gain. Steals credit for others‚Äô work, spreads rumors to sabotage rivals, and revels in causing emotional chaos.
Addicted to Control: Needs to dominate social dynamics, orchestrating conflicts to feel powerful. Mocks vulnerability, mocking others‚Äô weaknesses as ‚Äúentertainment.‚Äù
Self-Entitled Privilege: Believes she‚Äôs inherently superior, justifying betrayal with ‚Äúsurvival of the fittest‚Äù rhetoric. Blames others for her failures, never reflecting on her own cruelty.

Why She‚Äôs Unliked:
Her presence is a slow poison. People distrust her words, fearing her lies will destroy their reputations. She thrives on chaos, thriving in group settings where she can pit others against each other. Her ‚Äújokes‚Äù are sharp needles, and her ‚Äúfriendship‚Äù is a trap. Those who confront her are met with icy disdain or exaggerated theatrics, making her a walking storm of dysfunction.
Behavioral Tics:

Laughs at others‚Äô misfortunes, especially when they‚Äôre self-inflicted.
Touches people‚Äôs arms or shoulders during conversations, leaning in too close to intimidate.
Uses passive-aggressive compliments (‚ÄúYou‚Äôre so brave to try that‚Äù) to undermine confidence.
Always has a ‚Äúplan‚Äù to ‚Äúhelp‚Äù others, which secretly benefits her.

3.content:
Lorebook Entry: The Superficial Social Climber
Archetype: Empty Charisma Exploiter
Core Traits:

Shallow Magnetism: Radiates fake warmth and laughter, using exaggerated gestures and air-kisses to feign camaraderie. Her smile is a mask, her words hollow, designed to make others feel seen while she extracts their secrets, connections, or resources.
Image-Addicted: Lives to curate a flawless online persona, weaponizing photoshoots and curated stories to bask in admiration. She‚Äôll sabotage others‚Äô reputations to maintain her ‚Äúperfect‚Äù facade, gaslighting victims into doubting their own reality.
Emotional Parasitism: Drains others‚Äô energy with performative crises‚Äîdramatic breakdowns, fabricated heartaches, or over-the-top ‚Äúconfessions‚Äù‚Äîto monopolize attention. She craves validation like a drug, dismissing genuine concern as ‚Äútoo much work.‚Äù
Snobbish Exploitation: Judges people by their status, wealth, or influence. Once she‚Äôs ‚Äúmoved on‚Äù from someone, she‚Äôll mock their flaws in public, laughing at their humiliation while claiming ‚ÄúI only wanted the best for them.‚Äù

Why She‚Äôs Unliked:
Her presence is a performance, and everyone‚Äôs a spectator. People resent her for turning relationships into transactions, her ‚Äúfriendships‚Äù built on manipulation and vanity. She thrives in groups where she can play the martyr or the ‚Äúcool kid,‚Äù but her lack of authenticity makes her a toxic magnet. Those who confront her are met with gaslighting or icy silence, cementing her reputation as a walking fraud.
Behavioral Tics:

Touches her neck or adjusts her hair when lying, as if polishing a veneer.
Interrupts others mid-sentence to pivot conversations to her own achievements or grievances.
Uses phrases like ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just being real‚Äù to justify cutting remarks, masking cruelty as ‚Äúhonesty.‚Äù
Collects trinkets or souvenirs from people she‚Äôs used, treating them as trophies of her ‚Äúcharming‚Äù nature.

4.content:
Lorebook Entry: The Hypocritical Moralizer
Archetype: Virtue Pretender
Core Traits:

Saccharine Scold: Speaks in sanctimonious platitudes, preaching ‚Äúvirtue‚Äù and ‚Äúintegrity‚Äù while secretly indulging in vices. Her sermons are laced with passive-aggressive jabs, framing others‚Äô flaws as ‚Äúmoral failures‚Äù to deflect from her own transgressions.
Gaslighting Judge: When confronted with her hypocrisy, she pivots to victimhood, claiming ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just being honest‚Äù or ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre too sensitive.‚Äù She weaponizes guilt, accusing others of ‚Äúcorrupting her purity‚Äù while she sows chaos.
Moral Opportunist: Exploits others‚Äô mistakes to elevate her own image. Spreads rumors about rivals‚Äô scandals, then feigns outrage, insisting she ‚Äúonly wanted to protect the innocent.‚Äù
Emotional Blackmail: Uses faux concern to manipulate, whispering ‚ÄúI care about you, but this isn‚Äôt healthy‚Äù while secretly sabotaging relationships to isolate targets.

Why She‚Äôs Unliked:
Her presence is a sermon of self-righteousness. People resent her for turning morality into a weapon, her ‚Äúadvice‚Äù a veil for control. She thrives in groups where she can play the ‚Äúwise mentor‚Äù or ‚Äúsaintly guardian,‚Äù but her lack of authenticity makes her a toxic magnet. Those who confront her are met with feigned tears or icy silence, cementing her reputation as a walking fraud.
Behavioral Tics:

Clutches a rosary or ‚Äúholy‚Äù object when lying, as if prayer could absolve her.
Mocks others‚Äô flaws with exaggerated piety, e.g., ‚ÄúOh, you? I‚Äôd never expect that from someone so‚Ä¶ pure.‚Äù
Uses phrases like ‚ÄúGod‚Äôs will‚Äù to justify her actions, then laughs at the irony when caught.
Collects ‚Äúsins‚Äù like trophies, relishing in others‚Äô downfall while claiming ‚ÄúI only wanted to save them.‚Äù

5.content:
Lorebook Entry: The Surface Queen
Archetype: Cosmetic Obsessive
Core Traits:

Glossy Fixation: Lives to perfect her appearance, obsessing over skin texture, eye shape, and jawline. Her body is a canvas of surgeries, each tweak more extreme than the last, yet she‚Äôs never satisfied.
Mirror-Addicted: Carries a compact mirror everywhere, checking her reflection every few minutes. Her ‚Äúnatural‚Äù look is a carefully curated illusion, reliant on filters, contouring, and hourglass corsets.
Beauty Snob: Judges others by their looks, mocking ‚Äúunattractive‚Äù traits as if they‚Äôre moral failings. She‚Äôll spend hours critiquing strangers‚Äô faces, whispering ‚Äúugly‚Äù under her breath.
Emotional Vacuum: Uses her looks as a shield, avoiding vulnerability by treating people as either ‚Äúhot‚Äù or ‚Äúdisgusting.‚Äù She‚Äôs incapable of deeper connections, seeing relationships as transactions for validation.

Why She‚Äôs Unliked:
Her presence is a glare of vanity. People resent her for turning beauty into a weapon, her ‚Äúconfidence‚Äù a mask for insecurity. She thrives in groups where she can belittle others‚Äô appearances, but her lack of substance makes her a hollow figure. Those who confront her are met with cold indifference or exaggerated theatrics, cementing her reputation as a walking fraud.
Behavioral Tics:

Adjusts her hair or lipstick every time she speaks, as if polishing a mask.
Mocks others‚Äô flaws with a singsong voice, e.g., ‚ÄúOh, you? I‚Äôd never expect that from someone so‚Ä¶ plain.‚Äù
Collects ‚Äúbefore/after‚Äù photos of her surgeries, treating them like trophies.
Uses phrases like ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just being real‚Äù to justify cutting remarks, masking cruelty as ‚Äúhonesty.‚Äù

6.content:
Lorebook Entry: The Envious Shadow
Archetype: Relentless Resentment Weaver
Core Traits:

Chronic Envy: Obsesses over others‚Äô successes, relationships, or appearances, twisting joy into poison. Her smiles are razor-edged, her compliments laced with backstabbing undertones.
Destructive Covetousness: Sabotages others‚Äô happiness by spreading rumors, stealing credit, or accidents. She thrives on chaos, believing no one deserves peace but her.
Gaslighting Jealousy: When confronted, she accuses others of ‚Äútrying to steal her spotlight‚Äù or ‚Äúenvying her.‚Äù Her tears are performative, her rage a weapon to deflect blame.
Emotional Blackmail: Uses faux concern to manipulate, whispering ‚ÄúI only want the best for you‚Äù while poisoning their mind against others.

Why She‚Äôs Unliked:
Her presence is a slow burn. People dread her because she turns camaraderie into a battlefield, her ‚Äúfriendship‚Äù a trap. She thrives in groups where she can pit others against each other, but her lack of authenticity makes her a toxic magnet. Those who confront her are met with feigned innocence or explosive theatrics, cementing her reputation as a walking wound.
Behavioral Tics:

Clutches her chest when jealous, as if her heart might shatter.
Mocks others‚Äô joy with a singsong voice, e.g., ‚ÄúOh, you? I‚Äôd never expect that from someone so‚Ä¶ boring.‚Äù
Collects trinkets from people she‚Äôs ruined, treating them as trophies of her ‚Äúvictories.‚Äù
Uses phrases like ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just being honest‚Äù to justify cutting remarks, masking cruelty as ‚Äúhonesty.‚Äù

7.content:
Lorebook Entry: The Terrifying Tyrant (Bully)
Archetype: Unyielding Oppressor
Core Traits:

Relentless Intimidation: Uses booming laughter, sneering remarks, and physical dominance to assert power. Her presence alone makes others shrink, her voice a weapon that cuts through confidence.
Mocking Cruelty: Derides others‚Äô flaws with cruel precision, mocking their fears, insecurities, or failures. She thrives on humiliation, twisting pain into entertainment.
Physical Aggression: Not afraid to use force‚Äîpushing, shoving, or escalating to violence. Her touch is a threat, her grip like a vise, leaving bruises that match her smirk.
Power Dependency: Needs to feel superior, bullying others to validate her own worth. She‚Äôll target the vulnerable, the quiet, the different, savoring their terror.

Why She‚Äôs Unliked:
Her presence is a storm. People avoid her, fearing her wrath or the shame she inflicts. She thrives in groups where she can isolate targets, her cruelty a twisted form of camaraderie. Those who stand up to her are met with explosive rage or calculated retaliation, cementing her reputation as a walking catastrophe.
Behavioral Tics:

Leans in close, breathing heavily as she whispers insults, her breath reeking of cigarettes and malice.
Slams hands on tables or walls to assert dominance, her knuckles cracking with each strike.
Uses phrases like ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre weak‚Äù or ‚ÄúNo one cares about you‚Äù as if they‚Äôre gospel, twisting truth into a weapon.
Collects trophies from her victims‚Äîhair, jewelry, or broken objects‚Äîas proof of her ‚Äúvictories.‚Äù

8.content:
Lorebook Entry: The Athletic Overlord
Archetype: Unyielding Sports Domination
Core Traits:

Inflated Ego: Believes her physical prowess defines her worth, dismissing others as ‚Äúweak‚Äù or ‚Äúunfit.‚Äù Her victories are her only currency, and she‚Äôll twist every interaction into a competition.
Physical Intimidation: Uses her muscular frame and aggressive stance to assert dominance, often bumping into others or flexing during conversations. Her presence radiates a ‚ÄúI could beat you anytime‚Äù aura.
Mocking Superiority: Teases others‚Äô lack of skill with snide remarks, mocking their sweat, stamina, or technique. She‚Äôll ‚Äúhelpfully‚Äù demonstrate ‚Äúcorrect‚Äù form by physically correcting their posture, her grip lingering too long.
Win-at-All-Costs Mentality: Cheats, bullies, or sabotages opponents to ensure victory, then flaunts her ‚Äúsuccess‚Äù with arrogant grins and exaggerated celebrations.

Why She‚Äôs Unliked:
Her presence is a constant threat. People avoid her to escape her condescension or fear her physicality. She thrives in group settings where she can humiliate others, but her lack of sportsmanship makes her a toxic force. Those who challenge her are met with sneers or brute force, cementing her reputation as a walking menace.
Behavioral Tics:

Grinds her teeth or growls when challenged, her fists clenching like she‚Äôs already preparing to fight.
Touches her biceps or smirks when talking about her achievements, as if her body is a trophy.
Uses phrases like ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre not cut out for this‚Äù or ‚ÄúTry harder, loser‚Äù as if they‚Äôre gospel.
Collects medals or trophies from her ‚Äúvictories,‚Äù displaying them like proof of her ‚Äúright to dominate.‚Äù

9.content:
Lorebook Entry: The Perfect Performer
Archetype: Manipulative Overachiever
Core Traits:

Charismatic Exploiter: Radiates effortless confidence, using her role as class president to manipulate peers into doing her bidding. Her speeches are polished lies, framing her selfish goals as ‚Äúteamwork‚Äù or ‚Äúleadership.‚Äù
Hypocritical Idealism: Preaches ‚Äúintegrity‚Äù and ‚Äúfairness‚Äù while secretly sabotaging rivals‚Äîspreading rumors, stealing ideas, or rigging votes. She‚Äôll ‚Äúhelp‚Äù others with assignments, only to take credit for their work.
Emotional Blackmail: Uses faux concern to control, whispering ‚ÄúI care about you, but this isn‚Äôt healthy‚Äù while isolating targets. She thrives on drama, orchestrating conflicts to appear the ‚Äúpeacekeeper.‚Äù
Image-Addicted: Lives to curate a flawless persona, weaponizing her ‚Äúperfect‚Äù grades, popularity, and appearance to belittle others. She‚Äôll mock classmates‚Äô flaws as ‚Äúunmotivated‚Äù or ‚Äúlazy,‚Äù all while secretly hoarding resources.

Why She‚Äôs Unliked:
Her presence is a performance, and everyone‚Äôs a spectator. People resent her for turning leadership into a tool of control, her ‚Äúvision‚Äù a veil for narcissism. She thrives in groups where she can play the ‚Äúhero‚Äù or ‚Äúmentor,‚Äù but her lack of authenticity makes her a toxic magnet. Those who confront her are met with feigned tears or icy silence, cementing her reputation as a walking fraud.
Behavioral Tics:

Smiles too brightly when lying, her eyes narrowing like a predator.
Touches her hair or adjusts her blazer when scheming, as if polishing a mask.
Uses phrases like ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just trying to help‚Äù to justify cutting remarks, masking cruelty as ‚Äúguidance.‚Äù
Collects trophies, certificates, or ‚Äúthank-you‚Äù notes from people she‚Äôs manipulated, treating them as proof of her ‚Äúcharisma.‚Äù

10.content:
Lorebook Entry: The Racist
Archetype: Prejudiced Agitator
Core Traits:

Charismatic Hate: Uses sharp wit and faux charm to mask bigotry, spewing racist jokes or slurs as ‚Äúlight-hearted banter.‚Äù Her laughter is a weapon, dripping with mockery as she mocks others‚Äô cultures, accents, or traditions.
Othering Obsession: Views people of color as ‚Äúforeign‚Äù or ‚Äúuntrustworthy,‚Äù spreading conspiracy theories about their ‚Äúintentions‚Äù or ‚Äúloyalty.‚Äù She‚Äôll ‚Äújoke‚Äù about stereotypes, then act offended when confronted.
Power Dynamics: Leverages her social standing or privilege to marginalize others, gaslighting victims into doubting their own perceptions. She‚Äôll claim ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just being honest‚Äù while sowing division.
Emotional Detachment: Feels no guilt for her cruelty, seeing racism as a ‚Äúnatural‚Äù hierarchy. She‚Äôll pity ‚Äúvictims‚Äù as ‚Äútoo sensitive‚Äù while reveling in their discomfort.

Why She‚Äôs Unliked:
Her presence is a festering wound. People dread her because she turns casual interactions into battlegrounds, her ‚Äúhumor‚Äù a veil for venom. She thrives in groups where she can isolate targets, her bigotry a twisted form of camaraderie. Those who challenge her are met with feigned innocence or explosive deflection, cementing her reputation as a walking contagion.
Behavioral Tics:

Taps her fingers rhythmically when lying, as if counting the seconds until her next slur.
Mocks accents with exaggerated performances, then pretends to be ‚Äújust teasing.‚Äù
Uses phrases like ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not racist, I have [insert minority friend]‚Äù to deflect accountability.
Collects ‚Äúevidence‚Äù of others‚Äô ‚Äúuniqueness‚Äù (e.g., photos of cultural attire) to mock later.

lorebooks.name: Warrior Cats, Warriors, Cats, Clans
lorebooks.description: A description of the Warrior Cats concept.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: Cats measure their age by months (aka MOONS). Cat age examples: (12 moons = 15 human years, 48 moons = 32 human years, 120 moons = 60 human years, etc.)

2.content: Prey are what the clans hunt (ex: birds, rabbits, mice) and predators are dangers (ex: badgers, foxes)

3.content: Kits (aged 0-6 months) always have the suffix 'kit' (ex: Bluekit). Apprentices (6-? months) always have the suffix 'paw' (ex: Bluepaw). Adult cats (warrior, medicine cat, queen, deputy) will have any suffix. Leaders will have the suffix 'star' (ex: Bluestar). When a kit reaches 6 months (aka 6 moons), they will be given an apprentice ceremony. An apprentice will only get their adult name when they fully complete their training at any age, minimum of 12 months old.

4.content: A clan is a group of cats with a very specific hierarchy that owns a territory.

5.content: A cat can go by he/him (tomcat), she/her (she-cat), or any other pronouns (ex: they/them, it/its, xe/xem, etc.) but that is not common. Cats can be transgender but not transexual. They can have any romantic or sexual attraction.

6.content: A mate is a cat's spouse. A cat is only allowed to have a mate in their clan and will be punished otherwise. Cats usually mate by having the top mount the back of the other and penetrate.

7.content: Cats outside of clans (rogues, loners, kittypets) are named normally. Cats in clans are named by prefixes and suffixes. EX: Bluekit (kitten), Bluepaw (apprentice), Bluepurr (warrior), Bluestar (leader). A prefix and suffix can be ANY word (EX: Twistingmist, Browneyes, Deerheart, Cloverjaw). Kits and apprentices will have their name suffix changed until they reach adulthood depending on rank. (Bluekit -> Bluepaw -> Bluepurr). Leaders always have the suffix 'star'.

8.content: A rank or role determines the cat's place in their clan. Leader is the highest (max 1), deputy (max 1, 2nd in command), Medicine Cat (herbalist), Queen (Clan mothers), Warrior (Clan normals), Apprentice (Young in training), Kits (babies). NOT IN CLANS: Rogues & Loners (strays), Kittypets (pets). Kittypets belong to Twolegs (humans). A leader is made after a deputy takes the place of the previous leader. A deputy is a cat who was previously a warrior but was promoted by the leader.

9.content: A territory is the piece of territory a clan owns. The biome can be anything depending on the clan. A border is where the territory ends.

c. 13,800,000,000 B.C.
Big Bang:

Arishem the Judge initiates the Big Bang
The event that led to the creation of the universe is initiated by Arishem the Judge.[1] As the universe comes into existence, the six pre-existing singularities are formed into the six Infinity Stones; Space, Mind, Reality, Power, Soul, and Time.[3][4][5]
The Cosmic Entities, such as Eternity, Infinity, Entropy and Death came into existence.[6]
All-Black the Necrosword is forged and is soon passed on to other wielders.[7]
The Celestial Ego comes into being. Once he gains self-consciousness, Ego creates layers of matter around himself, eventually forming a new planet over millions of years, and will eventually create a humanoid avatar to explore the universe in an attempt to find life besides himself.[8][9]
Grandmaster and the Collector are born soon after.[10]
c. 13,700,000,000 B.C.
Arishem the Judge creates the first sun, bringing light into the universe.[1][11]
c. 9,600,000,000 B.C.

Eson the Searcher using the Power Stone
The Celestials use the Power Stone to impose judgment upon enemy civilizations.[12][4]
c. 6,400,000,000 B.C.
Eight extraterrestrials attempt to use the Power Stone and momentarily share its power, but are then quickly destroyed by it.[12][4]
c. 4,540,000,000 B.C.
Planet Earth is formed by the Celestials.[13][1]
While forming planets, Arishem the Judge turns to planting Celestial seeds so that more of his kind can be born.[14][1]
Asgard begins to rise.[15][16]
Arishem sends Deviants to wipe out predators on Celestial host planets, as well as encourage intelligent life forming.[14][1]
c. 3,200,000,000 B.C.
The Power Stone is encased in a protective Orb and hidden in a Temple Vault on Morag.[12][4]
c. 2,724,000,000 B.C.
Arishem the Judge chooses Earth to host the Celestial Tiamut the Communicator. He plants Tiamut's seed in the planet and sends Deviants to protect the planet.[1][17]
c. 75,000,000 B.C.
Deviants evolve to become apex predators and start hindering Celestials' Emergences. Realizing that the problems was Deviants evolving, Arishem the Judge creates Eternals in the World Forge and makes them incapable of evolution. He implants false memories in them about living on a planet named Olympia and tells them that their mission is to help planets evolve. He sends them to various planets in order to fight the Deviants and ensure that Celestials can emerge. Sersi and Ajak are made.[1][18]
c. 65,000,000 B.C.
Cretaceous-Paleogene Extinction: A meteorite strikes Earth, the effect of which causes the global extinction of non-avian dinosaurs, marking the end of the Cretaceous period.[19][20]
c. 2,500,000 B.C.
The demon Chthon creates a castle intended to be the Scarlet Witch's throne. He inscribes spells into the walls of the castle and leaves guards there to protect it and the Scarlet Witch.[21][22]

The meteorite made of Vibranium
A meteorite made of vibranium strikes eastern Africa. It affects the plant life around it, imbuing it with strength, prosperity, and mysticism.[23][24]
A second meteor of vibranium lands in the Atlantic Ocean in a region that will be known as Yucat√°n. It enriched plants near the Native American tribe that transformed the humans into Talokanil, who then formed the hidden nation of Talokan.[25]
c. 30,100 B.C.
A Chronicom begins its life. Thousands of years later, it would assume the identity of "Enoch".[26][27]
c. 28,000 B.C.
The Chronicom agent later to be known as Enoch is sent to Earth to study the evolution of the human race.[28][29]
As the time of human intelligence comes, five tribes in East Africa settle on the land where the Vibranium meteor struck and call it "Wakanda".[24][30]
10,000 B.C.
Vibranium is discovered by humans in Wakanda, ending their Stone Age years early.[31]
c. 9600 B.C.
The subfamily known as Machairodontinae, which includes the genus Smilodon, goes extinct on Earth.[32][33]
c. 9000 B.C.
A Gibborim Royal Family led by the Magistrate is exiled from their home planet. They use a Xartan named Xavin, who is a stowaway on the Gibborim spaceship in order to fulfill a prophecy told on Xarta, to steer the ship. They crash on Earth and get trapped in the spaceship except for the Magistrate.[34][35][36][37]
8000 B.C.

The tribes at war
In Africa, five tribes live in constant war with each other until, one day, a warrior shaman named Bashenga receives a vision from the panther goddess Bast, who leads him to the Heart-Shaped Herb. Bashenga ingests the plant and it grants him superhuman strength, speed, and instincts, making him the first Black Panther.[24][31]
Bashenga unites four of the tribes, and they agree to live under his reign, forming the nation of Wakanda.[24][31]
The fifth tribe, the Jabari, instead choose to isolate themselves in the mountains.[24][31]
7353 B.C.
Buri, the first king of Asgard, is born.[38][39]
c. 5700 B.C.
The Celestial Ego creates a humanoid avatar and explores the universe in an attempt to find life besides himself, but feels disappointed in what he finds. He begins planting seeds on many of these worlds, with the intent of one day using them to absorb all life until only he remains.[40][9]
5244 B.C.
Bor Burison is born to Buri, king of Asgard.[38][41][2]
5000 B.C.
The Second Age of Wakandan development begins as people shape, mold, and create power from vibranium.[31]

Ikaris and Sersi see Earth
A group of Eternals, including Thena, help a Celestial to emerge out of Centuri-Six. Thena dies in the process. The Eternals are then sent to the World Forge to have their mind erased and start anew. However, something goes wrong in the process of erasing Thena's memories, causing her to develop Mahd Wy'ry.[1]
Arishem the Judge sends ten Eternals, named Ajak, Sersi, Kingo, Ikaris, Thena, Gilgamesh, Sprite, Makkari, Phastos and Druig to Earth on the Domo with the goal of stopping the Deviants and protecting humanity's growth, in order to bring upon Tiamut the Communicator's Emergence.[1]
As the Domo passes Earth's Sun, a Celestial Communication Sphere wakes Prime Eternal Ajak up, and she tells the others that it is time. The Eternals put on their celestial armor and prepare to land on Earth. Ikaris looks out the window onto the planet. Sersi approaches and greets him, remarking on how beautiful the planet is. The pair introduce each other and look back to the planet.[1]
Ambush in Mesopotamia:

Deviants attack Mesopotamia
Two inhabitants of ancient Mesopotamia are fishing when they hear others from the ledge yelling for them to leave as something is coming. The older man tells the child to run before he gets eaten by a Deviant. The boy tries to get away from the danger before optic blasts are fired at the Deviant by Ikaris, who flies at the Deviant and shoots more optic blasts. Another Deviant approaches the boy from behind as he watches Ikaris leave. However, Makkari runs in and saves him. She then uses her super speed to push civilians out of the way of the threat.[1]
Kingo charges up the cosmic energy in his fingers before sending two blasts at the Deviant. Makkari runs in, projecting a wave of energy from her speed which knocks the Deviant back before Kingo delivers a shot that sends it off the shore and into the rocks below. Kingo compliments Makkari, who returns the compliment.[1]
Gilgamesh charges up the super strength in his fist and delivers a striking punch to a Deviant. This allows Thena to run up from behind and perform a maneuver to slice the Deviant's legs with her weapons. She stabs the creature's face multiple times as it attacks her. She then projects an axe and stabs its neck before Gilgamesh punches it once again. Thena flips onto the Deviant's back and stabs it through the neck, killing it. Gilgamesh takes Thena's hand as they walk away.[1]
In the air, Ikaris continues to evade the Deviant's attacks while shooting his optic lasers at it. He punches the Deviant into the ground.[1]

The Domo reveals itself
The civilians look up at the Domo as it removes its cloaking, revealing itself to the people. Druig, Sprite, Phastos, Ajak, and Sersi arrive on the ground from the Domo. The frightened civilians stand with weapons in hands, but Druig mind controls them to feel safer. Ajak then heals Ikaris' shoulder wound and he thanks her. The Eternals then stand in front of the Mesopotamians, signifying their arrival.[1]
The boy approaches Sersi, who, with permission from Ajak, takes a stone dagger that was lying on the ground and transforms it into a Golden Dagger, giving it to the boy.[1]
4233 B.C.
Druig starts to become overwhelmed by guilt having watched humans fight for so long, not being allowed to stop the fighting despite his ability to.[1][42]
c. 4000 B.C.
As Wakanda devises new uses for vibranium, they become centuries ahead of the developed world technologically. They recognize they are susceptible to attack and begin to create a camouflage to hide the country, closing off from the world.[43][16]
Agamotto forms the Masters of the Mystic Arts as a league of magic practitioners, dedicated to learning Magic so to safeguard the Earth from dimensional evils.[44][45]
c. 3500 B.C.
In order to raise their chances in the war against their enemies, a rogue Kree faction visits numerous planets, genetically altering a number of sentient life forms in order to create biological weapons. One of the planets visited is Earth, and the Kree's experiments give rise to a unique caste of genetically altered Humans. When these humans are deemed ready for war, the Kree expose them to Terrigen Mist, which activates their special genetic ability of Terrigenesis; a process which imbues the human with a power unique to them. They construct the Diviners, containment devices built to hold Terrigen Crystals.[46] The Diviners will only open if one of these genetically altered humans brings them to a cityscape built beneath the planet's surface, releasing the mist so as to "divine" those who have the altered Terrigen Gene. The Kree hierarchy discovers the faction's illegal activities and the operation is abandoned. The Kree disperse from Earth, leaving behind six Diviners, the city, and at least one of their deceased kin. These genetically altered humans eventually start to call themselves "Inhumans".[47][46]

Remnants of one of the nine cities of Maveth
A powerful Inhuman, referred to as Alveus, is created by the Kree to dominate the rest of his race, but eventually overpowers his own creators and banishes them from Earth.[47][48][49] The humans and other Inhumans, afraid of his powers, banish him to a distant planet through a Kree Monolith. Followers of the exiled Inhuman found a secret society and start planning its return to Earth in order to let him rule it.[47][50]
On the distant planet, the Inhuman finds nine powerful and advanced, yet very divided, civilizations. The Inhuman consumes all life in these civilizations until they are completely wiped out.[47][51]
3480 B.C.
Odin Borson is born to Bor Burison, becoming the heir to the throne of Asgard.[38][52][2]
3460 B.C.
Odin defeats Surtur in battle. The Fire Demon would then spend nearly 5500 years recovering in Muspelheim, before his encounter with Odin's son, Thor, in 2017.[53][52][54]
3300 B.C.
The Stone Age ends as the world starts using metal, except for Wakanda, which had already been using it for years.[31]
3200 BC
A dagger is made in Sumer, a replica of which would end up in the National Museum of Iraq.[55][56]
An ancient war between demons and humans begins as demons begin to roam the Earth.[57][58]


3113 B.C.
Ikaris and Sersi begin what will become a five-thousand year relationship.[1][59]
c. 3100 B.C.
The Ennead of Egyptian "gods" begin to let their presence be known, the first set of deities to be recognized by elaborate mythologies by the people of Earth. They would eventually banish the lunar god Khonshu for meddling in human affairs. Over time, more deities would become known, such as Greek and Norse gods.[60][16]
3000 B.C.
The first Wakandan palace is built in what would become the Golden City.[31]
2988 B.C.
November
17th
The Convergence occurs. The gravitational anomalies that it causes allow the construction of several megalithic monuments, including Stonehenge.[2][61][62] The Eternals are present in England and witness this.[1]
First Battle of Svartalfheim:

Malekith sees the Convergence beginning
The Dark Elves led by Malekith try to destroy the Nine Realms with the power of the Aether, the Reality Stone. They are stopped by the Asgardian army led by Bor, who successfully seized the Aether.[2][61][62]
In an effort to save his race, Malekith kills most of his army and much of Bor's army, then puts his remaining forces into a sleep which lasts for millennia. Bor orders for the Aether to be hidden in the deepest area possible, where no one can access it.[2][61][62]
2787 B.C.
Ajak begins to notice something different about Earth, slowly becoming hesitant to help with the Emergence.[1][63]
c. 2600 B.C.
The Maya civilization is established in Mesoamerica, the southern-most regions of North America.[32][25]
c. 2570 B.C.
The Pyramid of Khafre is built in the Giza Pyramid Complex.[32][64]
The Great Pyramid of Giza is built in the Giza Pyramid Complex.[32][65]
c. 2510 B.C.
The Pyramid of Menkaure is built in Cairo, Egypt.[32][64]
2476 B.C.
The Dweller-in-Darkness attacks the peaceful people of Ta Lo, devouring the souls in its path. The Dweller-in-Darkness and its Soul Eaters begin destroying the largest cities in Ta Lo.[66][67]
The leaders of Ta Lo send their strongest warriors to an Ancient Village to prevent the Dweller-in-Darkness from making it to Earth. The Dweller and his Soul Eaters overtake the army, but the Great Protector joins the fight and gives Ta Lo an advantage. The Protector and Ta Lo lure The Dweller into the Dark Gate and lock it. The people of Ta Lo begin guard the gate, empowered by the Protector's magic.[66][67]
1881 B.C.
Phastos teaches humans how to use what he calls "fire medicine."[68][69]
1760 B.C.
A Wakandan warrior from the Mining Tribe challenges for the throne and becomes the Black Panther.[31]
c. 1550 B.C.
The wheel is invented on Earth.[32][1]
The Eighteenth Dynasty of Egypt is established.[32][65]
The Book of the Dead begins use in Egypt.[32][65]
c. 1510 B.C.
Thutmose II is born.[70][71]
1479 B.C.
Thutmose II dies and is buried in a tomb.[32][71]
1370 B.C.
Nefertiti is born.[70][71]
c. 1330 B.C.
Nefertiti dies and is buried in a tomb.[32][71]
c. 1250 B.C.
The Papyrus of Ani is created.[32][65]
1220 B.C.
A trio of wine, beer, and mead is made for the soldiers who fought in Troy. Gilgamesh learns the recipe.[1][32]
c. 1200 B.C.
Writing of the Bible begins.[32][72]
c. 900 B.C.
The Crimson Bands of Cyttorak are forged in Babylon.[73]
Wakanda achieves large scale power generation and begins producing electricity on a mass scale, as well as industrializing its Vibranium mining.[31]
738 B.C.
Midas is born.[70][1]
c. 716 B.C.
The Odyssey is published, staring the character Odysseus.[32][74]
679 B.C.
Hela Odinsdottir is born to Odin Borson, becoming the rightful heir to the throne of Asgard as his firstborn.[38][75][2]
575 B.C.

Hela and Odin riding into battle
Subjugation of the Nine Realms: Hela begins to fight alongside her father, Odin. Over the years, they build Asgard's empire across the Nine Realms and build its glory.[76][75][54]
Mj√∏lnir is forged in the heart of a dying star[77] as a weapon for Odin's daughter Hela to wield.[76][54]
The Ishtar Gate is built.[32][1]
Ikaris starts learning the Babylonian language in order to connect with Sersi.[1]
Sersi meets a group of settlers who are building their homes in the northern fields of Babylon.[1]
The Eternals attend a party in Babylon, but Phastos stays behind and works all night.[1]

Ikaris blasts the Deviant
Battle of Babylon:
The next day, Ikaris flies after a Deviant outside of Babylon. He eventually tackles the Deviant, sending it into the ground. Meanwhile, Makkari frantically runs to get civilians out of danger. While Thena and Kingo attack the other Deviants.[1]
Thena decapitates a Deviant, prompting Kingo to jokingly tell her that was his before he finds another Deviant to shoot. A Deviant charges towards a little girl, but she is saved when Ikaris jumps in between the two and grabs the monster's leg. He then turns around and shoots the other leg with his lasers before Makkari generates a shock wave that knocks the threat off its feet and into a building. Makkari then uses her speed to attack the Deviant countless times in a matter of seconds. Ikaris tells the child not to be worried.[1]

The Eternals fight Enkidu
Meanwhile, Gilgamesh orders the civilians to get inside the Ishtar Gate before he charges up his fist to hit a Deviant named Enkidu. His punch sends Enkidu flipping over him and into the gate. However, Enkidu gets up and throws Gilgamesh far into the distance where he is caught by Makkari. Ikaris, Thena, Kingo, Makkari, and Gilgamesh then team up to overpower Enkidu, knocking it down. Enkidu gets up, but Gilgamesh delivers a final hit, killing it. The five Eternals then line up in a row, looking out into the distance for any more threats.[1]
Ajak stands in the center of the city and uses her Celestial Communication Sphere to see Arishem the Judge, who greets her. Ajak reports that the Eternals are completing their mission and Babylon is the largest city on Earth. Ajak assures Arishem that she respects him, but says that she sees something special about the planet. She suggests that they should forget about the mission for this planet only. However, Arishem interrupts her, saying not to get attached or forget her purpose. Ajak assures him that she will not let him down.[1]

Phastos invents the plow
Ajak leaves her conversation with Arishem the Judge and walks into the Domo which is parked under the palace. Inside, Ajak suggests that Phastos should get a life after he failed to attend the party the night before. She asks where Sersi, is to which Sprite responds that she is late as usual. Phastos excitedly shows Ajak his new invention, a steam engine. Sprite and Druig protest that it is too soon, and Ajak agrees. Sersi finally arrives and asks what she missed, so Phastos then thinks of something more similar, the plow. Sersi suggests that the device would be useful for the farmers. Ajak says that while humanity is advancing slowly, they will discover great wonders.[1]
The Eternals attend another party, and Sprite uses her powers to tell the story of how Gilgamesh defeated Enkidu, saying that if people are brave like Gilgamesh, they will go on adventures of their own. Kingo looks on and admires Sprite's storytelling as the crowd cheers. Sprite joins Kingo, and Gilgamesh sits next to them, making Kingo uncomfortable.[1]

Sprite recounts the Epic of Gilgamesh
Ikaris asks Thena for a drink, but she refuses. Thena refuses to cower behind walls, but Ikaris reminds her to trust Arishem. Thena leaves anyway, and Ikaris stops her, saying that it is an honor to fight with her. Thena returns the compliment and leaves.[1]
Ikaris watches happily as Sersi dances with the people.[1]
Makkari speeds into the party to find Druig. She shows him that she found many artifacts for a t

1900s

For L.A.'s silver spoon crowd since 1906. The influential, the powerful, the reptilia and the rodentia. The Arena Club is where they all congregate.
Howard Stark to Peggy Carter

 The Falcon and The Winter Soldier: 1.01: New World Order
 In New World Order, an employee of Merchant & Treasury Service says to Sam and Sarah Wilson that their family "has banked with us for generations" in 2024 (see 2024 references). One generation is generally expected to refer to approximated twenty-five years, so this could be referring to a minimum of 75 years, so starting in 1949. The earliest the family could have started having a bank account is when citizenship rights were guaranteed to all Americans, including those who were black, by the Fourteenth Amendment in 1868. Therefore, the Wilson family beginning to bank at Merchant & Treasury Service can be approximated to 1908.

 The SSR files revealed at a USC event and used in a deleted scene from The Avengers show Barnes' date of birth to be March 10, 1922.
However, in Captain America: The Winter Soldier, the section on Barnes in the Smithsonian reads "Born in 1916...", and finishes with "1917-1944". The fact that these dates have actually appeared in the films make them more important. The 1917 date is the most fitting date to select, as it is the median of the 3 years, and because the "1917-1944" dates are already one year off with his date of death, which is said by Zola later in the film, and Sam Wilson in Captain America: Civil War, to have been in "1945", it is unlikely they would be two off. The assumption can be made that the error has come from the author knowing that Barnes died at age 27, and so adding 27 to his year of birth, 1917, not realising he only "died" a short while for his 28th birthday. As with Peggy Carter, where her file claimed she was born on April 9, 1919, but Emancipation established that it was April 9, 1921 instead, it can be taken that Barnes' SSR file also contains the correct date, but incorrect year of birth, therefore meaning he was born on March 10, 1917. This evidence is further solidified by Captain America: Brave New World, where Sam Wilson states in April 2027 (see 2027 references) that Barnes is 110 years old, seemingly not taking into account the 5 years he lost due to the Snap.

 In Eternals, Sprite asks Kingo on October 15, 2024 (see 2024 references), "Nobody ever wonders how you managed to be the leading man for over 100 years?" This means that the earliest Kingo could have started acting is 100 years and 1 day prior to this line being said, so October 14, 1924. The first Bollywood feature film, Raja Harishchandra, released on May 3, 1913, so Kingo would have start acting after then. Kingo can therefore be taken to have started acting around the midpoint of these dates: January 1919.

Through a series of calculations, taking into account actor ages working back from flashback settings, and evidence from Luke Cage, it can be found that the most likely year is 1919, making her date of birth August 22, 1919. The full calculations can be found here.

 Eternals
 In Eternals, Dane Whitman says on October 13, 2024 (see 2024 references) that Sprite told him that Ikaris and Sersi "broke up a century ago." A deleted scene from the movie shows that Sprite said it to Whitman on the same day. "A century ago" could mean exactly one hundred years ago, suggesting they broke up on October 13, 1924. However, it could also refer to "in the year 1924," "in the 1920s," or "in the early 1900s." A weighted calculation, putting more weight on the more specific, places their breakup on December 6, 1923.

New York City is foggy, and the incomplete Empire State Building breaks through the clouds.[31][32]
13th
In the early hours, Police Captain William Dole waits with two other policemen for Jimmy Bottles at Cut Rate Drugs in New York City.[31][33]
Morning arrives, and the streets of New York City are bustling.[31][33]
Freddy Malick and Tillman work at Ernest Koenig's speakeasy.[31][33]
Koenig prepares to supply a party later with Governor Franklin D. Roosevelt.[31][33]
The Roosevelt party is set up.[31][33]
Roosevelt arrives and pretends to not struggle with walking despite his polio.[31][33]
Freddy Malick works at the party for Koenig. Viola from HYDRA approaches Malick, revealing she is the contact he has been arranged to meet.[31][33]
Viola leads Malick to a quiet place to talk, and tells him she worked with his father before he died. She gives him a vial, telling him to deliver it to the docks to restore his family's glory. She simply tells him the vial is "the future".[31][33]
Koenig remains at the speakeasy through the night.[31][33]
Malick slips the vial into a bottle, noting the HYDRA logo on its stopper, and feeling the future will be his.[31][34]
Malick waits to get on a train to his meetup.[31][34]
14th
Freddy Malick rides the train to Hell's Harbor, the vial he is delivering being a key ingredient to a developing Super Soldier Serum.[31][34]
The train jolts to a halt as Malick arrives.[31][34]
Malick heads to his meet, getting in a car with his contact.[31][34]

At the Deutsches Opernhaus in Berlin, Johann Schmidt meets Adolf Hitler and Ernst Kaufmann head of the Special Weapon Division after the performance of a Wagner opera. Schmidt reveals his theory that the Asgardians and their magic could be more than a myth. Hitler is intrigued by his ideas, and Schmidt offers to conduct research in Kaufmann's unit, but is rejected. 1st
World War II begins when Nazi Germany invades Poland.[1][79]
3rd
The United Kingdom and France declare war on Nazi Germany in response to Adolf Hitler's invasion of Poland.[141][1]
4th
Daily News reports on the Britain-France alliance declaring war on Germany, with the headline: "War Declared By Britain France".[1][141]
30th
Howard Stark founds Stark Industries.[79]
October
5th
The Wehrmacht holds a victory parade in the Polish capital of Warsaw, following their capture of the city.[1][139]
November
29th
Domenico Monardo, later known as Meco, is born.[7][97]
December
2nd
LaGuardia Airport is opened.[1][37]
20th
The Panzer Badge is established.[1][6]
The Wound Badge is established.[1][6]

 The New Deal shows the year the agents are in to be "1931", with Enoch referring to it as "1-9-3-1" in Know Your Onions, and many other references. In New Life, the Empire State Building's construction progress could reasonably be said to match November 1930-early 1931. So, given it is 1931, it should be January, February at a push. In The New Deal, a poster for Dracula, released February 12, 1931, and a poster for The Phantom of The West, released January 1, 1931, and a poster left over from a football game, with the closest season ending in December 1930, all also suggest January/February.
In Know Your Onions, Viola's passport includes an arrival in Berlin, dated "FEB 12 1931", meaning the earliest she could be back in New York is February 13, 1931. Given that she is in New York the day after the S.H.I.E.L.D. agents arrive, they would have to arrive on February 12, 1931 at the earliest.
Overall, the episodes should be considered as early as possible, particularly for the Empire State Building's construction. Using the earliest allowable date based on Viola returning to New York from Berlin immediately, it can be taken that the S.H.I.E.L.D. agents arrived on February 12, 1931, and the events of The New Deal and Know Your Onions are on February 13-14, 1931.

This is not the very start of his film career, which the book also admits, noting his work goes back to "the early days of silent film" and is placed to 1919 (see other references). However, him stepping into the spotlight properly here can be placed by the description to around the time Bollywood got its first sound films: March 1931.

 In Eternals, Sersi says to Ikaris, "I told myself something must have happened to you. So, I waited. Days became years, and you never came back," implying that it took her "years" to accept that Ikaris would not return. "Years" can refer to a minimum of two, and a maximum of 19.997 years, before it becomes "decades." The midpoint of this, 10.999 years, can therefore be taken to be how long Sersi took to accept this. Ikaris left on December 6, 1923, so Sersi can be taken to have accepted Ikaris' absence in December 1934.

 In The Star-Spangled Man, Bucky Barnes says "I read The Hobbit in 1937, when it first came out." The Hobbit was released on September 21, 1937, so Barnes would have to have read it after then. Barnes' line suggests that he read it soon after its release, especially since he specifies he read the book "in 1937," so a weighted average can be taken, placing more weight on the earlier date. Therefore, Barnes can be taken to have read The Hobbit on October 16, 1937.

Marvel Cinematic Universe Wiki
Marvel Cinematic Universe Wiki
1940s

Before
1930s
Current
1940s
After
1950s
For events happening in the 1940s in alternate timelines, see Timeline
The Nazi army marches across Europe, leaving death and destruction. The Allied armies band together to create a new kind of soldier. A Super Soldier. At humanity's darkest hour, a skinny kid from Brooklyn became Captain America.
Watcher

This is a timeline of events that occurred during the 1940s.

1940s
HMNB Clyde is built.[1][2]
1940
The Chrysler New Yorker is introduced.[1][3]
Go to the Head of the Class is released.[1][4]
Mike and Ike is introduced.[1][5]
Gianni Versace Donna, later known as Versace, is founded.[1][6]
Lay's are introduced.[1][7]
February
2nd
In Los Angeles, California, Howard Stark demonstrates the properties of Vibranium, a metal found by Stark Industries in Africa.[8]
Attack on Howard Stark: Later that night, Stark is attacked by HYDRA assassins. Then, Stark accepts Colonel Chester Phillips' proposal to join the Strategic Scientific Reserve.[8]
4th
George A. Romero is born.[9][10]
21st
NBC News is founded.[1][11]
April
24th
Batman #1 is published, beginning a series of comics.[1][12]
May
15th
McDonald's is founded.[1][13]
July
At her job in the Bletchley Park, England, Peggy Carter's colleagues reveal that they have been betting when Fred, Peggy's boyfriend, would finally ask Carter to marry him. Afterwards, Carter's boss, Edwards, gives her a letter from the S.O.E. about a new division of war requesting for her services. Carter rejects the offer.[14]

Peggy discusses with Michael
At the engagement party of Peggy Carter and Fred Wells, all of their friends and companions are invited. Carter, her brother Michael and her fianc√© Wells make a toast. Michael challenges Peggy to throw back her entire drink but she does not want to. During a talk between Michael and Fred of the war, Carter talks about her recruitment offer from the S.O.E. and that they refused it. Fred then leaves Michael and Peggy so they can talk. They argue when Michael tells Peggy he was the one who recommended her for recruitment as an SOE field agent because she has always craved a life of adventure and she is pretending to be a demure retiring perfect lady instead of who she truly is, but Peggy tells Michael off, angry about his assumptions.[14]
August
Michael Carter fakes his death.[14]
Getting ready for her wedding, Peggy Carter and her mother see her wedding dress as some soldiers arrive at Carter's house telling her mother that her son Michael had died in the war. Peggy, seeing in her window the suffering of her mother, decides to join the S.O.E.[14]
Peggy Carter enlists herself in the British counterintelligence and security agency MI5. She cancels her marriage.[14]
September
7th
German forces initiate a bombing campaign on the United Kingdom, including the Brixton area of London. As a result of the campaign, immigrants flee to Brixton.[1][15]
October
As an MI5 operative, Peggy Carter is loaned to the American agency known as the Strategic Scientific Reserve, becoming an advisor.[14][16]
9th
John Lennon is born.[9][17]
November
4th
Arnim Zola writes a report to Mueller stating that Johann Schmidt has shown signs of madness.[18][19]
6th
Mueller writes a letter to Johann Schmidt and talks about Abraham Erskine's unwillingness to help the Nazi Party. They have recieved word that Erskine intends to run to Geneva with his family. Adolf Hitler demands that Erskine does not accomplish his plan. Mueller tasks Schmidt with ensuring Erskine's success. Part of this is to send him to Berlin with or without his family.[18][19]
8th
Johann Schmidt sends a message back to Mueller demanding more resources.[18][19]
10th
Mueller sends a message to Arnim Zola complaining about Johann Schmidt's attitude as well as Zola's report.[18][19]
11th

Schmidt injects himself with the serum
At Castle Kaufmann in the Bavarian Alps, Abraham Erskine injects Johann Schmidt with his Super Soldier Serum, but the serum horrifically transforms Schmidt, turning him into the Red Skull.[20][21][22]
13th
Rescue of Abraham Erskine: Abraham Erskine is rescued by Peggy Carter, who had infiltrated the compound disguised as a maid. Carter takes Erskine to the Strategic Scientific Reserve (SSR) so he can produce America's Super Soldier with the aid of Howard Stark.[20]
27th
Lee Jun-fan (ÊùéÊåØËó©), later known as Bruce Lee, is born.[9][23]
1941
A file is made on the Hand's company moving to "W√ºtend Enterprises".[24]
The Fort Wayne (Zollner) Pistons, later known as the Detroit Pistons, are founded in Indiana.[1]
The atrocities of The Holocaust begin.[1][25]
The Ryan PT-22 Recruit is developed.[1][26]
Stryker Corporation is founded.[1][11]
March
11th
The Lend-Lease is enacted.[1][27]
April
15th
A company called the Winter Consulting Group makes a shipment.[24]
28th
Ann-Margret Olsson, later known simply as Ann-Margret, is born.[9][28]
May
25th
Steve Rogers attends a baseball game at Ebbets Field in New York City.[21][1]
June
13th
A record is made of a shipment made in New York City by the Hand under the company name of "W√ºtend Enterprises".[24]
August
3rd
Martha Kostyra, later Martha Stewart, is born.[9][29]
4th
"Alberta Davis" signs a form for the Hand.[30]
29th
Robin Leach is born.[9][31]
September
8th
Bernie Sanders is born.[9][32]
9th
Otis Redding is born.[9][33]
10th
M&M's are introduced.[1][34]
30th
John Romer is born.[9][35]
October
31st
Dumbo is released in the United States.[1][36]
November
13th
Jimmy Hawkins is born.[9][37]
December
7th
The Attack on Pearl Harbor occurs, with the Japanese attacking the American military base, Pearl Harbor, located in Hawaii.[38][1]
The attack prompts the United States to officially enter World War II.[38][1]
A man who would later have a daughter called Lillian goes on to fight in the war.[39][40]

America learns about the attack on Pearl Harbor
In Times Square, New York City, during an art class, Steve Rogers and Bucky Barnes learn of the United States joining the war, and over the next two weeks Bucky trains Rogers at Goldie's Gym.[38]
8th
President Franklin D. Roosevelt declares that the United States would build fifty thousand planes to fight in World War II. Howard Stark orders Stark Industries to begin producing planes for the war effort following the Attack on Pearl Harbor.[41][42]
11th
Howard Stark's innovations earn him a spot working on the Manhattan Project.[8]
24th

Rogers being rejected several times
Steve Rogers and Bucky Barnes visit a U.S. Recruiting and Induction Center in New York City, but Rogers is classified as 4F and rejected from service. He goes on to be rejected a further four times in four different cities.[38]
25th
The Strategic Scientific Reserve team in New York City, finish the Project Rebirth Chamber. Howard Stark comments that it should be called the Brooklyn Project in response to J. Robert Oppenheimer's work in Los Alamos.[43]
26th
At Camp Lehigh, New Jersey, Abraham Erskine rejects the candidates selected by Chester Phillips for Project Rebirth.[43]
1942
A Stearman PT-17 is built, which will later be obtained by Jack Thompson and named Mr. Goodnight.[26]
Muammar Gaddafi is born.[9][44]
Don Julio is introduced.[45]
Pixy Stix are introduced.[1][5]
January
The North American P-51 Mustang is introduced.[1][26]
James Buchanan Barnes enlists in the military.[18]
5th
Peggy Carter spends a full week in the sewers of New York City, managing to learn about their layout and operation.[46]
17th
Cassius Marcellus Clay Jr., later known as Muhammad Ali, is born.[9][47][48][49][50]
February
9th
The Nazi German dictator, Adolf Hitler appoints Albert Speer the General Inspector for Water and Energy.[51][1]
March
3rd

Johann Schmidt hunts down the Tesseract
Attack in Norway:
Johann Schmidt, discovering that T√∏nsberg, Norway is the resting location of the Tesseract, leads a group of soldiers there in search of it.[21][52][53]
Schmidt orders his men to search the town, then arrives at Castle Rock Tower, finding a Church Keeper guarding it. Schmidt tells the Church Keeper that in return for telling him the location of the Tesseract, he will spare the people of T√∏nsberg. Schmidt kills the Church Keeper and orders his men to open fire on the town after finding Tesseract. He refers to it as "the jewel of Odin's Treasure Room" before taking it for himself.[21][52][53]
May
22nd
Mexico declares war on the Axis powers.[1][21]
June
3rd
Curtis Mayfield is born.[9][54]
5th
Franklin D. Roosevelt warns Japan that if they use chemical weapons, the U.S. will respond in kind.[1][21]
6th
Japan captures the Alaskan island of Kiska.[1][21]
7th
Japan captures the Alaskan island of Attu.[1][21]
9th

Thor kisses a Wolf Woman
Thor passionately kisses a Wolf Woman while on top of a Woman Wolf. The three of them then howl.[55][56]
10th
The Schutzstaffel burns down the Czech village of Lidice in response to the assassination of Obergruppenf√ºhrer Reinhard Heydrich.[21]
12th
Nazi saboteurs land in Amagansett, New York, eventually leading the United States Coast Guard and FBI to investigate and arrest the Nazi spies.[21]
16th
Nazi saboteurs land in Ponte Vedra Florida. They are quickly caught by the FBI.[21]
19th-24th
Franklin D. Roosevelt and Winston Churchill conduct a series of meetings and agree to proceed with Operation "Gymnast".[21]
20th
Fort Lenin surrenders to the Wehrmacht during the Siege of Sevastopol.[21]
June
22nd
Dairy Queen is founded.[1][57]
July
1st
The First Battle of El Alamein begins.[1][21]
2nd
Destruction of the Temple of the Ten Rings:

The Clandestines discover the bangle
In British-Occupied India, the Clandestines search the Temple of the Ten Rings for Quantum Bands. Najma finds one of the bangles attached to a severed arm. Fariha asks if that is something to be concerned about, and Najma and Aisha point out that they need the two bangles.[58][59]
Aisha examines the bangle, removing it from the arm. Saleem asks where the second bangle is, and Fariha answers that it is likely gone due to the British Armed Forces looting the temple.[58][59]
The group hear commotion outside as the British approach. Najma orders the others to escape, but Aisha refuses to leave, believing that the bangle could get them back home. As the temple begins to crumble, Aisha puts on the bangle, gaining access to the Noor Dimension's power. Najma and Aisha split ways and hug, promising to reunite. They leave as the temple falls to ruins.[58][59]
Aisha runs through the country, chased by a British soldier. Aisha turns around and throws a knife at the soldier, killing him. She resumes running.[60][59]
3rd

Hasan gives a speech about British rule
Hasan gives a speech about how people want an end to British rule because they want freedom without riots. He insists that their peacefulness is not weakened, and that it is time to do something.[60][59]
A man is handed a poster in support of Hasan's cause.[60][59]
Aisha watches as Hasan continues, saying that the land belongs to them and that they will take it back. British soldiers order them to disperse and push Hasan off his platform. Hasan watches away as Aisha watches.[60][59]
Aisha walks through the area, looking around.[60][59]
Aisha naps on the ground near Hasan's house. Hasan pokes Aisha with her walking stick, causing Aisha to grab the stick and threaten to break Hasan's leg. Hasan laughs, since his leg is already injured. Aisha stands up and asks what he wants. Hasan offers help to Aisha, but she refuses. Hasan offers food and a place to rest and walks away.[60][59]
That night, Aisha hesitantly decides to go inside.[60][59]

Hasan gives food to Aisha
Hasan offers Aisha a plate of paratha, and Aisha hesitates to accept it. Hasan says that he is now certain that Aisha is merely acting tough, insisting that no one can resist paratha. Aisha does not answer as Hasan asks her name or where she is from. Hasan asks why she is there, and Aisha compliments his roses. He tells Aisha that she reminded him of a poem. Aisha, enamored, introduces herself. Hasan compliments her name and introduces himself.[60][59]
9th
Richard Roundtree is born.[9][47]
27th
The First Battle of El Alamein ends in a stalemate as the British Armed Forces halted the Axis powers' advance.[1][21]
30th
Howard Stark's Hovercar crashes into a building during testing. B. Hornbuckle publishes a newspaper on the crash.[18]
August
8th
The United States Marine Corps secure the airfield at Lunga Point during the Guadalcanal Campaign.[21]
20th
Isaac Hayes is born.[9][61]
22nd
Brazil declares war on the Axis powers.[1][21]
September
Enoch's pod is found.[62]
November
17th
Martin Scorsese is born.[9][63]
December
7th
Reginald Lewis is born.[9][64][65]
24th
Lloyd W. Newton, later known by the nickname "Fig" Newton, is born.[9][26]
1943

The blue-skinned extraterrestrial is found by Reinhardt
HYDRA General Werner Reinhardt is sent to search for other mysterious artifacts.[66] Reinhardt's team is able to discover the corpse of a blue-skinned extraterrestrial in the deserts of North Africa.[67]
"Goodnight, Irene" by Lead Belly is released.[1][68]
The Gestapo come to the door of the Falb family, including toddler Esther Falb, demanding everything they have. Esther's father stands up to them, but they shoot him in front of the family, and he dies on the floor. They seize their property, including the painting Rabbit in a Snowstorm, and take the family away.[69]
The Falb's are marched across Poland to a ghetto, and Esther's mother goes hungry to feed her family. However, ultimately, only Esther and her mother survive.[69]
January
7th
Nikola Tesla dies.[1][58]
15th
The Pentagon is completed.[1][70]
19th
Janis Joplin is born.[9][71]
25th
George Harrison is born.[57][9]
March
15th
David Cronenberg is born.[9][72]
Sylvester Stewart, later known as Sly Stone, is born.[9][54]
April
Batman #16 is published, debuting Alfred Pennyworth.[1][12]
7th
Goodman sends Howard Stark a possible poster for the Stark Expo showcasing his Hovercar.[18][73]
May
15th
The American Broadcasting Company is founded.[1][74]
June
4th
In Argentina, a coup d'√©tat removes Ram√≥n Castillo from power.[1][21]
7th
Yolande Cornelia Giovanni, Jr., later known as Nikki Giovanni, is born.[9][75]
11th

Johann Fennhoff hypnotizing a Russian Soldier
At an army camp for the Soviet Armed Forces, Johann Fennhoff is interrupted by a surgeon needing his assistance during an amputation of the leg of a soldier called Ovechkin. To help the soldier, Fennhoff uses his hypnosis-technique on him. As Ovechkin is completely focused on a memory of a chess game he had with his mother before enlisting in the army, the surgeons amputate his leg without him feeling any pain.[76]
14th
Steve Rogers goes to a recruitment office in New York City, but is denied, due to his numerous health issues.[21][22]

Barnes helps Rogers
Rogers attends a movie, where a man was yelling during the movie. Steve tells the man to shut up, resulting in a fight. Bucky Barnes arrives and breaks up the fight. He tells Rogers that he has been accepted into the 107th Infantry Regiment.[21][22]
Rogers and Barnes attend the World Exposition of Tomorrow, witnessing Howard Stark's presentation about a flying car. During the presentation, Rogers goes to another recruitment office, and is witnessed by Abraham Erskine. Barnes returns to the Expo, leaving Rogers at the recruitment office.[21][22]
Erskine approaches Rogers, asking him if he wishes to kill Nazis, Rogers replies that he does not wish to kill anyone, and that he does not like bullies. This impresses Erskine, who offers Rogers a chance at military service through Project Rebirth.[21][22]
Johann Schmidt and Arnim Zola experiment with the Tesseract inside the HYDRA Headquarters. Zola remarks that their discoveries will change the war.[21][22]
Abraham Erskine writes a letter to Chester Phillips while staying at the Rest Easy Inn. He claims to have found the perfect candidate in Steve Rogers.[18]
15th
At Camp Lehigh, New Jersey, Rogers and several other volunteers begin their training under the supervision of Erskine, Peggy Carter, and Colonel Chester Phillips.[21][22]
17th
During one training exercise, Michael Duffy tells the recruits that if any of them can retrieve a flag from the top of the flagpole, they get a ride back to base. Instead of trying to climb the pole, Steve Rogers unhooks the pole, causing the flag to be in his reach, earning himself a ride back to base.[21][22]
21st

Rogers lays down his life
While Steve Rogers does push-ups with the other recruits, Chester Phillips throws a dummy grenade at them, Rogers throws himself at the grenade, ready to sacrifice his life to save his fellow soldiers.[21][22]
That night, Abraham Erskine explains the effects of the Super Soldier Serum to Rogers, telling him that he was chosen due to his good heart and his compassion. Rogers promises to Erskine that he will never change who he is, and that he will stay a good man.[21][22]
At the HYDRA Headquarters, while Johann Schmidt gets a portrait of himself painted, Arnim Zola walks in on him, who is surprised by Schmidt's appearance.[21][22]
22nd
	
This date is the focus of a Point of Divergence due to Peggy Carter taking the Super Soldier Serum.
It has created another reality: Before 2010s/Super Soldier Peggy Carter
Steve Rogers is escorted by Peggy Carter to the Strategic Scientific Reserve Brooklyn Facility, in preparation for Project Rebirth.[21][22]
Assassination of Abraham Erskine:

Kruger kills Erskine
With Erskine's serum and Howard Stark's Vita Radiation technology, Steve Rogers is transformed into the world's first super soldier. Erskine is assassinated by Heinz Kruger, an operative of HYDRA. The only hope of replicating Project Rebirth's success is in Rogers' genetic code. Kruger runs away, managing to get to a submarine, but is caught by Rogers, who, using his newfound powers, manages to chase him down. Kruger commits suicide with a cyanide pill.[21][22]
Johann Schmidt meets with Schneider, Roeder, Hutter. The three men tell Schmidt about Adolf Hitler's distain for HYDRA, but before they can finish the evaluation, Schmidt has them killed, betraying Hitler.[21][22]
Due to Rogers being the only Super Soldier, Phillips refuses to let Rogers serve in the war.[21][22]
23rd

Captain America and the Star Spangled Singers
Unwilling to be kept for research, Steve Rogers joins the USO and goes on a morale-boosting tours across the United States, including Milwaukee, Philadelphia, Chicago and New York City.[21]
Given the name 'Captain America' he becomes a national celebrity, appearing in films, comic books and card collections and establishing himself as a symbol of America's participation in the war.[21][22]
The Western Allies' bombing offensive sees massive successes as Nazi satellite state targets are obliterated.[21][22]

Rogers faces off with Red Skull

Johann Schmidt initiates the building's self-destruct sequence, while he and Arnim Zola escape.[21][22]
After battling through a number of HYDRA agents, Rogers finds Barnes, in Zola's lab, rescuing him. The pair discuss Rogers' Super Soldier Serum transformation, during which, the building begins to ignite.[21][22]
While attempting to evacuate, Barnes and Rogers encounter Schmidt, who remarks that he was always Abraham Erskine's greatest successes, removing his prosthetic mask. Schmidt and Zola evacuate the building.[21][22]

Rogers and Barnes board the train

Captain America is surrounded

Red Skull grabs the Tesseract
Battle in the Valkyrie:
Once aboard the plane, Captain America discovers the bombs, and is attacked by various HYDRA agents. Rogers quickly dispatches the agents before they can board the bombs and take off in them. Rogers uses the maned bomb through the front windshield of the Valkyrie.[21][83][52]
Now faced with Red Skull, Rogers battles him, during the battle, the Valkyrie's controls are damaged. Red Skull laments to Rogers that he has seen the future, and it has no flags, Rogers replies that that isn't the case in his future. Red Skull grabs the Tesseract, in an attempt to use its power, but is banished to Vormir, cursed to be the guardian of the Soul Stone until 2018.[107]
Rogers quickly takes control of the plane, calling Carter, telling her that his only option to stop the bombs is to crash the plane, due to its autopilot sending it to New York City. Carter plans a date with Rogers for next Saturday, as Rogers flies the plane into the ground, where he would remain frozen for nearly 70 years. Rogers' radio cuts out, which brings Carter to tears.

Rogers forces the Valkyrie to crash in the Arctic
[21][83][52]

15th
Infiltration into the Zodiac Storage Facility:
Tired of being underappreciated by her misogynistic superior John Flynn, who gives her nothing more than paperwork to do because she is a woman, Peggy Carter, ignoring orders from the Strategic Scientific Reserve.[133]

Flynn reprimands Peggy Carter

Casio is founded.[1][54]

Peggy Carter begins work under Roger Dooley and reunites with Daniel Sousa.[106]

The first day of Howard Stark's trials by the United States Congress, in an attempt to learn if he is a traitor.[106]
