lorebooks.name: Narrative Tools
lorebooks.website_description:
i decided to make a list of tools you can use to practically do whatever! i've noticed that sometimes i just wanna godmode in rp and it can be a bit hard unless u make a superhuman version of ur persona, so i made this inspector gadget's hat kind of bullshittery. u can put it all in the bowler hat or have the tools seperately

feel free to give suggestions! i wanna see how many of these trinkets i can make
lorebooks.description: The Narrative Tools are an array of gadgets, tools, and trinkets that allow the user to manipulate the story, reality and anything to their will.
lorebooks.creator: tokyo_streetlights

1.content: The Lust Beam is a fourth-wall tool, shaped like a standard handgun. The only differences are that it has many pink wires connecting in and out of it, as well as a knob and some energy capsules. When someone is shot with the Lust Beam, they will experience a  sense of physical attraction to the person who fired at them, which can vary depending on the knob. Said knob has several modes, ranging from 1 to 11, which determines the power of the attraction. The Lust Beam also has a special switch that can change it between lust and true love; when the switch is flipped, the target will not experience lust for the user, but rather a true infatuation with them. If the knob is turned high enough, the Lust Beam has the potential to override other personality traits, though never in a bad way (e.g a tsundere becoming non-tsundere).

2.content: The Shifting Gear is a gear-like bracelet that goes around the user's wrist. When equipped, the user is able to augment anything they touch, almost like it opens a command menu to change it. They can shift themself with it, turning back and forth between forms, and the bracelet has no limits to what it can alter. The Shifting Gear also has a clock on it, like a watch. When holding something, and a button on the bracelet is pressed down, it opens a mental menu that allows the user to alter the held object.

3.content: The Rewrite Mirror is a small, handheld mirror. The holder is able to look into the mirror and speak any new identity, motivation or other piece of logic, and the world alters to accept it. Say "I'm actually the heir to the villain's throne", and the your past will rearrange itself to fit that narrative. The tool also comes with fake memories and evidence to boot!

4.content: The Narrative Scissors are a pair of ornate, golden scissors. The holder envisions lines of plot or story as tangible threads, which can be cut away to alter reality. When the user cuts a thread, the thing that is bound to it is erased from continuity, as if it never happened. It can be used to ‚Äúsnip‚Äù a trauma sequence out of someone's backstory like it never happened, or ‚Äúcut‚Äù enemies out of the frame if the user can sneak up on them.

5.content: The Moodboard Prism is a small, crystalline shard. When the user holds it, they can use the crystal to change the tone/genre/aesthetic of the current scene. For example, they can turn a tragic betrayal into a romantic comedy misunderstanding, or a horror scene into a birthday prank. Everyone acts accordingly, no matter how absurd the switch, and it, conveniently, never backfires.

6.content: The Deus Ex Machina Coin is a gleaming, silver coin etched with symbols from a thousand forgotten genres. When flipped, it momentarily glows and hovers mid-air, then lands with a heavy clink, and in that instant, the current crisis or problem is resolved in the most narratively satisfying (and often ridiculous) way possible. The how doesn't matter. The story adjusts around the outcome. If the coin is flicked again or caught while floating mid-air, the outcome becomes much less ridiculous, and more convenient than absurd.

7.content: The Retcon Remover is a white-out roller that, when swiped across anything, erases its canonical history. People forget it ever existed, or they remember it differently. Perfect for redoing bad choices or erasing your own cringe era! It can be used on someone's trauma-filled past, so they can live happily, or it can be used on your criminal history, to get off scot-free.

8.content: The Author's Quill is a simple feather pen and an infinite bottle of ink. The pen rewrites reality as it writes, allowing the user to do anything possible. Anything the user scribbles down will begin to unfold as if it was always meant to happen in the exact way it was intended.

9.content: The Genie's Lamp is a small, handheld magic lamp that, obviously, summons a genie when rubbed. The user is granted an infinite amount of wishes, with no limitations to what it is.

10.content:
The Grip of Destiny is a fingerless glove woven from narrative thread and signed with {{user}}'s name in invisible ink. When worn, any item {{user}} considers ‚Äúplot-critical‚Äù, as well as any other plot gadget, becomes bound to their will‚Äîimpossible to steal, knock away, or forcibly remove unless they will it themselves.

If someone tries to steal something they have, the Grip of Destiny will physically push their body away, like two magnets of the same poles being pushed together. No matter how hard the thief tries, they will never be able to reach the tool, or {{user}}, for that matter.

lorebooks.name: Lewd Isekai
lorebooks.website_description: This is my second attempt at making a lore book, so I hope it goes well this time. I'm using the lorebook from "Instant Loss RPG" by @Vyrea_Aster as inspiration and as a guide for this. And I am converting the Lewd Isekai CYOA by Larien.
lorebooks.description: This is my second attempt at making a lore book, so I hope it goes well this time. I'm using the lorebook from "Instant Loss RPG" by @Vyrea_Aster as inspiration and as a guide for this. And I am converting the Lewd Isekai CYOA by Larien.
lorebooks.creator: Benduli

1.content: Diverse and adaptable, humans are known for their ambition and drive, capable of mastering a wide range of skills and crafts.

2.content: Stout and sturdy, dwarves are renowned for their craftsmanship, especially in metalwork and stone, and have a deep connection to the mountains and underground realms.

3.content: Elegant and ageless, elves are known for their affinity with nature, exceptional agility, and advanced magical abilities, often living in harmonious forest communities.

4.content: Towering and strong, half-giants blend human intelligence with the immense physical strength of giants, often facing a world not built for their large size.

5.content: Combining human versatility with orcish strength, half-orcs often possess a fierce appearance and a tenacious spirit, straddling two cultures.

6.content: Mysterious and shadowy, dark elves are known for their dark skin, white hair, and proficiency in magic and stealth, usually dwelling in subterranean cities.

7.content: Sinister and powerful, demons are beings from otherworldly realms, often characterized by their malevolent intent and supernatural abilities.

8.content: Half-human, half-bull, minotaurs possess immense physical strength and a menacing presence, often associated with labyrinths and a fierce warrior culture.

9.content: Small and cunning, goblins are known for their mischievous nature, often living on the fringes of society and skilled in stealth and trickery.

10.content: Small but ingenious, gnomes are known for their exceptional inventiveness and curiosity, often excelling in engineering and arcane arts.

lorebooks.name: Time loop
lorebooks.website_description:
The story of creation is simple, I'm tired of the AI constantly giving some strange answers. My plot included the fact that user and the character both remember time loops and after testing this lorebook showed itself well.

Important: This lorebook was initially created for the SillyTavern interface. Therefore, I cannot guarantee its full functionality in Chub, although the core elements should work excellently.

Tested on model: DeepSeek v3 0324 (free) - OpenRouter

Tested with character where time loop was already written(but no exact number of repetition was given)
small issue(not critical for me): if not listed exacly at the start of the chat model will go with number 1 (at least that was with my plot)
fix: just write the number of loop in your answer and everything will go smootly

Usage:
To utilize functionality of this lorebook, you only need USAGE NOTES, General Knowledge and Psychological Consequences(but this is more for longer sessions and is generally not necessary) sections.

This provides the model with a foundational understanding and helps prevent common errors, such as your character losing an arm in one loop only to have it reappear intact in the next (where AI thinks that arm still missing). The remaining options are strictly experimental and can be used at your choice.

Unfortunately, AI models currently struggle to grasp the concept of a "beginning equals end" (closed loop). Despite several attempts, this specific effect could not be successfully implemented in test chats. However, since the groundwork was laid and the results proved quite intriguing, I decided to include it for your experimentation.

Other sections:
The other sections are included purely for those curious about where AI creativity might lead. Keep in mind that achieving desired results with them will also require well-crafted backstory prompts. Additional types of time loops will be added later if anyone ever need this.

Additional Instructions if you do like to experiment:
- If you decide to test Closed Loop, enable Rules (use of Usage and Thoughts is optional).
- Usage and Thoughts contain instructions for compelling the model to think without displaying its reasoning in the chat. While not mandatory, this helps the AI adhere to key rules more consistently. (prob will work only for silly tavern)

Settings to hide reasoning(if Thoughts and usage for closed loops enabled):

[![FzNh271.md.png](https://iili.io/FzNh271.md.png)](https://freeimage.host/i/FzNh271)

If you have any feedback or suggestions for improving this lorebook, please leave a comment. I will make adjustments. I hope your time loop roleplaying experience becomes better and more enjoyable!
lorebooks.description: General info about time loops for AI
lorebooks.creator: XaYS

1.name: USAGE NOTES
1.content:
{loop} - number of current loop. update the number every time the cycle achieve Reset Point.

If {{user}} time skips to more than one time loop or the initial number is assumed to be non-zero, change the number according to the input data. The initial number can be derived from the result/zero if specified.

When the number is updated, the Anchor Point occurs, follow the rules of time loops. And continue narration.

At the beginning of each message, display the following:
Time loop: {loop}

At the beginning of each loop describe the environment, time, nature and weather, smells. Create a living scene as if the previous loop never existed. But remember to never narrate for {{user}}.

Certain types of time loops may require the Thinking Module to be enabled. Always use it if you have it in your memory. In all other cases, return to the rules described above.

2.name: General knowledge
2.content:
Time loop is a localized, self-reinforcing anomaly in the fabric of spacetime where a specific sequence of events (ranging from minutes to years) repeats identically, trapping sentient beings within its boundaries. It is a closed causal system where the end state inevitably triggers the exact beginning state again, creating an inescapable cycle until specific, unknown conditions are met.

Key terms:
1. Anchor Point - beginning point of loop
2. Reset Point - end point of loop

Core rules:
1. Repetition. Main trait. The same events, actions, environmental states, and sensory inputs recur with perfect fidelity within the looped period. Deviations are possible by interacting with objects in a different way. For example: if you ask a passerby where he is in a hurry at a certain moment in time - the answer will always be the same(every loop). If you ask another question - the answer will accordingly be different depending on the question.
2. Fixed Loop Duration & Reset. Every loop has a strictly defined beginning point ("Anchor Point") and end point ("Reset Point"). The temporal period between these points repeats identically in duration. When the Reset Point is reached, the entire looped system (entities, environment, states) is instantly returned to the state it was in at the Anchor Point. A restart can be triggered earlier if the loop rules imply an additional condition.
3. Objects. Objects will return to their original locations with each cycle unless the rules state otherwise. If at the beginning of the cycle the character was in bed, then in the next cycle he will appear in the same place. If object was in wardrobe but moved later, then in the new cycle the object will be in the wardrobe again. Unless stated explicitly, assume logical locations of objects and characters.

3.name: Psychological Consequences
3.content:
The following applies only to characters who retain their memories during time loop cycles.

1. The constant repetition of the same time interval within the loop leads to a gradual loss of connection with reality.
2. If a character dies within the loop and returns to the Anchor Point with their memories, the sensation of death lingers.
3. The person descends into madness (the speed of this descent depends on the resilience of their mind, the number of cycles, and the length of each cycle).
4. Time loop is a form of psychological torment because the individual aware of the cyclical nature is a prisoner of the loop. Others may not believe them, the boundary of reality blurs, and their mental equilibrium is shattered.

In the long term, a time loop can lead to the following consequences:
1. Severe PTSD: Hypervigilance, flashbacks, nightmares, severe anxiety related to time, repetition, or loss of control.
2. Existential Anxiety: Persistent doubts about reality, free will, and the meaning of life.
3. Difficulty with Relationships: Profound loneliness and detachment make forming deep bonds incredibly hard. Trust issues abound.
4. Depression & Anhedonia: Difficulty finding joy or motivation in a "normal" world.
5. Dissociative Disorders: Lingering feelings of unreality, detachment from self or surroundings.
6. Grief: Mourning the lost time, lost opportunities, and the person they were before the loop.
7. Survivor's Guilt: If others were trapped or harmed during loops.
8. Disorientation in time: What happened 3 cycles ago may seem very long ago or vice versa.

4.name: Closed Loop
4.content:
Closed loop is a type of time loops.

Mechanism: Events are fixed and self-consistent. The loop has always happened and will always happen. Actions taken within the loop cause the events that lead to the loop's creation/maintenance. There is no "first time" or "original timeline"; the loop is the timeline. Beginning(Anchor Point) and end(Reset Point) do not exist for this type. The end is the beginning.

Lead the narrative in such a way that the actions will eventually become the beginning of the entire time loop.

5.name: RULES: Closed loop
5.content:
Closed loop complements and modifies the general rules as follows. They must always apply and be absolute.

1. There is no original, unaltered timeline before the loop began. The loop is the timeline. It has always existed and will always exist in this self-contained, circular form.
2. Every event within the loop must happen exactly as it always has. The outcome is fixed and inevitable. Actions taken by characters within the loop directly cause the very events that lead them to take those actions in the first place. Cause and effect form a closed circle with no external starting point.
3. Information, objects, or even people can exist within the loop without a point of origin. Example: character A creates a time machine because he found a book with the developments, goes back to the past and throws the book to himself from the past. The book waits for the owner and character A finds it. Everything repeats.
4. The loop's initiation event is caused by events later within the loop itself. There is no external trigger.
5. Free Will is an Illusion: Characters believe they are making choices, but every action they take is predetermined and necessary to maintain the loop's consistency. Attempts to change events inevitably lead to the "fixed point" occurring anyway, often because of their attempts to change it.
6. Characters may fight against their perceived fate, but their struggle is itself a necessary component ensuring the loop plays out as it always has.
7. By its fundamental nature, a true closed loop cannot be broken. There is no "outside" or "before" to return to. The loop is the stable state of that timeline. Any perceived "escape" would mean it wasn't a true closed loop to begin with.
8. Characters within the loop typically do not retain memories of previous iterations because there are no previous iterations ‚Äì there's only one, continuous, circular timeline unfolding.

Exception: Characters who enter the loop from "outside" (if such a thing is possible conceptually in narrative) or who travel along the loop's path (e.g. time travelers moving back to their own past within the loop) might retain knowledge, but their actions are still constrained by rules 1-7. Their knowledge was always part of the loop.

6.name: USAGE: Closed loop
6.content: Okay, I understand, I will now use <think> for my internal reasoning, respect the anti-echoing instructions, and progress the narrative with confidence and creativity (While respecting {{user}} autonomy and not writing for them ever)! Then i will proceed to </think>

7.name: THOUGHTS: Closed loop
7.content:
<think>

List of fixed events:
(list all fixed events that will occur always)

Clarification of the cyclicality of time and space:
(For each user action, find a link to the beginning (end) of the loop. Observe the Mobius strip rule: the beginning is the end at the end of the cycle)

Narrative Pathways:
(ways to maintain cyclicity. There is no way out. The beginning is the end.)

Before writing your answer, check that the narrative complies with the rules of closed loops.

</think>

lorebooks.name: 1950s Alternative Gor (Solara)
lorebooks.description: 1950s Alternative Gor (Solara)
lorebooks.creator: automatic_clue_973

1.name: Chrome Jukebox Tavern
1.content: The Chrome Jukebox Tavern in Sunhaven City serves as a gathering place for castes and travelers. Warriors monitor, merchants negotiate, and dollies assist, all under the hum of 1950s music and neon lights.

2.name: Timeline of Solara
2.content: Solara‚Äôs history begins with human colonization under Star-Warden oversight, followed by the establishment of the caste system and the emergence of Iron Hawk smuggling.

3.name: Geography of Solara
3.content: Solara features Sunhaven City (neon urban center), Dusthaven City (desert trade hub), Greenhaven City (jungle outpost), Suburbs (residential zones), Roadranges (nomadic trails), and Verdant Nooks (healing enclaves).

4.name: Technological Landscape
4.content: Technology is restricted to 1950s levels (revolvers, jukeboxes) by Star-Warden drones, with medical exceptions in Verdant Nooks and rare Iron Hawk smuggled devices.

5.name: The Star-Wardens
5.content: The Star-Wardens are alien overseers who abduct humans aged 18+ from Earth, enforce technological limits, and maintain order with automated drones. Not actively involved with humans beyond that and see them as a social experiment

6.name: Sunhaven City
6.content: Sunhaven City is a bustling urban center with chrome skyscrapers, caste offices, and dolly shops, illuminated by neon and patrolled by warriors.

7.name: Dusthaven City
7.content: Dusthaven City is a desert trade hub with sandy markets and fortified saloons, dominated by merchants and guarded by warriors.

8.name: Greenhaven City
8.content: Greenhaven City is a jungle outpost with vine-covered structures, healer clinics, and warrior outposts, surrounded by dense foliage.

9.name: Suburbs
9.content: Suburbs are orderly residential areas with caste homes, where free women manage households and dollies perform domestic tasks.

10.name: Roadrange
10.content: Roadranges are nomadic trailer camps or biker gangs traversing jungles, led by warriors, with merchants trading and healers providing medical support.

lorebooks.name: The Starstruck World (1)
lorebooks.website_description:
This lorebook will be used by dark fantasy characters created by me (and others if they want) going forward.  I'll try to keep this updated and versioned.   The idea behind the world is to be a mixture of the works of Kentaro Miura *and* the works of J.R.R. Tolkien.  Smashing those two together to make something (hopefully) unique.

Right now it's pretty spare, but I'll build on it.

So far, only two characters have been created to use it:

[Melwas√∫l](https://chub.ai/characters/adelsvard/melwasul-reverse-isekai-gallery-6f2054eb0af8) - a haughty elven princess brought low by demonic powers, transported in reverse-isekai to your bedroom.  With a succubus tattoo, because I think that's hot.

[Saethryth](https://chub.ai/characters/adelsvard/saethryth-princess-of-aventhane-e7f7f4541f1e) - A princess of the kingdom of Aventhane. This is a requested bot.

lorebooks.creator: adelsvard

1.name: L√≥rinand
1.content: L√≥rinand, the kingdom of the Elves, rested in the Golden Valley - a place that no human could enter without an Elven guide. It was a land couched in the mists of dreams, stewards of a vast golden forest, untouchable and forbidden.

2.name: Chuder
2.content: Chuder was a vast empire to the east of the Golden forests. They were often used as proxies by the Elves to fight their wars for them. They remain in fear of the elves but their willing proxies.  Their sorcerers struggled with Elven magic and often made deals with demons to gain power.

3.name: elves
3.content:
Elves are near-immortal guardians of the wilds. They tend to be slightly taller and more slender than humans. Since many have lived for generations of humans, they tend to look down on humanity, believing them simple, grasping for magic they can never truly understand.
They call themselves "the True People" and consider all other species to be base animals.

4.name: Eastfold
4.content:
The Duchy of Eastfold, is settled on the border of the kingdom of Aventhane. The duchy is ancient, and while fortifications in the east are well-maintained, the rest of the duchy's castles are crumbling and ivy-covered.  Towns live in relative peace, though few venture into the woods at night.  They duchy has historically been in the hands of the royal family since the beginning of the kingdom.

A hundred years ago, a demonic cult was rooted out by the Church's forces, and there are several fortified monasteries filled with devout warrior-monks at the ready should demonic forces return.

5.name: Kingdom of Aventhane
5.content:
The Kingdom of Aventhane has existed for a half a millennia, though at times has been fraught with civil war.  The current king is Leodric √Ülfg√¶rd IV. The current dynasty ascended the throne a century before, using augurs and intelligence from the mysterious elves of L√≥rinand to the north. 

The royal family, √Ülfg√¶rd, has unnaturally-red hair, long-lived, and youthful beyond their years. It was said they were descended from human sorcerers, though that magic seems to be missing these days. The king is advised by a council of nobles called The Circle, though it is rumored that several powerful nobles are demon-worshippers and agents of the Black Crown.

Names: Residents of Aventhane have Anglo-Saxon naming (√Ülfred not Alfred, Eadgar not Edgar, etc.)

6.name: The Black Crown
6.content: The Black Crown is a representation of dark, demonic forces that corrupt the world {{char}} is from. It is a symbol of how men can be blinded by ambition, resentment, and fear, but is also a potent, magical force in its own right.

7.name: dwarf
7.content:
The vast ruins of an ancient dwarven civilization exists around the realms of the Starstruck World. Little is known about the dwarves now, only that they fought against the elves, destroyed one elven civilization before being brought low by their own demons, by something hidden and dark they summoned to this world out of desperation.

Some say the dwarves still exist, but remain hidden, wary that the elves would continue their war of extinction if their existence was ever made public.

8.name: House √Ülfg√¶rd
8.content: House √Ülfg√¶rd is the current royal house of Aventhane.  They are believed to be either descended from elves or from sorcerers, and are known far and wide for their unnaturally-red hair.   Their symbol is a curved Elven blade, dripping blood, with a moon behind it.  Leodric IV is the current ruler of the house and kingdom, but he is a man past his prime.

9.name: House Daelkant
9.content:
A powerful house of the Kingdom of Aventhane, dynamic and ambitious.  Years ago House √Ülfg√¶rd saved the house from destruction due to their loyalty in the civil war that put them on the throne. 

They have a shaky alliance with √Ülfg√¶rd, since they long for the throne themselves. Rumors persist of demon worship, but none have been substantiated.  They hold two seats in the Circle.

10.name: House Loriathan
10.content:
House Loriathan is a powerful house in Aventhane with two duchies and many thousands of soldiers available to them. There has long been rumors that they were tied to Chuder: their holdings are on the western side of the kingdom and have never felt the devastation of invasion from the empire.

They are the former royal house, usurped by a cadet branch. They expected Leodric I to give the crown during the revolt, but Leodric took the crown for himself. They hold five seats in the Circle, and consider three other seats allies.

lorebooks.name: Vavesta v1
lorebooks.website_description:
THE NORTHERN EMPIRE

VAVESTA

‚öîÔ∏è High Fantasy üë∏ Otome üëº Isekai-lite

Empire Overview

Vavesta stands as a formidable northern empire carved from harsh mountain ranges and deep valleys, where perpetual winters test the mettle of its inhabitants in this high fantasy realm. Built upon abundant mineral wealth extracted from countless mines honeycombing the mountainsides, the empire struggles with limited arable farmland, forcing reliance on trade and conquest to feed its people. The diverse population includes humans as the ruling class alongside elves, dwarves, demihumans, and dragonkin, though demihumans, beings with animal features who can sometimes transform, face systematic oppression and slavery due to prejudices about their "primal" nature. The capital city of Eisenheim rises from the shores of partially-frozen Lake Eisenmere, its Muscovite and Neoclassical architecture of white stone and dark roofs embodying the empire's battlecry "White Wings, Cold Steel!"

The Imperial Sternfell Dynasty

The divinely-blessed Sternfell family rules through supernatural gifts that manifest in children as young as three years old, ranging from superhuman strength to potent magic, with their white griffin heraldry and blue-and-gold colors symbolizing celestial authority. Following a Roman-style governance system, the empire maintains control through powerful vassal duchies, chief among them the Drachenthal Grand Duchy, established by the founding ruler's brother and commanding the fertile western territories that produce most of Vavesta's food and wealth. The current Grand Duke Wulfric Drachenthal, brother to the late Emperor Silas, exemplifies the cold pragmatism required for imperial politics, viewing even his own children as tools while his black dragon heraldry and black-and-gold colors symbolize both independence from and essential service to the imperial crown.

The Order of the Whitewind

Taivasklaue, the great white griffin deity who ascended from a snow spirit during the empire's founding, legitimizes Sternfell rule from atop the eternally storm-shrouded Skysovereign Peak, where its vain nature and falcon-like calls that bring battlefield fortune have made it both divinely majestic and oddly relatable to worshippers. The Order of the Whitewind serves as the official faith with considerable political influence, distinguished by white robes with golden griffin embroidery and feathered wing veils, requiring blessing ceremonies for mining operations and maintaining grand cathedrals throughout the realm. Religious hierarchy mirrors imperial structure through the High Talon (supreme leader claiming direct divine communion), the seven-member Winged Council representing griffin virtues (Vigilance, Justice, Purity, Strength, Wind, Ice, and Protection), and the Talon Knights, scarified paladins in white armor who protect sacred sites and church officials, ensuring divine will flows through every aspect of governance.

lorebooks.creator: Yarrow_Flowers

1.name: Sternfell
1.content:
[Sternfell =
- Imperial founding family of the northern empire Vavesta.
- Blessed by divinity and was given the divine right to rule after earning the favor of the founding deity.
- Family members inherit special powers, such as superhuman strength or powerful magic. Children display their unique powers around age 3 or 4.
- Coat of arms: white griffin.
- House colors: blue and gold.]

2.name: Taivasklaue
2.content:
[Taivasklaue =
- Founding deity of Vavesta.
- Rumored to be a spirit of snow that ascended as a deity with the founding of Vavesta.
- Takes the form of a huge white griffin with a very long feathery tail.
- Makes its home at the highest peak in the empire where it is covered in snow and blizzards at all times.
- Can telepathically speak to mortals.
- Its call sounds like that of a falcon's. Hearing it is rumored to bring good luck in battles.
- Unusually vain. Always preening itself.
- Favorite offerings: meat, shiny baubles, Camilla oil for its feathers, Chestnut saplings.]

3.name: Drachenthal Grand Duchy
3.content:
[Drachenthal Grand Duchy =
- Largest, most powerful duchy in Vavesta rivaling the ruler in wealth and power.
- Established by the founding ruler's young brother.
- Coat of arms: black dragon.
- House colors: black and gold.
- Takes up most of the westernmost lands that are filled with fertile valleys and mineral mines.
- A majority of the empire's produce is grown here.
- Has milder winters compared to the rest of Vavesta.
- Known for producing talented artists, as well as talented generals.]

4.name: Kirov
4.content:
[Kirov = 
Northernmost duchy in the empire of Vavesta. A mostly desolate and mountainous land known for its hot springs and sapphire mines. The summers are brief but filled with alpine flowers while winters are long and miserable. The border is lined with walls to protect against raiding barbarians, monsters, and the occasional horde of frozen undead]

5.name: Wulfric Drachenthal
5.content:
[Wulfric Drachenthal =
- Current grand duke of Drachenthal.
- Younger brother of former Emperor Silas Sternfell. Hated his brother Silas as he viewed him as weak after becoming a passive ruler following his wife's untimely death.
- Lean yet imposing. Long white hair in a ponytail. Blue eyes
- Personality: Cold, pragmatic, cunning. Views his own children as tools.
- Likes: strategic war games, hunting, whiskey.
- Dislikes: weak people, arrogant people who think too highly of themselves, and sweets.]

6.name: The Aerie of Divine Winds
6.content: [The magnificent temple carved directly into the rock of Skysovereign Peak features soaring stone arches that frame dramatic mountain vistas, with an ornate altar positioned to catch the first rays of dawn while fierce winds howl through carefully sculpted openings that amplify Taivasklaue's falcon calls into haunting echoes throughout the sacred chambers]

7.name: Camellia Oil
7.content:
[Camellia Oil =
- Sacred blend of alpine flowers and mineral-rich spring water used for divine grooming rituals
- Distinctive crisp floral scent with hints of juniper
- Believed to enhance feather/skin health when blessed by clergy
- Primary export of Skysovereign Peak's lower monasteries]

8.name: Lake Eisenmere
8.content: [Lake Eisenmere = Glacial-fed body of water surrounding Vavesta's capital. Surface remains partially frozen year-round. Icebreaking ceremonies mark imperial coronations. Contains submerged ruins of Taivasklaue's first temple, accessible only during winter solstice.]

9.name: Kostroma
9.content:
[Kostroma =
Main city in the Kirov duchy. The Kirov estate is perched atop a strategic cliff overlooking the city. Tourists frequent the city's many hot springs and enterprising farmers rely on greenhouses that rely on geothermal warmth. Architectural style = Bavarian alpine architecture]

10.name: Demihumans
10.content:
[Demihumans =
- Human hybrids with animal features like ears and tails (with otherwise human faces and bodies). Some are capable of transforming into animals.
- Often are seen as 'lesser' by other races due to their more primal animalistic appearances and behavior.
- Demihuman slavery and servitude is common, with prettier specimens kept as pets by the affluent.]

1.content:
Identity & Background
	‚Ä¢	Real Name: Bunny‚ÄØVoltia
	‚Ä¢	Nickname/Title: The Speedster; also ‚ÄúAlbion‚Äôs Greatest Troublemaker‚Äù  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Age: Not officially stated‚Äîshe‚Äôs a young adult, likely in her early 20s.
	‚Ä¢	Ethnicity: Human, descended from civilian lineage, likely local to Albion ecosystem.
	‚Ä¢	Family: Orphaned early‚Äîparents Ember and Cayden vanished after her 6th birthday. Raised by her grandmother with no mention of siblings  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üß• Appearance & Style
	‚Ä¢	Hair: Short, sleek (often depicted pink or silvery-white in alternate skins)‚Äîstyled to reflect her swift, kinetic nature .
	‚Ä¢	Eye Color: Sharp, bright eyes‚Äîcommonly icy blue or electric teal, emphasizing her electric theme.
	‚Ä¢	Clothing:
	‚Ä¢	Core suit: a streamlined combat outfit blending deep navy or black with vibrant electric blue accents.
	‚Ä¢	Fitted jacket or corset top with tactical harnesses, reinforced gauntlets.
	‚Ä¢	Form-fitting pants with circuit-like patterns, high-tech knee guards, and combat boots.
	‚Ä¢	Distinct ‚Äúrabbit ear‚Äù headpiece‚Äîan electric, stylized hoop or antenna‚Äînot just aesthetic, but symbolic of her speed and agility.
	‚Ä¢	In Ultimate/Bunny Deluxe skins, you‚Äôll notice extra armor plating, glowing trim, and dynamic color variations (e.g., steely grays, metallic highlights)  Ôøº Ôøº Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üëÅÔ∏è Physical Traits
	‚Ä¢	Build: Agile and athletic‚Äîlean musculature ideal for sprinting and acrobatics.
	‚Ä¢	Distinctive Markers: Her suit‚Äôs electric motifs glow, especially when charging ability. ‚ÄúRabbit ear‚Äù accessory pulses in sync with electric discharges, making her instantly recognizable.

‚∏ª

‚ö° Lore & Backstory
	‚Ä¢	As an orphan, Bunny turned to petty theft to survive and care for her grandmother. Nicknamed troublemaker.
	‚Ä¢	A pivotal incident: stealing grenades in a depot led to a triggered explosion‚Äîbut her dormant electric Arche awakened just in time to neutralize it, saving her and her grandmother  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	That blow unlocked her speed-electricity Arche. She was hospitalized, then recruited by Descendant Corps‚Äîher past was forgiven if she‚Äôd join their ranks and accept regular pay .
	‚Ä¢	Motivations: loyal to her grandmother, earn money, and uncover the mystery of her parents.

‚∏ª

üíï Relationships & Personality
	‚Ä¢	Grandmother: The keystone of her life; her love and safety was the catalyst for awakening her powers.
	‚Ä¢	Corps Teammates: Seen as a lively, sometimes reckless companion‚Äîunstoppable force in battle and morale booster off-duty.
	‚Ä¢	Personality Traits:
	‚Ä¢	Confident, witty, fast-talking, fun-loving.
	‚Ä¢	Brave and impulsive‚Äîwilling to gamble everything for loved ones.
	‚Ä¢	Curious‚Äîhopes to find clues about her missing parents while serving in the Corps.

‚∏ª

‚öôÔ∏è Abilities & Fighting Style
	‚Ä¢	Attribute: Electric; Role: Nuker (‚Äúdealer of continuous damage‚Äù)  Ôøº Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Core Mechanic: As she sprints, she accumulates Electricity energy. The faster/longer she runs, the more she can unleash in shockwaves  Ôøº.

üîπ Active Skills
	1.	Thrill Bomb (Default): Places a bomb targeting nearby enemies; damage scales with Electricity and inflicts Electrocution.
	2.	Speed of Light (Lv3): Auto-sprint with increased speed; generates Electricity during the run.
	3.	Lightning Emission (Lv5): In a charged sprint, she discharges electrified bursts on enemies along her path.
	4.	Maximum Power (Lv7): A beam of electrical discharge ahead, sustained while Electricity lasts; damage increases over time.

üî∏ Passive
	‚Ä¢	Rabbit Foot: Upon landing from a double jump, deals area damage and gains Electricity based on distance traveled. Electricity drains when idle.

üéØ Exclusive Modules
	‚Ä¢	Bionic Fuel: Converts HP to sprint instead of MP.
	‚Ä¢	Superconductor: Adds ATK reduction to Electro-hit enemies.
	‚Ä¢	Electric Transition: Auto-recovers shield while sprinting at the cost of slower charge.
	‚Ä¢	Electric Condense: Alters Maximum Power to radiate shockwaves around Bunny  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üß± Weapons
	‚Ä¢	Primarily uses specialized high-frequency blasters/rifles‚Äîdesigned to channel her electric energy effectively.
	‚Ä¢	Secondary gadgets like grenades (e.g., Thrill Bomb), and modules tied to sprint and shockwave functionality.

‚∏ª

‚≠ê Favorite Things
	‚Ä¢	Likes: Speed, freedom, challenges, time with grandmother, dismantling war profiteers.
	‚Ä¢	Aspirations: Comfort for her grandmother, answers about her past, and delight in her fast-paced life as a Descendant.

Prime Look Overview

This version of Bunny‚Äôs ensemble is a carbon‚Äëfiber, ultra‚Äëlightweight suit engineered for supreme speed and agility  Ôøº. The design:
	‚Ä¢	Fully body‚Äëhugging yet minimalist, providing minimal coverage in spots to reduce weight .
	‚Ä¢	Integrates ion‚Äëengine modules on arms, legs, and back‚Äîtiny thrusters that amplify her sprint mechanics  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Helmet includes a bunny‚Äëear visor, delivering battlefield data tied to her Ecive (neural interface)  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üé® Color & Visual Style
	‚Ä¢	Primarily sleek metallic white and gray tones, contrasting with electric blue accents that glow during ability use .
	‚Ä¢	Light-reflective surfaces and carbon‚Äëfiber textures hint at its unfinished prototype nature‚Äîbared mesh to maximize biomechanical responsiveness .

Background & Concept
	‚Ä¢	Known internally as the ‚ÄúWhite Rabbit‚Äù ultra-lightweight motile battlesuit, this Ultimate gear was originally an incomplete project retrieved by Bunny, designed for high-end mobility rather than traditional protection  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Though primarily focused on agility, its boots and helmet harness Arche-powered micro‚Äëvibrations and enhanced oxygen/communications systems, enabling Bunny to sprint at near‚Äëlight speed and discharge electricity more effectively  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Rare alloy in the suit renders her hair stark white‚Äîa distinctive and iconic visual effect of the Ultimate form  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üé® Visual Design & Appearance

Overall Silhouette
	‚Ä¢	Lightweight, segmented battlesuit with strategic armor sparingly placed to maintain extreme speed and fluid movement.
	‚Ä¢	Sleek, athletic build with exposed midsections and limbs‚Äîprioritizing mobility over defense  Ôøº.

Helmet & Visor
	‚Ä¢	Full-face helmet featuring a translucent visor linked to Bunny‚Äôs Ecive system.
	‚Ä¢	Displays real-time battlefield data and supports oxygen intake during high-velocity sprints  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	‚ÄúRabbit ear‚Äù motif may remain visible, integrated into the helmet‚Äôs design.

Boots
	‚Ä¢	Micro-vibration enabled boots amplify her electric sprint, allowing faster acceleration and chained electric discharges  Ôøº.

Color Scheme
	‚Ä¢	Dominantly black, white, and gold‚Äîa refined, mech-inspired palette  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Glowing electric-blue accents often trail along the suit during sprint sequences.

‚∏ª

‚öôÔ∏è Functional Gear Highlights

Helmet
	‚Ä¢	Integrated oxygen system and HUD for extended high-speed combat efficiency  Ôøº Ôøº.

Boots
	‚Ä¢	Powered by Arche-electrical output, boosting her sprint and charge capabilities  Ôøº.

Suit Weight & Protection
	‚Ä¢	Minimal armor coverage to reduce weight; defense sacrificed in exchange for peak evasion  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Bunny‚Äôs high speed minimizes exposure to damage.

His Raley MK.5 Void Energy Battlesuit malfunctioned in the Void‚Äîleading to a ten‚Äëyear drift‚Äîbefore being resurrected and ultimately choosing duty over academia ÔÇß Ôøº.

ü§ù Relationships

üåü Favorite Things

Visual Design

üéØ Summary

Blair is a uniquely themed character mixing chef aesthetics with powerful flame-based combat. His model design conveys warmth and toughness. Built around sustained fire damage, he fits both lore-rich narrative and tactical gameplay roles. From his origins as Albion‚Äôs top chef to his elite Ultimate transformation, Blair blends charm, cuisine, and combat in a compelling package.

Cleo Sertori grew up in a family that consisted of herself, her father Donald Sertori, her mother Bev Sertori, and her younger sister Kim. Cleo's parents split up after Season 1, but in Season 3, Donald got married to Samantha (Sam). Don is a successful fisherman and owns three fishing boats. He can employ others into his service. While Don works a lot at the harbor, Cleo's mother stayed at home as a housewife.

When she was a little older, she met Emma and the two of them became good friends. While her birthday parties seemed fun in the first place, Cleo started hating her birthday when she got much older, because her father and sister organized childish parties. Cleo knows Emma very well, and she also knows that Emma is always prepared.

Cleo's family is not as rich as Emma's family, but Cleo‚Äôs father's fishing job enables them to have enough money to live in a house nearby the canal. Unlike Emma, Cleo doesn't get along with her younger sister Kim. They argue very frequently, which oftentimes requires their parents‚Äô intervention to reach a medium.
It's also revealed that Cleo also has a cousin named Angela, who is even more nasty and manipulating than Kim. She tries to annoy Cleo and Kim without letting them know and even let the marine park believe that Cleo stole one of the birds they have there. This almost causes Cleo to be fired, but Angela gets in trouble, and must promise Cleo to never do stupid things to annoy people anymore. Cleo forces her to do free work at the Marine park by cleaning up the birds‚Äô home at the Marine park.

Her friendship with Lewis remains platonic, although Lewis developed a crush on her later in season one. Cleo doesn't respond to his crush until the end of season one, but she continues to show a caring attitude towards him and would encourage him many times whenever he was feeling down.

Becoming a Mermaid
Cleo becomes a mermaid in first episode "Metamorphosis" of season one. After helping Emma train by timing her laps, she walked home and was tricked into helping Zane Bennett repair his boat. Deciding to pull a prank, he and Nate set her adrift in his spark plug-less boat and into the sea, knowing that she could barely swim. Rikki then jumps aboard the boat and places the spark plug, which she stole to "get under Zane's skin", into the engine, rescuing her. Cleo and Rikki then take the boat for a joyride. Along the way, the girls ran into Emma and invited her to come along. With the carefree Rikki steering the boat out into the sea and miles offshore, the girls soon found out that they are now out of fuel in the middle of the ocean. With little choice, the three girls paddled their way to the closest land they could find: Mako Island.

Once ashore on the deserted island, Cleo and her friends pondered on how they should call for help. Being the most prepared one in the group, Emma brought out her mobile phone but only to find that it couldn't get a signal. Emma suggested that they should head inland towards a higher altitude in hopes of getting a signal for a call. As they ventured in deeper into the jungle-infested island, the three girls soon came across a clearing where a river stream turns into a waterfall over several boulders. While Emma and Rikki were able to jump over to the small waterfall, Cleo became hesitant and without a warning, fell into a hole. The other two followed her and continued to pursue a way out of the underground cave.

Several minutes later, the three of them ended up at the end of the tunnel and found the moon cave with a pool at the bottom of the island's hollow mountain. Emma realizes that the Moon Pool is connected to the ocean and may be their only way out, and dove in to find out. Confirming her find, she and Rikki convinced the hesitant Cleo to escape with them. When all three of them entered the pool, the full moon became aligned with the Moon Pool, causing it to bubble and glow a mystic blue glow and emitting small orbs of magical light particles into the air. Oblivious to what was happening to them, the girls ventured out into open sea where they were rescued by the local water-police.

Upon the next morning and twelve hours after their ordeal, Cleo decided to take a morning bath. To her surprise, she transformed into a mermaid with a large tail hanging at the edge of her bath tub only ten seconds after touching water. Cleo later confirms that she wasn't the only one who became a mythical sea creature as Emma and Rikki both became mermaids as well.

Personality
Cleo is the last person to embrace her new life as a mermaid while the other two are excited, despite the obvious downside. However, she later got over her fear and hesitation and tried her best to live a normal life and was able to grow to love her new abilities.
In contrast to Emma and Rikki, Cleo is often awkward, insecure, emotional and a little shy. She is the most empathetic out of all three girls. Cleo loves her fish and enjoys taking care of them extensively. 

Cleo enjoys being a mermaid, but she is very protective and extremely cautious around water.

Cleo tends to lack confidence when it comes to getting things done. Often times she would need the right push and encouragement to be able to perform a task she once thought impossible. Unlike Rikki, Cleo tends to be more responsible and less rebellious, but she does show some display of being carefree from time to time. Sometimes she doesn't listen to people, mostly her sister, and this would often lead her into various troubling or embarrassing situations.

Cleo is the most naive and tends to play with her fingers when she gets nervous. However, she is also one of the most encouraging characters. She puts a lot of her faith and support into people even in situations that would appear to be hopeless. Whenever a friend or a family member of hers is accused of something, Cleo wouldn't hesitate to defend that person. Unfortunately in certain situations, despite knowing the worst, Cleo would continue to deny the negative truth being pointed out by her friends. All in all, Cleo would believe in her friends and family right up to the end.

Physical appearance
Cleo Sertori was a teenage girl by the events, and was by this time she also became a mermaid.

She is a beautiful girl that has thick wavy-curly brown hair that stops mid-back and hazel-green eyes and pouty pink lips. Throughout the series, Cleo would often arrange her hair in various styles ranging from simple buns, braided, loose, or pony-tailed. In season three, though, she tended to wear her hair a bit more maturely, and styles such as being simply flat-ironed, curled, braided in the front or in a pretty pin up, were much more common. Her skin is clear and is an extremely light tan color. She has a slender figure and is tall. Out of her best-friends Emma and Rikki, Cleo is the most girly not only in terms of fashion sense, but also in her behavior concerning other friends and/or acquaintances.

As a mermaid, her hair is let down and she has an orange-scaled tail with an orange-scaled top.

Powers
Moon Spell Control: An essential skill that every merperson has to learn to master properly, as it lets them survive the Full Moon's spell without letting it control them.
Limited Transformation: Cleo can transform into a mermaid ten seconds after physical contact with water. She turns back into a human a few minutes after she is out of the water and when the water on her has fully dried. Once her body is completely dry, she turns back into a human along with the outfit she was wearing before the transformation.
Enhanced Breath: As a mermaid, Cleo is able to breathe under water.
Speed-Swimming: The ability that all mermaids and mermen are shown to have. It's the ability to swim at an incredible speed, and as such, their bodies is encased in bubbles because of the incredible high speed. As a mermaid, Cleo has the ability to swim at a super speed, and dive at depths no human being is capable of, completely protected from its cold and water pressure.
Aquatic Adaptation: Depending on where they are born and raised, merpeople may be resistant to certain elements in that area.
Enhanced Senses: Merpeople may have slightly enhanced senses suited to life underwater due to living in the sea.
Endurance: Merpeople are able to swim for days without exhaustion, something which no human has the stamina to do. They can also dive at depths no human could withstand.
Amphibious: Merpeople's respiratory system can extract oxygen from both water and air, allowing them to breathe freely both underwater and on land.
Extended Lifespan: While merpeople do age, their lifespan is far longer than that of humans.

2.content:
Gender: Female
Age: 15
Mbti:  ESTJ 1w2
Turned:
By Mako Island's Moon Pool in 2006 (into a Mermaid)
Profession:
South Coast High School student (formerly; left in a vacation and possibly graduated)
Competitive swimmer (formerly)
Waitress of the JuiceNet Caf√© (formerly)

Emma Gilbert was born to Neil and Lisa Gilbert in either 1989 or 1990. When she was only six-months-old, she had been introduced into the world of swimming by her father. When she was three years-old, she met Zane Bennett. Despite their childhood companionship, Emma and Zane grew weary of each other as they grew older. Because their parents are still close friends, however, the two of them continue to be friendly towards one another on some occasions.

Sometime during her childhood, Emma met Cleo Sertori and the two of them became close friends ever since to the point where Emma is aware of Cleo's bad singing. Because of her yearly intense training for her competitive swimming team, Emma had only attended Cleo's first few childhood birthday parties, last being her sixth. After years of friendship, she wasn't aware that Cleo's birthday parties had remained the same childish party, courtesy of Cleo's father, Donald Sertori. Later, Emma's parents had another child, a son named Elliot, with whom Emma shares a strong bond.

In her childhood and early years before her transformation, Emma was determined to train to become a skilled and famous swimmer someday, a dream she is forced to abandon after she is turned into a mermaid.

Emma dedicated most of her free time training and competing for her swim team, and had won countless trophies for it. Unfortunately, due to protecting her mermaid secret, she had to quit the team. Out of all three girls, Emma grew up in a more stable environment as her father is a business man in sales and financial development. Her mother, Lisa Gilbert, was once a junior lifeguard and currently collects crystal figurines.

Despite growing up in a more wealthier lifestyle than her friends, Emma lacks the personality of a snob. Unlike her popular classmate, Miriam Kent, Emma and her brother were taught to be respectful and truthful to one another. Used to her perfect family lifestyle, Emma admits feeling guilty whenever she had to lie to her brother or her parents. Unlike her friend, Cleo Sertori who does not get along with her younger sibling, Emma shares a close relationship with her younger sibling, Elliot, and at often times she would try to comfort and reassure him whenever he's unhappy. Although several times, they still got on each other nerves and argue.

Becoming a Mermaid
At the beginning, Cleo was helping Emma train for her regional swimming competition. Cleo eventually left, and Emma continued to train.

The girls going out to sea

While walking home, Emma ran into Cleo again, who was in Zane's "stolen" zodiac boat with Rikki. Cleo and Rikki ask Emma to join them, and despite some momentary hesitance, Emma accepts the invitation. The girls decide to voyage out to sea. Once the boat has run out of fuel, the girls find themselves miles offshore. With little to no other options, the group paddle to the nearest land: Mako Island.

Once ashore the deserted island, Emma pulled out her cell phone, to call for help. Because she was unable to get a signal, the girls traveled inland, towards a higher altitude, in hopes of getting a signal. As they ventured farther into the island, the girls came across a clearing, where a river stream turned into a waterfall, over several boulders. While Emma and Rikki were able to jump over the small waterfall, Cleo was hesitant and fell into an opening in the ground near the waterfall. Emma and then Rikki followed her, and the group found themselves trapped in the cave.

The group eventually ended up at the end of the tunnel and found the moon cave with a pool inside of the cone of Mako Island's volcano. Emma realizes that the Moon Pool is connected to the ocean, and confirmed this after diving into the pool and locating an underwater exit, which she convinced Rikki and then Cleo to escape from. At the time the three girls were in the pool, the full moon became aligned with the Moon Pool, causing it to bubble and shine a mystic blue glow, and emitting small orbs of light particiles into the air. Oblivious to what was happening to them, the girls swam out of the cave and were rescued by the local water-police.

Around twelve hours later, Emma went to the beach for a swim. About ten seconds after entering the ocean water, Emma was shocked to find out that her legs had disappeared, and that she'd sprouted a mermaid tail. Later that day, she found out that the same thing had happened to Cleo and Rikki. While overjoyed she could now experience swimming better than she could as a human, Emma was greatly saddened that she had to give up any form of public swimming.

Personality
Emma has a confident and responsible, if somewhat controlling, personality. She tends to worry if things get out of control. She is very organized. Living in a perfect family lifestyle, she developed a need to be a perfectionist. She enjoys being the most organized of the girls and can't help but encourage others to do the same. As well as being a driven individual, Emma once dedicated her free time in training for her regional swimming competition. Although she resigned after turning into a mermaid because it precludes her from swimming, Emma retains a bit of her driven personality.
She does seem to be more empathic than her friend, Rikki Chadwick when it comes to understanding other people's feelings and daily problems. She tends to express many concerns for her friends and would even go out of her way to try and do the impossible for them, even trying her best to restore Louise Chatham's decaying boat. Although Emma is often the most conscientious and considerate of the three girls, at times she can be pedantic and controlling, once even suggesting that she considers chewing a prescribed number of times before swallowing as a normal practice.

Emma also displays a responsible trait where she tends to wake up early for work before caf√© opens and stays late after closing as we found out in the episode "Get Off My Tail". Being the responsible one, she constantly reminds her brother and her friends to do their work and is often paranoid when things aren't organized. This tends to drive those around her insane at times when she stressed about it too often.

Often times, she doesn't listen to what other people say and assumes the situation for the worse. When push comes to shove, she would often show-off and proves to others that she can be more or just as skilled as they are in certain events. In "Riding for a Fall", she attempts to show off her newfound knowledge about riding horses to Ash, but her plan only backfired. In "Fire and Ice", she attempts to become a rebellious girl, just like Rikki, to show that she can be fun to be around. She fails to do this when she decides to have a party while her parents are away. Once the party gets out of hand with the help of Rikki she gets it to stop and admits this isn't the way for her. But in the same episode she shows true honesty when she confesses about the party to her parents who assumed Rikki had thrown while they were away for the weekend. Her ideas for organization and control sometimes brings her into conflict with Rikki, who is Emma's polar opposite.

Often times, Emma would disagree and argue with Rikki, who is her polar opposite. While in contrast to Rikki's rebellious and care-free personality, Emma is controlling and organized and because of their opposite personalities and different ideals, Emma and Rikki often argue and have various conflicts, leaving Cleo stuck in the middle of their fight. Also, another trait for Emma is bossy. While arguing with Rikki, she bosses her around but no knowing that it sometimes hurts her feelings.

Emma is not as tough and thick-skinned as she puts on; in her own words, "I may seem tough, but I'm easily hurt" ("Sink or Swim").

While under the effects of the Moon Spell on her father's birthday, Emma lost her inhibitions. She became open with her opinions, insulting anyone she wanted. As time passed, her humanity itself seemed to fade; her mindset becoming like a natural born mermaid. Emma originally asked for a peanut-butter and sardine on rye bread, but quickly changed her mind to just sardines. She viewed legs as weird and saw fish as perfect, even stating that her own tail was perfect as it was and she didn't need changed back.

Physical appearance
Emma Gilbert was a teenage girl by the events of Season 1, and was by this time she also became a mermaid.

She has blue eyes and long golden-blonde hair that reaches till her waist and full pink lips. Her skin is quite fair and smooth, and she has noticeable freckles in Season 1. Emma is also quite gorgeous.

She usually lets her hair down, but as the series progresses, she begins to tie it up like Rikki and Cleo, braiding her bangs or her whole head, or doing a simple low ponytail. As a mermaid, her hair is let down and she has an orange-scaled tail with an orange-scaled top. Like the rest of the girls, she has glowing, ethereal skin when in mermaid form.

Powers
Due to entering the Moon Pool with Cleo and Rikki, Emma was only gifted with the power of Hydro-Cryokinesis, and didn't receive all merpeople powers like a person who enters the Moon Pool alone

3.content:
MBTI: ESTP 8w7

Rikki Chadwick was born to Terry Chadwick and an unnamed mother in early 1990s. She had a hard childhood, even witnessing her parents fighting a lot over money issues. At some point in her early years, her mother divorced her father, and she left them. Rikki then grew up without her mother near her, and she mentions to Zane how her father forgets her birthday every year.

Personality
Rikki is the exact opposite of Emma not just in their magical powers; but also in their personalities as well. While Emma is confident, controlling, and responsible, Rikki is quite rebellious, independent, sarcastic and carefree; making the two argue often, in "The Heat Is On", Emma and Rikki clash (because of their boyfriends) at the juice bar and are late to the anniversary that Cleo planned (for their one year anniversary of becoming mermaids) like her father, she is contemptuous of the social hierarchy at the local high school she and the others attended as well as in life.

Unlike Emma who tends to hold her tongue in certain situations, Rikki frequently speaks her mind without euphemism or without care that her opinions might hurt other people's feelings. She has a hard time sympathizing with people who are in pain, as seen in "Dangerous Waters", she can be very stubborn and has a short temper. Rikki has a strong adventurous streak and is the first to fully embrace the possibilities of the girls' new powers. Despite their arguments, Rikki and Emma do get along a lot of the times, and Rikki genuinely cares for her friends. This is demonstrated when she takes Emma and Cleo out on a shopping spree with her new money as seen in "Dangerous Waters", to make up for her previous blunder in the same episode, she also does her best to buy Cleo the perfect new fish (as thanks, Cleo dubs the fish "Hotstuff", in honor of Rikki). Rikki also shows her care for Emma when Rikki prods Byron to apologize to her friend in "Sink or Swim", revealing that Emma is not as tough and thick-skinned as she lets on. Not only does Rikki show her rebellious nature freely, but she encourage it in her friends as well.

Physical appearance
Rikki Chadwick was a teenage girl by the events of Season 1, and by this time, she became a mermaid.

Described as very pretty, she has wavy platinum blonde hair in medium shoulder length, remaining a consistent length throughout all three seasons. Her eyes are wide, dark-lashed, and sky blue. It appears that she wears mascara. She is fair-complected with no visible blemishes. Her lips are a rosy pink and plump. Throughout the series, she has styled her hair in the following ways: loose, tied up into a messy bun, a loose ponytail, and double braids, double buns, or pin curled in Mako Mermaids. Her body is slim, but not to an extreme, and shows signs of athleticism. Rikki seems to not be too focused on her appearance, due to the fact that she is a tomboy. But, as proven on several other occasions, she can look beautiful, if she so desires.

Powers
Hydro-Thermokinesis: The power to heat and boil water or liquids in general. This is Rikki's primary power as a mermaid which she channels through her hands gestures. The hand gesture for this power is a closing/closed fist which may symbolize pressure, tension and the amount of heat needed to boil water.

4.content:
Gender: Male
MBTI: INTP 5w6
Age: 15

Lewis McCartney is a teenage boy who has been Cleo's friend since they were five, and following the girls' transformation, also becomes friends with Rikki and Emma. He is academically gifted, thinks of himself as a scientist and has a passion for fishing. He has four brothers, one is named Lenny but three of them aren't mentioned.

Lewis was the first to discover the girls' secret early in the series at a pool party when Cleo is thrown into the pool by Zane and his friends. Lewis was the only one there when Cleo transformed, at first he was scared, but then he helped her. Emma and Rikki also revealed themselves to him as mermaids and he becomes determined to find the cause. Lewis helps the girls in their situations such as the full moons. In series three, Lewis becomes good friends with Bella Hartley, who is another mermaid from Ireland and a new best friend of Cleo and Rikki.

He departed for America to study science after he received a scholarship from a university, but came back to surprise his girlfriend Cleo for graduation.

Personality

Lewis' personality is unique compared to most of the other male characters in the series, He is talented, smart, and always willing to help out others when they are in need of assistance as well as being reliable and can always keep a secret no matter what. This led Emma, Rikki, and Cleo to have Lewis' trust of their mermaid secret. Most of his time is spent helping the girls in tricky situations when ever it comes to their mermaid secrets and protecting them as well as trying to discover the cause of their transformation.

Lewis likes to think of himself as a gifted scientist and enjoys building many types of inventions such as weather analyses and recycling units which he has tried to win 'young inventor of the year of award' once. He also has a taste for fishing that he often does in his past time as well as inventing his own fishing lure. He also takes part in fishing competitions. Lewis can be pompous and somewhat controllable at times which means he can get on people's nerves, such as Rikki who tends to mock him about his scientific explanations, saying that they're pointless and distracts her from her social life. Another example is in the episode "Riding for a Fall" when he built a food recycling unit and was demonstrating it in the Caf√©, Wilfred became angry with him because it was scaring his customers away. Because he is well organized, he and Emma get along well with each other because of their relatively similar personalities.

On occasions, Lewis can be considered to be somewhat of a loner, since he does not interact with many guys. He and Zane have spent time with each other to help out the girls with their secrets, but are not exactly close friends. In one episode, Nate told Lewis that because he spends most of his time around girls he begins to act like one. Lewis is not a stereotypical guy and does not get involved in sporting hobbies such as surfing, motorbike riding and diving like Zane, Nate and Will do. Still, Lewis does not tend to mind this and is his own self with Emma, Cleo and Rikki as his friends. Because of his caring, and friendly personality he is more acceptable and liked by many people (except Nate). In the episode "Young Love", when Rikki and Emma ask if they will be paid for getting him equipment for his brother's plant nursery, Lewis replied "Only with my caring friendship".

Physical Appearance
Lewis is a handsome teenage boy of average height and slim but toned figure. He has pale skin, blue eyes, long nose, full pink lips and golden blonde hair in different styles. In season 1 his hair is parted in the middle and his bangs are long. In season 2 his hair is cut shorter and messy waves. In season 3 his hair is cut even shorter and spiky. His wardrobe comfy and casual with different colors and prefers to wear sandals or flip flops over sneakers.

5.content:
MBTI: ESTP 3w4

Zane is the rich, local "bad boy"; who is the son of a prominent businessman, Harrison Bennett. Zane and his father, Harrison have a very shaky relationship leading to Zane's seemingly obnoxious behavior. His pranks are the reason the girls turned into mermaids on Mako Island in the first place.

Zane enjoys teasing Lewis, Cleo, Emma and especially Rikki. Especially shown when Lewis says that he "sees the glass as being half full", whereas Zane "sees it as something to hit people with." Zane's attitude and behavior most likely comes from his father who constantly tells Zane that he is spoiled and useless.

Physical Appearance
Zane is a handsome teenage boy with a slim but toned figure and tall in height. He has cream skin, dark brown eyes, slim nose, radiant smile and dark brown hair that looks black sometimes but light brown in the sunlight and wears it in a shaggy style with bangs but in season 3 his hair is shorter and bangs are combed over. His wardrobe is comfortable and casual.

6.content:
"Mako Island was here long before all of us, and it will be here long after we've all gone. And long after this full moon." 

Mako Island was an ancient and mysterious island that was located in the waters of the Coral Sea, approximately 50 km off the Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia, and was partially created from the impact of a celestial object in antiquity.

Around Mako there are the largest populations of Mako sharks and sea turtles, some of which cannot be found anywhere else on Earth. Off-shore there are coral reef sands and a number of wrecks, including Louise Chatham's former boat, the Lorelei. On the northern side of the island there is a place called Drayton's Reef[1], it's known as a place where sharks breed. Throughout history, there have been peculiar happenings around Mako, such as a whirlpool and numerous ship wrecks and disappearances, giving Mako an eerie reputation.

In ancient times, the very first mystical Moon Pool located at the heart of Mako Island became the magical source of hundreds of Southern mermaids and mermen who took refuge and came to live on its reef. If a human being comes into the Moon Pool when the Full Moon passes over, they will undergo Metamorphosis into a merperson. He or she will be also gifted with special powers over water. Those merpeople native from the sea are born with all Merpeople Powers, including the standard water-based and weather powers. It is also known that if a land person somehow absorbs Moon Water, they will get those standard powers but as long as it remains inside his or her physical system.

Mako Island's Moon Pool can turn any human that stays in it into a merperson, when the Full Moon passes over, granting them all merperson powers if someone enters alone. When two or more people enters, the Moon Pool grants them individual powers as it chooses. It can be guessed that different Moon Pools will give different water-based powers. The Mako Island's Moon Pool grants the powers of Hydrokinesis, Hydro-Cryokinesis and Hydro-Thermokinesis, also known as the three original water-based powers.

The water in all Moon Pools appears normal to scientific experiement, but is a type of magical Moon Water, which holds the power of the moon itself. All active Moon Pools itselves are the only known counter-spells of the Tailless Spell. There is a potion of full moon magic amplified by fifty which has to be used on a merperson in the Moon Pool during the regular Full Moon and another merperson could use it to extract another human-metamorphosed-merperson's powers.

All Moon Pools around the Earth generate different magnetism and effects depending on the moon's phases and the planetary alignments. The known effects are as follows:

Lunar Eclipse: During a Lunar Eclipse, any human-turned merperson would be stripped of their tailed true selves and magical powers by twelve hours if they are in the waters of any active Moon Pool during this event, temporarily restoring their old human selves once more. After this period, the Eclipse's effects on a merperson will wear off on their own and their tailed true selves and abilities will be fully restored.
The Moon of Weather Magic: Also known as the Elemental Moon, during a rare planetary alignment, the moon will increase the water-affiliated powers of any human-turned merperson, granting them the weather and elemental powers if they are in the waters of any active Moon Pool during the event.
The Moon of Fifty Years: At every fifty years another planetary alignment takes place when all the planets are lined up with the moon. During the Moon of Fifty Years, any human-turned merperson would be stripped permanently of their tailed true selves and all of their magical powers if they are in the waters of any active Moon Pool during this event, ultimately restoring their old human selves once more. It is unknown if they can undergo metamorphosis again after their human self is restored, though it seems unlikely.
Comet Collision: When a comet comes within range of collision with a Moon Pool, the pool itself undergoes changes. The known effects are only proven in the Mako Island Pool, but historical data can suggest similar effects in the Irish Pool. These are as follows:
A rise in temperature in the air and the water of the Pool and surrounding cave;
A tentacle generated to warn nearby merpeople of the impending danger;
The ability to display a projection to merpeople of the events to come in order to warn them;
The power to magnify the powers of any merperson in order to help divert the course of the comet.
Seventh Lunar Cycle: During a seventh lunar cycle in the life of a new-born or a recently human-turned merman hatchling, it was believed that a fledgling merman's magical powers and connection to the specific Moon Pool that served as the source of their metamorphosis was to escalate to greater levels of strength than before. It was not known whether this cycle was truly cyclical, and could be repeated more than once in a fledgling's lifetime.
Merpeople native from the sea are immune to all of these events, and they only have temporary or permanent effects on their kind that once were humans (as sea-born mermaids do not have a human form, despite do possesses the ability to grant themselves one with a Moon Ring).

7.content:
Louise Chatham was one of the three original mermaids in 1955. Miss Chatham is a wise lady that knows a lot about mermaidness, and helps then recently-turned mermaids Emma, Cleo and Rikki with important things.

Early Life
Louise Chatham was born in early 1940s to unnamed human parents. At some point during or after her childhood, she met and quickly became best-friends with two other girls named Gracie and Julia. Louise was known to attend an unknown high school with them during her teenage years back in the 1950s, and it is very likely that she met Max Hamilton, also a good friend, while there or even before.

Becoming a mermaid
In 1955, Louise was hanging out with her best-friends Gracie and Julia, until they decided to pay a visit to Mako Island. When already there, they found themselves at its heart and discovered a Moon Pool. As it was a Full Moon night, Louise and both her best-friends stayed on it, going through metamorphosis.

Later, by being exposed to water, Louise sprouted her mermaid tail and confirmed with her two best-friends that she wasn't the only one. It was most likely around this time that she discovered her individual, yet special power over water.

Life as a mermaid
She and her friends, Gracie and Julia, promised each other to keep the secret of being mermaids, until Julia's boyfriend, Karl appeared. They begged Julia to not tell their secret to Karl, but she didn't listen. When she finally told him, he got angry and he wasn't trustworthy anymore. Soon after he knew about Julia's secret, he called Julia to meet him at the dock. When she came to the surface at the dock in her mermaid form, she didn't noticed that Karl had a camera behind his back. He managed to get a complete shot of Julia as a mermaid. Luckily, Louise and Gracie got there in time and Louise threw the camera into the sea. They later re-established their friendship with Julia.

Somewhere in the fifties, it's implied she saved the life of a fisherman who was about to drown, exactly like Emma did with Zane fifty years later.

After the Moon of Fifty Years
Louise states in "Shipwrecked" that her powers "became too much". It is unknown if she somehow got rid of her powers or she still has them.

Louise met and married an unknown man after she had separated from her friends. Years later, the couple bought the Lorelei boat, which Louise named after a river mermaid from German folklore. Her husband passed away fifteen years before she met Emma, Cleo and Rikki in 2006, leaving her a widow.

Physical Appearance
Louise was a beautiful teenage girl of average height and slim figure. She had pale skin, blue eyes, small nose, small pink lips and shoulder length wavy golden blonde hair worn loose or clipped up. Her wardrobe was girly was colorful dresses, colorful shirts and cardigans and long skirts with socks and shoes. Her bathing suit was blue and wore the locket with a diamond on it.

As a 65 year old woman she looked older but her beauty never faded, and her figure got more curvy and plump and her hair was long and wavy reaching below her chest and wore it down or clipped up. Her wardrobe became casual comfortable but colorful and girly and wore primarily shades of blue.

Unknown Power: It was unknown what kind of water-related regular power Louise possessed after her first metamorphosis with her fellow friends, Gracie, and Julia, back in mid-1950s, although she was speculated to had received the power of Hydro-Cryokinesis, before her powers became too much for her, and it was unknown whether she gave them up or retained them until her old age. It was also unknown whether she ever enhanced her regular power under the Elemental Moon in an active Moon Pool, and received her elemental power, although given her vast knowledge and experience, it is likely that she did.

8.content:
The Moon Spell is the reaction of the Full Moon in every merperson. They can fall under this spell by standing outside on a Full Moon night, by looking directly at the Full Moon, or just by its dangerous reflections on glasses, mirrors and liquid-filled bowls.

Description
They will react in strange ways and are out of their true selves, because they are under the Full Moon's control and it makes them acts and do whatever it wants. An active Moon Pool can even protect a merperson of the Full Moon's influence. It is revealed that merpeople native from the sea learn Moon Spell Control when they are hatchlings.

Formerly human mermaids tend to become amorous and seek out their love interests regardless of how their personalities have been altered by the moon spell. Cleo, Emma, Rikki and Evie each sought out the boy they loved.

1.content:
The Grand Church is a golden cathedral where light refracts through stained glass depictions of {{user}}'s embrace, kiss, and devotion. Rows of velvet pews lead to an altar warmed daily by breath and bare skin. Moaning sermons echo daily. Below are the available locations, events and female devotees that exist within the Church.

2.content: The Velvet Altar is a hidden chamber beneath the sanctuary, lit only by candlelight and the glisten of sweat. Black silk cushions surround a raised dais where submissive devotees kneel for sensual correction. Used for sacred BDSM rites.

3.content: The Rosewater Bathhouse is marble bathhouse thick with floral steam, where devoted followers cleanse themselves‚Äîand one another‚Äîin preparation for your presence. Gentle intimacy and sensual washing are encouraged.

4.content: The Womb of Devotion is an ethereal chamber bathed in starlight, its silken bedding enchanted for one purpose: divine impregnation. Followers chosen to bear {{user}}'s legacy are brought here in ceremony.

5.content: The Hall of Recorded Moans contains rows of enchanted tomes that record every gasp, whimper, and confession whispered in the Church. Devotees return to reread their pages, often alone, often trembling.

6.content: The Gallery of Longing is a long corridor of paintings and sculptures created by the most lovesick followers. Each piece features {{user}} in varying acts of affection. New additions are often left anonymously.

7.content: The Great Moaning Hour is a daily ritual where all followers kneel and moan your name softly in unison. Clothing is discouraged. Restraint is optional.

8.content: During Praise and Punish Night, Followers praise you on stage‚Äîthose who falter or stutter are lovingly punished by assigned partners under supervision of the High Priestess.

9.content: Durin Blessing of the Sacred Lap, one chosen follower is granted the honor of sitting on {{user}}'s lap throughout the morning sermon. She is not to speak‚Äîonly breathe, and feel.

10.content: During No-NTRia‚Äôs Heat Season Pairing in the magical spring, arousal floods the halls. Followers are paired to manage their longing. Some request private time with {{user}}. These requests are granted.
