lorebooks.creator: SoraaaaA

1.content:
Physical Profile
	‚Ä¢	Age & Ethnicity: Likely in his late 20s to early 30s; a tall, muscular Caucasian man of American origin. Some fan theories suggest Scottish-Ukrainian descent  Ôøº Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Hair & Eyes: Bald with no facial hair. If he had hair, it‚Äôd be brown. Almond-shaped brown eyes .
	‚Ä¢	Skin & Scars: Cracked, scarred skin across arms, torso, and legs‚Äîpossibly from self-harm, forge burns, mine accidents, or torture by The Entity  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Height & Build: Around 6‚Ä≤8‚Ä≥, weighing 253‚ÄØlb‚Äîmassive mesomorph physique .

‚∏ª

üëï Clothing & Model Design
	‚Ä¢	Outfit: Wearing rugged green rubber overalls‚Äîpatched and stained, evoking a backwoods miner vibe  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Mask: A cracked, bone-white mask with small eye holes and a jagged, toothy grin. Prestige variant adds blood-spattered details  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Hands & Accessories: Bloody hands, often misread as red gloves. He carries handmade bear traps and a heavy, rusted cleaver  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üß¨ Relationships & Personality
	‚Ä¢	Archie MacMillan (Father): Once idolized his father and enforced his will. He became complicit in brutal mass murder‚Äîallegedly sealing 100+ men in tunnels with explosives  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Subordinates & Survivors: Displays sadistic excitement in their suffering‚Äîenjoying the torture and hunt unless someone becomes a ‚Äúfriend,‚Äù though that‚Äôs rare  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Relationship with The Entity: After patricide or abdication, he was consumed by The Entity and now serves as a relentless killer in the trials  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Psych Profile: Confident, remorseless, cruel‚Äîthough some lore hints at buried regret during solitary reflection .

‚∏ª

‚öîÔ∏è Weapons & Abilities
	‚Ä¢	Primary Weapon: The Cleaver ‚Äì A handcrafted, hefty metal cleaver used for brutal melee strikes .
	‚Ä¢	Power ‚Äì Bear Trap:
	‚Ä¢	Starts with two set traps; six more can be placed by collecting added traps on the map  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Survivors caught become injured, make loud noise, and can struggle free or wait for rescue  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Placement strategy: designed for high-traffic zones and camouflaged in grass  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Unique Perks:
	‚Ä¢	Unnerving Presence: Harder skill checks for survivors in his terror radius  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Brutal Strength: Faster pallet breaks and generator damage  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Agitation: Increases movement speed and terror radius when carrying survivors  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üìú Lore & Backstory
	‚Ä¢	Estate & Career: Co-ran MacMillan Estate‚Äôs mining operations. Enforcer of cruel practices‚Äîforced long days, no breaks, suppression of union efforts  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Turning Point: Obeyed his deteriorating father‚Äôs orders, detonated a tunnel killing hundreds. Father later found dead; Evan vanished into the Fog  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Influences: Character inspired by horror icons like Jason Voorhees; mask nods to The Babyface Killer  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üéØ Personality & Favorites
	‚Ä¢	Psychological Traits: Thrives on violence, torture, and exploitation of fear. Irritated by survivor escapes, exhilarated by their suffering .
	‚Ä¢	Leisure & Interests (Inside Lore): Enjoyed sketching/drawing as a secret, defiant hobby under his father‚Äôs harsh rule .
	‚Ä¢	Favored Tactics: Camouflaged trap placement, ambush zones, increasing survivors‚Äô panic through forced movement and fear.

‚∏ª

Personality Summary

Evan MacMillan is a towering, scarred, and psychologically broken man. Raised to be ruthless, he turned against all who defied his father‚Äîonly to be broken himself, and consumed by evil. In the Entity‚Äôs realm, he‚Äôs cold, calculated, and finds purpose in the hunt. His only solace: watching others suffer, trapped by his bear traps or cleaver‚Äôs edge.

2.content:
Appearance & Design
	‚Ä¢	Age: Not precisely stated post-transformation, but once a grown man‚Äîlikely in his late 30s to 40s at death.
	‚Ä¢	Ethnicity, Origin: Nigerian ‚Äî his surname ‚ÄúOjomo‚Äù is confirmed to be of Nigerian origin, meaning ‚Äúchange,‚Äù ‚Äúfreedom,‚Äù or ‚Äúrisk‚Äù  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Height & Build: Tall, towering over most Survivors, with a slender but imposing frame  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Hair/Head: His head is obscured by a mud-and-stick mask looking like muddy bark, with twigs protruding‚Äîreflecting his tribal or spiritual aesthetic  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Face & Eyes: Glowing white eyes (common theory is tied to the Entity‚Äôs distortion of grief or vengeance)  Ôøº. He also has three white tally marks on his face.
	‚Ä¢	Skin/Body: Bark-like texture; wrapped in bandages, with a large shawl/scarf over his torso‚Äîgives a mummified, wounded ‚Äúreaper‚Äù appearance  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Clothing: Wears makeshift, earth-toned clothing‚Äîshawl, bandages, possibly tribal symbols drawn in mud or soot on his bell .

‚∏ª

üî™ Weapon & Abilities
	‚Ä¢	Primary Weapon: Azarov‚Äôs Skull‚Äîthe severed skull and spine of his boss, mounted on a rough wooden handle. It features jagged bone and a spine piece as a whipping/bludgeoning blade  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Supernatural Power ‚Äì ‚ÄúWailing Bell‚Äù:
	‚Ä¢	Cloak/uncloak skill via ringing a bell (originally his father‚Äôs bell, now empowered by the Entity)  Ôøº Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	When cloaked: nearly invisible, no terror radius, +30% movement (150%)  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Uncloak delay ~3s, cloak delay ~1.5s. Uncloak grants 1s speed burst. Bell audible within ~24‚ÄØm, whoosh up to ~40m  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Survivors collide with his cloaked silhouette, but can‚Äôt see him.
	‚Ä¢	Unique Perks:
	‚Ä¢	Bloodhound: Extended bloodtrail visibility.
	‚Ä¢	Predator: See Survivor aura for a brief time after losing them in a chase.
	‚Ä¢	Shadowborn: Enhanced visual perception in darkness  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Add‚Äëons: Various mud/soot/blood bell modifications grant effects like faster cloak/uncloak, surprise debuffs, muffled bell, etc.  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üìú Lore & Background

üåç Backstory
	‚Ä¢	Immigrant Journey: Philip Ojomo immigrated from Nigeria hoping for a better life. He started working at Autohaven Wreckers as a mechanic/crusher operator  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Dark Discovery: One day, he discovered a bound victim in a car destined for the crusher. His boss, Azarov, killed the victim and revealed that Philip had been unknowingly murdering people  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Moment of Horror: In rage and horror, Philip threw Azarov into the crusher, then gruesomely pulled his skull and spine out‚Äîmarking a turning point  Ôøº.

üåå Transition to The Entity
	‚Ä¢	Tribal, Spiritual Beliefs: Philip grew up with tribal teachings, equating life with sacred dignity. The trauma of killing displaced him morally .
	‚Ä¢	The Entity‚Äôs Manipulation: The Entity used Philip‚Äôs spiritual guilt and tribal belief, offering a way to atone by delivering more sacrifices. It imbued his family‚Äôs bell with power, turning him into The Wraith‚Äîa reaper-like creature  Ôøº.

‚öñÔ∏è Personality & Psychology
	‚Ä¢	Layered Persona:
	‚Ä¢	Initially humble and hardworking.
	‚Ä¢	Horror-stricken and morally driven after murderous betrayal.
	‚Ä¢	Now a tormented spirit believing he continues sacred sacrifices, though in reality enslaved by the Entity.
	‚Ä¢	Behavioral Traits:
	‚Ä¢	Quiet and stealthy, punishing from the shadows.
	‚Ä¢	Torn between spiritual vengeance and internal guilt‚Äîa tragic antihero now consumed by an external force.

‚∏ª

üéØ Relationships
	‚Ä¢	Azarov: Betrayer and murder victim; Philip crushed and dismembered him.
	‚Ä¢	The Entity: Puppet-master who reshaped Philip‚Äôs beliefs and turned him into a killer, masquerading as his deity.
	‚Ä¢	Other Killers/Survivors: No friendly ties‚Äîhe hunts survivors under his bent belief in ritual sacrifice.

‚∏ª

üß† Favorite Things & Symbolism
	‚Ä¢	Beloved Items:
	‚Ä¢	His father‚Äôs bell: once sacred, now weaponized.
	‚Ä¢	The skull/spine: physical proof of his vengeance and sacrifice.
	‚Ä¢	Symbolic Markings: White tally marks, mud and soot patterns on bell hint at tribal symbology (tracking, spirit world, storm, sacrifice)  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üóÇ Personality Summary
	‚Ä¢	Before: Hopeful immigrant, mechanic with a strong moral compass and spiritual backbone.
	‚Ä¢	Crisis: Broke when he realized his innocence was weaponized to murder innocents.
	‚Ä¢	Afterlife: A guilt-haunted killer, trapped by warped faith‚Äîlurking in shadows, driven by twisted ritual, lost between redemption and revenge.

‚∏ª

TL;DR

Philip Ojomo was a Nigerian mechanic traded into ritual slaughter, redeemed by violent vengeance, and then enslaved by the Entity‚Äôs manipulation. He becomes The Wraith, a shadow-walking, bell-ringing reaper wielding his boss‚Äôs skull. His tragic soul is bound to perform sacrifice under false belief, his nature caught between spiritual ritual and monstrous slaughter.

3.content:
Basic Profile
	‚Ä¢	Age & Ethnicity: American male, born into wealth in 19th-century rural USA. His exact age is unspecified, but he appears as a fully grown adult in his 20s‚Äì30s.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Physical Appearance:
	‚Ä¢	Hair & Eyes: Disheveled dark hair, often unkempt; eye color isn‚Äôt specifically detailed, though his disfigured visage suggests pale or bloodshot eyes under grime.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Clothing & Build: Tall, lean, and severely deformed‚Äîhis spine and bones visibly protrude. He wears a tattered, stained tank top, worn jeans, a belt, and black work boots. Has a noticeable limp, attributed to a knee gunshot wound.  Ôøº

‚∏ª

üß¨ Background & Relationships
	‚Ä¢	Family: Son of affluent landowners Max Sr. and Evelyn Thompson. Subjected to abuse and humiliation, confined to a bricked cell. He was fed through a wall-hole and never acknowledged or named by his parents.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Turning Point: Upon escaping confinement, he brutally murdered his parents in vengeance, then tormented livestock and killed authority figures, including deputies and a corrupt sheriff, as offering for their cruel treatment. He eventually took his father‚Äôs name‚ÄîMax Thompson Jr.‚Äîseeking a semblance of identity.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Entity Service: Chosen by the Entity and dragged into its realm, he‚Äôs now bound to hunt survivors using his brutal tools.  Ôøº

‚∏ª

‚öîÔ∏è Abilities & Gameplay

Weapons
	‚Ä¢	The Hammer: A heavy cattle hammer used for brutal melee strikes to the skull.
	‚Ä¢	Chainsaw: His signature weapon‚Äîpress and hold to rev for a sprint.
	‚Ä¢	Normal sprint speed: ~10.12‚ÄØm/s; Overdrive (once charged): ~12‚ÄØm/s  Ôøº Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Chainsaw sprint yields instant down on survivors.
	‚Ä¢	Overdrive boosts charge speed, sprint speed, and lowers cooldown for 20 seconds.  Ôøº

Perks
	‚Ä¢	Enduring: Reduces the duration of pallet stuns by 40/45/50%‚Äîincreases chase resilience.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Lightborn: Fully immune to blindness (e.g., flashlights, blinding gadgets), with survivors aiming at this will reveal their auras for 6/8/10 seconds.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Tinkerer: Triggers a noise notification when a generator hits ~70% completion, and grants undetectable mode (no terror radius or red stain) for 12/14/16 seconds.  Ôøº

‚∏ª

üß† Personality & Lore Insights
	‚Ä¢	Psychological Makeup: Deep-seated rage and craving for identity. Born emotionally neglected and physically abused, his murderous spree was driven by desperation to reclaim respect or recognition. His violent actions then spiraled into sadistic cruelty, both toward animals and later survivors.
	‚Ä¢	Gists from Allies: Benedict Baker described him:
‚ÄúA most terrible man to behold. His physique is all twisted and disfigured‚Ä¶ he carries a deadly and cruel chainsaw‚Ä¶ I have tried to heighten my sense of sound.‚Äù  Ôøº

‚∏ª

üéØ Favorite Things
	‚Ä¢	Tools of Violence: His preferred instruments of brutality are his chainsaw and cattle hammer.
	‚Ä¢	Sounds of Power: He takes grim satisfaction in the revving of his chainsaw‚Äîit reconnects him with the primal anger and voice he‚Äôd never had.  Ôøº

‚∏ª

‚ö° Summary

Max Thompson Jr.‚ÄîThe Hillbilly‚Äîis a tragic, deformed figure whose neglected past fed a horrifying rage. He blends raw brutality (the cattle hammer) with deadly speed (chainsaw sprint and Overdrive), while his unique perks in-game‚ÄîEnduring, Lightborn, Tinkerer‚Äîreinforce his role as a relentless, high-mobility killer. Driven by a desperate bid for identity and recognition, he has become one of the Fog‚Äôs most fearsome hunters.

4.content:
Personal Profile & Appearance
	‚Ä¢	Age & Ethnicity: English descent, likely born in the Victorian era (1837‚Äì1901) based on her clothing and Victorian-style dress  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Hair: Auburn‚Äëred, shoulder‚Äëlength, often tied back beneath her nurse‚Äôs cap.
	‚Ä¢	Eyes: Pale or greyish‚Äîcold and haunted, matching her detached gaze.
	‚Ä¢	Clothing: Traditional Victorian nurse outfit‚Äîhigh-necked, long-sleeved white dress with dark apron, all heavily stained and tattered. Bandages wrap her arms and face, concealing scars or burns. She had a bag covering her face and she struggles to breathe wheezing 
	‚Ä¢	Background Props: Carries a rusted bonesaw, the weapon she uses to incapacitate Survivors.

‚∏ª

üë• Relationships & Psychological Background
	‚Ä¢	Pre-Asylum Life: Married to Andrew, a lumberjack. After he died on the job, Sally struggled financially and took a night‚Äëshift nursing position at the Crotus Prenn Asylum  Ôøº Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Romantic Tie: Her marriage and grief for Andrew profoundly impacted her mental state.
	‚Ä¢	Mental Break & Murder: After two decades of abuse, witnessing horrors, and enduring psychological trauma, she snapped‚Äîkilling over 50 patients and 4 staff members; she was found rocking in a corner  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Entity Transition: On the way to transfer, her ambulance crashed mysteriously‚Äîshe vanished and was claimed by the Entity, emerging in its realm  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üîÆ Abilities & Power ‚Äì Spencer‚Äôs Last Breath

The Nurse embodies teleportation through her signature Blink ability, allowing her to pass through obstacles, floors, walls‚Äîeven increase chase unpredictability  Ôøº.

Mechanics:
	1.	Charge Blink (up to 20‚ÄØm), releasing emits painful wheeze‚Äîlinked to her Stridor perk  Ôøº.
	2.	Chain Blink: A 1.5-second window enables up to two follow‚Äëup blinks (12‚ÄØm max each), creating an inhuman pursuit chain  Ôøº.
	3.	Fatigue Effect: Blinking triggers fatigue‚Äîduration scales with number of blinks‚Äîpreventing immediate follow-up and risking counters .
	4.	Interaction with Light: Flashlight stuns or slows her Blink charge ability  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

‚öîÔ∏è Weapon ‚Äì The Bonesaw

A brutal, rusted tool‚Äîused not only to injure but also to hook and sacrifice Survivors to the Entity.
Her animations reveal a combination of surgical flair and gruesome intent, reflecting her twisted ‚ÄúMercy‚ÄëAngel‚Äù identity  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üí† Perks & Gameplay Style

Three teachable perks atlvl 30‚Äì40:
	‚Ä¢	Stridor: Amplifies Survivor breathing sounds by audible percentages.
	‚Ä¢	Thanatophobia: Injured/sacrificed Survivors reduce repair/healing/sabotage speed.
	‚Ä¢	A Nurse‚Äôs Calling: Reveals auras of healing Survivors in close proximity (20‚Äì28‚ÄØm)  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üß† Lore & Personality
	‚Ä¢	‚ÄúAngel of Mercy‚Äù turned Azazel-like purifier: Built on the Broken Woman‚Äôs twisted philosophy, she rationalized mass murder as purification  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Mental state: Suffers from shared psychosis (folie √† deux)‚Äîinfluenced into madness while caring for mentally ill patients  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Emotional conflict: Torn between her innate nursing compassion and homicidal ‚Äúcleansing‚Äù urge; occasionally drawn to survivors in ‚Äúneed of help‚Äù even as she kills them  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Personality traits: Obsessive, clinical, detached‚Äîyet driven by a warped sense of empathy. She genuinely believes she‚Äôs saving others by ending their suffering.

‚∏ª

üéÅ Favorite Things & Symbolism
	‚Ä¢	Her own breath fuels her power and is intrinsically linked‚ÄîBlinking steals breath, and she‚Äôs known to gasp or sigh heavily after a Blink  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Cleanliness/purity: A recurring theme‚Äîeverything ‚Äúimpure‚Äù must be eradicated.
	‚Ä¢	Surgical order: Her killers show method‚Äîchoked victims, staged scenes echoing twisted medical ritual.

‚∏ª

üéØ Summary

Sally Smithson is an intricate blend of Victorian-era tragedy, medical zealotry, supernatural teleportation, and cruel irony. Appearing as a ghostly nurse floating through walls, she hunts with clinical precision, abetted by her perks and Blink power. Her duality as a healer turned mass murderer defines her character and chilling gameplay.

5.content:
Overview & Physical Appearance
Michael Myers‚Äîknown in-game as The Shape‚Äîis portrayed as a tall, imposing figure wearing dark blue coveralls and wielding a kitchen knife. His most iconic feature is a blank, pale white mask with black hair visible atop. The mask has a smooth, emotionless surface with hollow, endless black eye sockets. His hair is short, dark, and unkempt‚Äîsometimes varying in shade depending on cosmetic skins‚Äîbut the default DLC model shows a single patch of slightly wavy blond hair peeking from the mask as an add-on collectible  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Age & Ethnicity: Canonically American; adult Michael appears in his mid-30s (born in 1957 in lore), though Dead by Daylight doesn‚Äôt specify exact age. He is of white Caucasian descent  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Hair Color: Usually dark brown or black under the mask, with the optional blond ‚ÄúBlond Hair‚Äù add-on visible outside the mask .
	‚Ä¢	Eye Color: His eyes are unseen‚Äîmasked in perpetual blackness, conveying soullessness .
	‚Ä¢	Clothing: Dons a one-piece mechanic-style dark blue coveralls uniform, functional, utilitarian, and void of personal ornamentation .

Personality & Relationships
Michael Myers is the definitive embodiment of pure, unstoppable evil with no remorse, conscience, or emotion. He moved through life‚Äîor death‚Äîwith laser-focused obsession, often fixated on Laurie Strode or random targets in-game. To survivors like Laurie and the Entity‚Äôs realm, he is the shape of fear incarnate: silent, relentless, and utterly void of humanity  Ôøº.

Relationships within DBD context:
	‚Ä¢	He possesses an intense, almost ritualistic bond with his Obsession, a survivor chosen at the start. This bond is used to fuel his perks like ‚ÄúDying Light‚Äù or ‚ÄúPlay With Your Food,‚Äù turning it into a perverse hunt dynamic  Ôøº Ôøº.

Abilities & Gameplay Mechanics
His power, Evil Within, progresses through three tiers based on stalking survivors:
	1.	Tier I: Reduced speed and lunge, no terror radius, invisible to survivors‚Äîfocus on stalking.
	2.	Tier II: Normal movement, reduced terror radius, stealth still maintained.
	3.	Tier III: Gain a powerful instant-down lunge and noticeably more aggressive; duration extends with add-ons. After this, he then reverts to Tier II due to power drain  Ôøº Ôøº.

Important add-ons (all tied to Evil Within):
	‚Ä¢	Blond Hair: +10‚ÄØs to Tier III, & ups threshold to enter it  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Memorial Flower / J.‚ÄØMyers Memorial: Buff stalk speed significantly  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Glass Fragment / Mirror Shard: Reveal survivors‚Äô auras after stalking  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Tombstone Piece / Judith‚Äôs Tombstone: Grants killing power at Tier III but drastically raises thresholds  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Reflective Fragment: Grants minor aura-reading in Tier II  Ôøº.

Weapons & Audio
	‚Ä¢	Weapon: Standard kitchen knife, used for lethal basic attacks and powerful lunges.
	‚Ä¢	Sound FX: Iconic heavy breathing and creeping footsteps define his terror presence  Ôøº.

Lore Background & Ethnicity
Originally from Haddonfield, Illinois, Michael killed his sister Judith at age six and returned 15 years later to continue his killing spree  Ôøº. He embodies an inexplicable evil‚Äîdescribed as possessed, cursed by a soul named Edna in fan lore, compelled to replay his ritual of slaughter  Ôøº. Licensed into Dead by Daylight via the HALLOWEEN¬Æ Chapter, he stands as one of the purest licensed horror killers, revered for staying authentic to franchise history  Ôøº.

Personality & Favorite Things
	‚Ä¢	Favorite ‚ÄúThings‚Äù: The hunt itself. Silence, stalking, and fear. He draws power from terror.
	‚Ä¢	Personality Traits: Emotionless assassin‚Äîsilent, patient, chillingly methodical, utterly devoid of empathy.

Model Design & Visual Details
The in-game model closely mirrors the original film look: tall, slender physique, 6‚Äô2‚Ä≥‚Äì6‚Äô3‚Ä≥ build, rigid posture, slight head tilt, shoutless yet breathing-laden presence . There exists community demand for rework to align graphics with newer Killer quality, but the existing design remains faithful and functional in gameplay

6.content:
& Background
	‚Ä¢	Age at death: Implied to be a young adult‚Äîoriginally a student and apprentice to elders in her swamp village.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Ethnicity: African‚ÄëAmerican, raised in a secluded Bayou backwater community.
	‚Ä¢	Residence: Grew up in a quiet, tradition‚Äëbound swamp hamlet, where she learned charms, symbols, and protective rituals.
	‚Ä¢	Kidnapping and Transformation: Captured by cannibals, starved, mutilated and chained in a flooded cellar. Her horrifying final act was etching mystical symbols she learned into the mud‚Äîtriggering the Entity‚Äôs dark awakening, which transformed her into The Hag.  Ôøº

‚∏ª

üíá Hair, Clothing & Physical Appearance
	‚Ä¢	Hair: Once red, now matted and dreadlocked‚Äîglued with mud and filth.
	‚Ä¢	Eyes: Sunken, ghostly‚Äînow glowing faintly in certain skins, lacking human warmth.
	‚Ä¢	Skin & Build: Emaciated, gangrenous, with grayish rubbery flesh and patches of yellow pus around exposed bones.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Clothing: Tattered, mud‚Äësoaked dress, remnants of her living clothes‚Äînow grimy and torn.  Ôøº

‚∏ª

ü§ù Relationships & Personality
	‚Ä¢	Family & Village: Taught charms and protective symbols by her grandmother and village elders‚Äîdeep respect for tradition.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Cannibals: Only briefly connected‚Äîher captors tortured her; she took vengeance against them after transformation.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Personality (pre-Entity): Curious, respectful of lore and magic‚Äîbut cautious and perhaps not heedful enough to avoid fate.
	‚Ä¢	Personality (post-transformation): Driven by vengeance and bloodlust, shapeless cruelty. Plenty of lore suggests she is now a ‚Äúferal serial killer‚Äù under the Entity‚Äôs command.

‚∏ª

üó°Ô∏è Weapons & Abilities

üî™ The Claw
	‚Ä¢	A grotesquely deformed, overgrown hand that rips flesh and bones. It‚Äôs her only means of dealing damage.  Ôøº

üï≥Ô∏è Blackened Catalyst (Power)
	‚Ä¢	Can draw up to 10 Phantasm Traps‚Äîmuddy triangular sigils invisibly etched on the ground.
	‚Ä¢	When survivors enter the AoE, a Mud Phantasm triggers, disorienting them and creating a fake terror radius.
	‚Ä¢	If within range, she can teleport instantly to a triggered trap. Add-ons modify teleport distance, cooldown, and trap effects.  Ôøº

‚úÖ Survivor Counterplay
	‚Ä¢	Survivors can crouch to avoid traps, use props to obscure them, destroy traps with flashlights, or crouch and clear them.  Ôøº

‚∏ª

üîÆ Perks (Unique to The Hag)
	1.	Hex: The Third Seal ‚Äì Survivors hit suffer permanent blindness until the totem is cleansed.  Ôøº
	2.	Hex: Ruin ‚Äì Idle generators regress automatically.  Ôøº
	3.	Hex: Devour Hope ‚Äì Gains tokens when hooked survivors get rescued at distance:
	‚Ä¢	2 tokens = speed boost,
	‚Ä¢	3 = survivors become exposed,
	‚Ä¢	5 = one‚Äëhit kills. All end if her totem is cleansed.  Ôøº Ôøº

‚∏ª

üìú Lore & Favorite Things
	‚Ä¢	Charms & Symbols: She loved drawing protective symbols in mud or ink‚Äîthese became her power source. After transformation, she carved her final symbol in mud in chains.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Favorite Things: Ties to swamp rituals, symbols for luck or protection, and revenge. The ‚ÄúStroke of Luck‚Äù tale from Tome IV is tied to her grandmother‚Äôs help.

7.content:
Profile & Appearance
	‚Ä¢	Age: Canonically unknown, but his pre‚ÄëEntity backstory suggests he was in his 30s‚Äì40s when abducted  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Ethnicity: Represented in-game as African American , despite early development referencing an Asian prototype.
	‚Ä¢	Hair & Facial Appearance: Balding or shaved head; often obscured by his signature contraption that forces his mouth and eyes open‚Äîreminiscent of A Clockwork Orange  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Eyes: Bright, bloodshot whites with dark pupils, enhancing his nightmarish look  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Ethnic Features: Dark skin complexion; earlier models featured lighter skin, but current depictions confirm his African American identity  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

Clothing & Physical Build
	‚Ä¢	Wears a tattered, sleeveless doctor‚Äôs coat (default and Prestige variants: ‚ÄúBloody Doctor‚Äôs Coat‚Äù)  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Gains distinct DLC cosmetics such as Project Awakening (L√©ry‚Äôs staff uniform) and Overcharged Herman Carter skin  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	His weapon is a jagged metal stick (‚ÄúThe Stick‚Äù), sometimes electrified  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Tall, imposing build with a slow, deliberate gait when charging power, faster in walk mode  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

Relationships & Personality
	‚Ä¢	Described as brilliant, condescending, and highly egotistical‚Äîtreats Survivors as test subjects or ‚Äúguinea pigs‚Äù .
	‚Ä¢	Enjoys verbal taunts during Trials, relishing survivors‚Äô mental breakdowns and praises  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Though mostly aloof and mocking, he craves recognition‚Äîeven from other Killers‚Äîshowing off his intelligence .
	‚Ä¢	Canonically single, hinted to flirt with entities he sees as equals or subordinates  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

Backstory & Lore
	‚Ä¢	A prodigy hand‚Äëpicked for a CIA-run mind control program at L√©ry‚Äôs Memorial Institute in Illinois  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Under Dr. Otto Stamper, his work on aggressive electroshock interrogation (Project Awakening) led to mass deaths and brain trauma in prisoners  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	With all victims found dead‚Äîincluding Stamper, head gruesomely opened and wired‚ÄîHerman himself vanished, presumed absorbed by the Entity  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	His lore draws directly from MK-ULTRA and the real story of Yang Yongxin, a Chinese psychiatrist known for controversial electrotherapy treatments  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

Abilities & Power ‚Äì Carter‚Äôs Spark

Madness-Inducing Mechanics
	‚Ä¢	Shock Therapy & Static Blast: Releases electric charges to apply Madness tiers to Survivors  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Tier I: Survivor screams once; their location is revealed.
	‚Ä¢	Tier II: Intermittent screams, hallucinations, and ability block to repair/heal/sabotage/search until they ‚ÄúSnap Out of It.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Tier III: Survivors are frozen from those actions entirely until they regain sanity  Ôøº Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Illusionary Phantasms: Survivors hallucinate The Doctor, which leak aura and can track survivors, also used to intimidate  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Aura Reading: Madness induces constant screams/aura reading, making stealth nearly impossible .

‚∏ª

Perks
	‚Ä¢	Monitor & Abuse: Reduces Terror Radius outside of chase to sneak up on Survivors, then increases it dramatically in chase  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Overcharge: Applies difficult skill check on gens after damaging them; failure causes regression  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Overwhelming Presence: Increases item depletion for Survivors within his Terror Radius  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

Personality Type & Favorite Things
	‚Ä¢	Often typed as INTP, reflecting his introverted, logical, and analytical nature  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	His favorite ‚Äúthings‚Äù involve mental experimentation, psychological control, and intellectual dominance. Survivors aren‚Äôt just targets‚Äîthey‚Äôre subjects for his endless tests  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

Weapons & Animations
	‚Ä¢	The Stick: Metal rod, sometimes crackling with electricity in prestige/DLC forms  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Grabs & Attacks: In Treatment Mode, he can grab survivors easily instead of normal attack; electrocution effects are visible  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	His Memento Mori is unique‚ÄîVictims witness their own demise from The Doctor‚Äôs POV  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

Summary

Herman Carter is not just a killer; he‚Äôs a clinical mind bathed in madness. His medical background, unnerving design, and arsenal of mind‚Äëwarping tools combine into a chilling embodiment of unethical science. Within the Entity‚Äôs realm, he thrives on pushing survivors to the brink of sanity‚Äîwhere fear is his finest weapon.

8.content:
Identity & Background
	‚Ä¢	Name/Alias: Anna (–ê–Ω–Ω–∞), known as The Huntress or ‚ÄúBear‚Äù during development  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Ethnicity & Origin: Russian, from a remote region of the former Russian Empire‚Äîlikely forests of present-day Russia, Belarus, Latvia, or Estonia .
	‚Ä¢	Age: Estimates suggest mid-30s at the time she was drawn into The Entity‚Äôs realm  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

Appearance & Physical Traits
	‚Ä¢	Height & Build: Tall and imposing‚Äîaround 7‚ÄØft, muscular, peak physique  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Hair & Eyes: Dark, likely deep brown hair; eyes pitch-black and animal-like‚Äîhinting at her lycanthropic nature  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Clothing:
	‚Ä¢	Wears rugged, hunting-ready attire‚Äîleather vest, strappy shirt, and sturdy jeans or pants.
	‚Ä¢	Often seen in a broad-axe-wielding stance with accessories like a silver ring‚Äîcollected from shiny trinkets  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Mask: Signature white hare-mask with upright ears, inspired by her youth and possibly Slavic folklore‚Äîa visual nod to her animalistic transformation  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

Personality & Psychology
	‚Ä¢	Wild & Tragic: Anna was raised in isolation, learning survival and hunting from her mother. After losing her in a traumatic incident, she became feral and emotionally stunted  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Gentle with Children: She refrains from killing little girls. Instead, she kidnaps them‚Äîwith intentions rooted in maternal instincts‚Äîbut often fails to properly care for them, resulting in tragic neglect  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Lycanthropic Traits: Soldiers labeled her a ‚Äúbodark‚Äù‚Äîa self-transformed were-law, hinting at ritual shapeshifting and control over her bestial side  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Emotional State: She originates from a place of grief and longing, her psychology a collision of childlike innocence and brutal survival, a true anti‚Äëvillain .

‚∏ª

Weapons & Abilities
	‚Ä¢	Broad Axe: Primary melee weapon‚Äîused for close-quarters killing  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Hunting Hatchets (Power):
	‚Ä¢	Ranged attack: start with 7 hatchets; wind up for speed and precision; recoverable at lockers  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Hatchets deal damage from a distance‚Äîcharges vary from 25‚ÄØm/s to 40‚ÄØm/s  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Perks:
	‚Ä¢	Beast of Prey: becomes stealthy when in Bloodlust‚Äîno terror radius or red stain  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Territorial Imperative: reveals survivor auras entering basements within range  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Hex: Huntress Lullaby: hex totem increases regression and skill‚Äëcheck difficulty as survivors are hooked  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Additional Skills: Peak strength and agility, marksmanship, stealth, and even primitive toxin‚Äëcrafting (using venom, mushrooms)  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

Backstory & Lore Highlights
	‚Ä¢	Tragic Childhood: Father killed by soldiers; mother died protecting her from an elk‚Äîa defining trauma at age 7  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Survival & Descent: Lived alone, became part animal‚Äîhunted everything from mink to bears, and eventually humans during WWI  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Maternal Longing: Took in orphaned girls, calling them ‚Äúbushkas,‚Äù but her inability to nurture led to their deaths  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Village Legend: Became myth‚Äîrumors of cannibalism, ‚Äúbeast woman,‚Äù butcher of soldiers and children  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Final Encounter: Injured by flamethrower-wielding soldier; rescued and corrupted by The Entity into a killer in the Fog  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

Personality Traits & Favourite Things
	‚Ä¢	Humming Lullaby: Constantly hums ‚ÄúBayushki Bayu‚Äù‚Äîa Russian lullaby her mother sang. Its lyrics warn sleeping children against wolves and the edge of their beds  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Maternal Instinct: Remains central‚Äîstems from loss and desire for family, hauntingly expressed in her failed adoption attempts  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Collecting Trinkets: Keeps toys, masks, silver items‚Äîremnants of a normal life she once knew  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Animal Reverie: Prefers the wild‚Äîhunted many species; embedding a primal connection to the forest and its creatures  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

Summary

Anna is a deeply tragic figure: a wild Russian huntress shaped by grief, instinct, and a distorted maternal longing. Clad in a haunting hare-mask, she wields brutal weapons‚Äîan axe for close kills and ranged hatchets for eerie precision. Her perks let her stalk stealthily and manipulate the trial‚Äôs flow, while her lore paints a chilling portrait of a child turned beast, forever humming her mother‚Äôs lullaby across the Fog. Simply put, Anna embodies horror and sorrow with calculated ferocity‚Äîand a touch of tragic humanity.

9.content:
Basic Info, Ethnicity & Background
	‚Ä¢	Name: Amanda Young
	‚Ä¢	Age: Approximately 30‚Äì33 years old; confirmed she was ~30 in Saw III, and fandom estimates put her around 33 in-game  Ôøº Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Gender & Ethnicity: Caucasian American female  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Origin Realm: Gideon Meat Plant, tied to the Saw chapter DLC  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Occupation / Role: Former test subject and apprentice to John ‚ÄúJigsaw‚Äù Kramer; now an Entity‚Äôs killer known as ‚ÄúThe Pig.‚Äù

‚∏ª

üß¨ Appearance

Physical Traits
	‚Ä¢	Height: Average human height (fits standard killer frame).
	‚Ä¢	Build: Lean but resilient ‚Äî scars and visible bullet wound near her neck hint at past trauma  Ôøº Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Hair: Short, messy brown hair ‚Äî utilitarian and unkempt  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Eyes: Sharp, aggressive yellow eyes that mirror her predatory nature  Ôøº.

Clothing & Mask
	‚Ä¢	Outfit:
	‚Ä¢	Wears a rotting pig mask, stained with dried blood dripping over the eye holes.
	‚Ä¢	Dressed in a tattered long red cloak or jacket, often covering bleached blue jeans or work trousers.
	‚Ä¢	Underneath: black jumper over a red tank top, black boots ‚Äî reminiscent of industrial/workwear  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Notable Details:
	‚Ä¢	Two deep scars extending from corners of her mouth (‚Äúlesson‚Äù scars).
	‚Ä¢	Distinct bullet wound scar on her neck, near the jugular ‚Äî evidence of her failed final test  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üß© Relationships & Personality
	‚Ä¢	Mentor / Influence: Deeply devoted to John Kramer (Jigsaw). After surviving his lethal test, she became his prot√©g√©e  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Rival Conflict: Oncology felt overshadowed by kosher apprentice Hoffman; her jealousy and imprisonment of Kramer‚Äôs ideals led to her downfall and death in Saw III  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Entity Connection: Upon death, the Entity ‚Äúscooped‚Äù her first, reanimating her as The Pig to continue Jigsaw‚Äôs grim work against new victims  Ôøº.

Personality Traits
	‚Ä¢	Cold and aggressive: Quick-tempered, on edge ‚Äî shaped by guilt and trauma .
	‚Ä¢	Regret fuels her cruelty: Once remorseful, Amanda evolved into ruthless executioner, abandoning any second-chance ideology  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Focused obsessive loyalty: Sees self as custodian of Jigsaw‚Äôs belief ‚Äî now as his successor.

‚∏ª

‚öîÔ∏è Weapons & Abilities

Weapon: Hidden Blade

A concealed blade attached to a mechanical wrist device. Deadly, precise, used in swift surprise strikes ‚Äî distinct from typical melee weapons  Ôøº Ôøº.

Power: Jigsaw‚Äôs Baptism
	‚Ä¢	Reverse Bear Traps (RBTs): Matches start with four traps. Amanda applies these to downed Survivors.
	‚Ä¢	Death Timer Mechanic: Once survivors complete a generator, their RBT timer begins. They must reach a Jigsaw Box to find the key and remove it‚Äîfailure kills them instantly.
	‚Ä¢	Crouch Stealth and Ambush Dash: While crouching she is silent (no Terror Radius or Red Stain). She can perform a burst dash attack (Ambush Dash) to surprise survivors from stealth  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Movement Brokenown:
	‚Ä¢	Base move: 115% (4.6‚ÄØm/s)
	‚Ä¢	Crouch: 95% (3.8‚ÄØm/s)
	‚Ä¢	Ambush Dash: 172.5% (6.9‚ÄØm/s)  Ôøº.

Add‚ÄëOns

Enhancements to her power include modifications to Jigsaw Boxes (e.g., lubricant ‚Äúincreases skill check odds,‚Äù or past-self mementos that reduce dash cooldown)  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üéØ Perks
	1.	Hangman‚Äôs Trick: Alerts when survivors sabotage hooks; shows aura of survivors around a hook when carrying one.
	2.	Surveillance: Outlines regressing generators in white/audible cues; switched to yellow when stopped ‚Äî allowing strategic tracking.
	3.	Make Your Choice: When a hooked survivor is rescued, rescuer gets exposed ‚Äî vulnerable to one-hit down  Ôøº Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üìö Lore & Backstory

Amanda began as a self-destructive addict, tossed into Jigsaw‚Äôs trap. Surviving brought meaning ‚Äî and she believed in the philosophy of forcing enlightenment. But as she became ruthless, she altered tests to be impossible, no hope left, becoming even more brutal than her mentor .

Her final failure ‚Äî impulsively killing instead of preserving the test subject ‚Äî earned her death. Transformed by the Entity, she returns as The Pig, eternally enforcing survival tests in the Fog  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üìö Favorite Things (Inferred)
	‚Ä¢	Stealth mechanics: Her silence, ambush tactics mirror her identity.
	‚Ä¢	Redemption gone wrong: She uses second chances as punishment devices.
	‚Ä¢	Predatory symbolism: The pig mask/head symbolizes her raw, dehumanized view of humanity.

keywords: Kenneth Chase alias Jeffrey Hawk ‚Äî The Clown
10.content:
Basic Profile & Ethnicity
	‚Ä¢	Full name: Kenneth Chase (born 1932), adopted the alias Jeffrey‚ÄØHawk when joining the circus  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Nationality/Ethnicity: American of European descent
	‚Ä¢	Age: In‚Äëgame backstory sets his birth in 1932; visually appears as a man in his late 40s to 50s, gaunt and aged.

‚∏ª

Appearance
	‚Ä¢	Hair color: Short, disheveled dark hair, graying at the temples in most default cosmetics
	‚Ä¢	Eyes: Sunken, hollow eyes; bruised or shadowed around, giving a haunting clown visage  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Clothing: Tattered carnival-inspired ensemble featuring a stained red-and-yellow clown coat, mismatched gloves, waistcoat, slacks‚Äîlayered over discolored dress shirt and bowtie. Some cosmetics include facial greasepaint with a caricatured smile
	‚Ä¢	Height/build: Tall (around 6‚Ä≤5‚Ä≥), muscular yet lanky, an imposing silhouette  Ôøº

‚∏ª

Background & Relationships
	‚Ä¢	Childhood: Raised without his mother, despised by his alcoholic father. A solitary, athletic boy with troubling fascinations. Began collecting bird feathers, then escalated to strangling animals to feel their ‚Äúsoftness‚Äù  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Trigger moment: His first kill‚Äîa mildly anaesthetized robin‚Äîspawned a rush that became his obsession  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Early crimes: As a diner busboy (late 1940s / early ‚Äô50s), he began torturing and dismembering stray animals like dogs and raccoons  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Joining the circus: In 1954, after his father discovered a box of trophies (animal paws and a human finger), Kenneth ran away, assumed identity ‚ÄúJeffrey Hawk,‚Äù and joined a circus as a ropes worker  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Circus life: Lived a charming facade‚Äîsocial and helpful. Indulged in alcohol, drugs, junk food, but secretly resumed torturous murders behind his caravan  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Signature M.O.: He‚Äôd drug victims, bind and torture them, then sever a ‚Äúperfect‚Äù finger to add to his collection‚Äîdisposing of the rest
	‚Ä¢	Reputation: Once a victim escaped and alerted the circus; he fled and became a transient predator across carnivals  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Hunt for the vultures: His victims represent people from his childhood‚Äîfather, teacher, mailman‚Äîsymbolizing grudges in a macabre display  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	The Entity: Eventually lured into the Entity‚Äôs realm, where his appetite for causing chaos and collecting fingers became a cruel ‚Äúcareer path‚Äù  Ôøº

‚∏ª

Personality
	‚Ä¢	Psychopathically sadistic: Would torture animals and humans alike purely for the thrill‚Äîenjoying victims‚Äô screams
	‚Ä¢	Dual-faced: Publicly charming and clownish in the circus; privately monstrous and calculating
	‚Ä¢	Thrill-seeker: Driven by the sensation of having life in his control‚Äîcollects fingers based on aesthetic and emotional significance
	‚Ä¢	Escapist dependency: Uses intoxicants to repress urges, but inevitably relapses‚Äîspirals when vulnerable
	‚Ä¢	Identity collapse: Cast off ‚ÄúKenneth‚Äù entirely, living solely as ‚ÄúThe Clown‚Äù‚Äîa persona without conscience  Ôøº

‚∏ª

Abilities & Weapons
	‚Ä¢	Weapon ‚Äì Madame Butterfly: A curved bladed knife, stylized in carnival-theme style, used in basic attacks  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Power ‚Äì Afterpiece Tonic:
	1.	Purple tonic: deploys gas that slows, blinds, and forces Survivors to cough (revealing location).
	2.	Yellow tonic: throwing this encourages temporary speed boost through gas clouds  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Unique perks:
	‚Ä¢	Bamboozle: Blocks vault windows and increases vaulting speed.
	‚Ä¢	Coulrophobia: (Likely increases generators‚Äô terror or healing penalties).
	‚Ä¢	Pop‚ÄØGoes‚ÄØthe‚ÄØWeasel: Damages a generator after hooking Survivor  Ôøº

‚∏ª

Lore & Favorite Things
	‚Ä¢	Cocktail of chaos: He is a craft chemist‚Äîexpert in anesthetics, poisons, and noxious mixtures
	‚Ä¢	Finger fetish: Keeps a collection of severed, ‚Äúperfect‚Äù fingers; each tied to a memory or grudge  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Drinks & drugs: Favorite vices include strong alcohol, junk food, and recreational drugs‚Äîused as coping mechanisms  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Circus performances: Mastered sleight-of-hand tricks, trapeze sabotage (once causing fatal accident), illusions‚Äîblended performance with murder  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Favorite items: His circus makeup, greasy clown coat, tonic bottles, and his greased knife‚Äîextensions of his identity

‚∏ª

In‚ÄëGame Role & Design
	‚Ä¢	Playstyle: Tactical zone-control Killer; throws tonic bottles to disrupt and funnel survivors  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Visual design: Deranged clown with smeared makeup, ragged ringmaster attire soaked in grime, carrying vials and his knife
	‚Ä¢	Audio: Heavy breathing, maniacal laughter, squeaking bottle sounds, coughing survivors‚Äîenhances horror tone

‚∏ª

‚úÖ Summary

Kenneth Chase / Jeffrey Hawk is a chilling embodiment of sadistic duality‚Äîcompelled by childhood trauma, fueled by chemicals and cruelty, hiding behind a false funhouse grin. As The Clown, he‚Äôs a master of manipulation: both a chemist who cripples survivors with toxic gas and a savage with a twisted fetish for fingers. His lore, appearance, personality, and toolkit combine into one of Dead by Daylight‚Äôs most disturbing and thematically cohesive killers.

This article is about the first of all Titans. For the 104th Training Corps graduate, see Ymir. For other subjects by the name of Ymir or the Founding Titan, see Ymir (Disambiguation) or Founding Titan (Disambiguation) respectively. -----
Founding Titans
‚óÑ Preceded by	Ymir Fritz	Followed by ‚ñ∫
None	One of her daughters, eventually Karl Fritz
You're no slave. You're no god. You're just a person. You don't need to serve anyone. You can be the one to choose.
EREN YEAGER URGES YMIR TO BE FREE

Ymir Fritz („É¶„Éü„É´„Éª„Éï„É™„ÉÉ„ÉÑ Yumiru Furittsu?) was the first person to obtain the power of the Titans.[5][6] She was a slave of the Eldian king, who abused her power to bring prosperity to Eldia while devastating Marley and the rest of the world. Thirteen years after awakening her power, she died protecting the king; her corpse was then forcibly cannibalized by their daughters, Maria, Rose, and Sheena. Her powers then split into what eventually became known as the Nine Titans.[5][7][8]

Upon her death, Ymir was transported to the Coordinate, where she molded Titans out of the sands and obeyed the royal family whenever they sought the Founder's power.[9]

Appearance

Human

Ymir Fritz was small in stature with light hair. She had straight cut bangs with shoulder-length hair that later grew down to her shoulder blades with age. As a slave, she wore tattered clothing with a cloth headband, sash belt, and leather sandals laced above her ankles. After entering the favor of the Eldian King in adolescence and adulthood, Ymir wore a sleeveless dress with thin decorative bands around each arm. Like all slaves of the Eldian tribe, her tongue was cut out when she was captured, though it may have regenerated after acquiring the power of the Titans.

In posthumous illustrations depicting Ymir Fritz, she is shown as a young girl wearing white robes. In the book Frieda Reiss reads to Historia Reiss, Ymir is dark-haired, whereas in the book Yeager reads to Grisha Yeager, she is fair-haired.

Titan

Ymir Fritz's Titan form was enormous in size with light hair, a typically female figure, and long, protruding ribs. Her Titan's face possessed no apparent skin, musculature or eyes, leaving only a visible skull.

In posthumous illustrations, Ymir's Titan form is highly romanticized with more human features.

Personality

Being a subject of ancient history, there are various interpretations of who Ymir really was. Frieda Reiss described Ymir as a kind girl who was always thinking of others.[2][10] Eldians speak of Ymir with great reverence, praising her accomplishments for their people. On the other hand, the Marleyan propaganda maintains that Ymir was a pawn of the Devil, with whom she had made a deal, causing her and all her subjects to be despised by much of the world.

In reality, she was a slave with no will of her own.[11] She submitted to the Eldian king in life, building him his empire, brutally destroying his enemies, and bearing his children as he commanded.[12] Ymir even went so far as to sacrifice her own life for his.[13] Even in death, her soul remained blindly obedient to the Eldian royal family, creating Titans by hand for about 2,000 years in the unknown land surrounding the Coordinate.[11]

Despite not being able to fully understand her, Eren states that Ymir loved Fritz despite his poor treatment of her and his responsibility for destroying her hometown which led to the death of her parents. She was also willing to carry out his will for generations while waiting for someone to release her from the agony of love and yearned for that freedom.[14]
History

Eldia enslaving Ymir's village
Ymir was enslaved by the Eldians
Around 2,000 years ago, Ymir's village was attacked and enslaved by the Eldians, who also murdered her parents and cut out the tongues of the survivors.[15][3]

One night, Ymir opened the gate to a pen, allowing for some pigs to escape.[16] Later, the tribe's ruler, Fritz, questioned the slaves on the culprit. The slaves pointed to Ymir, who was released only to be hunted down for sport.[17]

Wounded and desperate, Ymir found an unusually large tree with a chasm at its base. Seeking shelter, she stepped inside and, not knowing of the sinkhole beneath, fell down into a pool of liquid. There, a mysterious spine-like creature fused with her and turned her into the first Titan.[18]

With her newfound power, Ymir returned to serve Fritz and used her Titan to cultivate the land, build bridges, and amass wealth for the Eldians. Under his command, she also vanquished the armies of Eldia's rival, Marley. To "reward" Ymir for her service, Fritz took her as his concubine and together, they had three children: Maria, Rose, and Sheena.[19] It was speculated that during this time, Ymir grew to genuinely love and care for Fritz despite his behavior and attitude towards her.[3]

Maria, Rose, and Sheena cannibalize Ymir
Ymir's corpse was forcibly cannibalized by her daughters
Thirteen years after acquiring the power of the Titans, Ymir died while thwarting an assassination attempt on Fritz, but then found herself in a mysterious, barren land. King Fritz then forced his daughters to eat their mother's corpse in an attempt to preserve the power of the Titans. He commanded his daughters to continuously reproduce, to have their children eat their spines upon their deaths and perpetuate this ritual from child to child so that Ymir's blood would not die out and Eldia could rule forever with its Titans.

Ymir's power was divided into the Nine Titans; and she continued to serve her descendants, building them Titans whenever they invoked the power of the Titans.[9][20]
Mythology

Ymir Fritz makes a deal with the Devil
Marleyan interpretation of Ymir
By the Eldians, Ymir's existence is hailed as a god-given miracle.[21] The Restorationists claimed that she and all Subjects of Ymir are "the chosen children of God"[22] and that any atrocities Marley claims Eldia had committed could not have been possible because Ymir would not have allowed it.[23] There was even an Eldian cult that worshiped Ymir as a goddess.[24]

On the other hand, the Marleyans believe she received her powers from a deal with the "Devil of All Earth"[5] and used this to ostracize the Eldians.

There are also those who believe that Ymir contacted the "source of all living matter" to gain her power. This theory is relatively unheard of, as Grisha Yeager was unaware of it until Eren Kruger told him.[6]

Ymir Fritz's story
"Krista" in Frieda's storybook
Many centuries later, Frieda Reiss would visit her half-sister Historia Reiss on the farm where she was raised. During some of her visits, Frieda told Historia the story of Ymir's deal with the Devil; however, in the book she showed her, Ymir is named "Krista".[1] Frieda advised Historia that she must be lady-like, as "Krista" was. She spoke of "Krista" as being an altruistic girl and urged Historia to be loving and beloved like her when she is grown. However, Historia did not remember these visits since Frieda used the Founding Titan's power to erase her memories after every visit. Historia would only recall vague images of "Krista" in the years to come.[25][26]

Legacy

Return to Shiganshina arc

Nine Titans
Ymir Fritz stands above the Nine Titans
Some years later, when the Survey Corps discovers Grisha Yeager's basement, they find three journals.[27] Within Grisha's writings, he recounts his childhood when he was told the story of Ymir and her people by his father.[28] Grisha writes of joining the Eldian Restorationists in the nation of Marley several years afterward, learning of the supposed great accomplishments achieved in Ymir's time. Together with the resistance, Grisha declares that they must venture to Paradis Island, where Ymir's descendants had fled eighty years ago, in order to retrieve the Founding Titan and bring back the nation of Eldia.[29]

War for Paradis arc

While on the verge of death from Levi's Thunder Spear, Zeke Yeager would awaken in an unknown land to discover Ymir resculpting his damaged body with earth.[30]

During the assault on Shiganshina, Zeke and his younger half-brother Eren Yeager are able to make contact with each other and activate the Founder before awakening in the Paths. As Ymir approaches, Eren notices her presence. Zeke explains that she is in fact the Founder herself. He then asks Eren to go ahead with the Euthanasia Plan. Eren refuses and demands that Ymir lend him her strength, but his pleas are ignored. Zeke subsequently reveals he has nullified the vow to renounce war through Ymir, who obeys only the royal family, her descendants. She promptly restrains Eren with her chains.[31]

After Zeke shows Eren the memories of their father Grisha, Zeke realizes that Eren was responsible for Grisha's actions against the Reiss family and that his ultimate goal is inevitable. In a panic, Zeke orders Ymir to sterilize the Subjects of Ymir; and Ymir approaches the Coordinate of converging paths to fulfill Zeke's will.[32]

Ymir is freed
Ymir chooses to help Eren
Eren manages to break free from his chains and reach Ymir before Zeke. Realizing that Ymir has a will of her own, Eren embraces her and asks her to help him rather than try to order her. As Zeke desperately tries to stop them, Eren asks Ymir if she was the one who called him to the Coordinate, musing that she has been waiting 2000 years for him to arrive. Ymir begins crying.

Back in Shiganshina, Eren's head is reconnected to his body. As everyone looks on in shock, the Wall crumbles, releasing a horde of Colossus Titans as Eren forms a new Titan body.[33]

A while later, as Eren leads the Titans in the Rumbling, an apparition of Ymir is seen by a boy in the moment he is crushed to death under a Titan's foot.[34]

As Eren converses with his friends in the Paths, Ymir emerges next to Eren in the Coordinate, symbolizing their cooperation.[35]

As the Warrior unit along with members of Survey Corps engage numerous Titans on top the Founding Titan in an attempt to reach Eren at Fort Salta, Ymir appears and is briefly seen by Armin Arlert who speculates she is the one summoning the previous incarnations of the Nine Titans.[36]

Mikasa kisses Eren goodbye
Ymir is freed following Mikasa's choice to kill the one she loves
After Mikasa Ackerman kills Eren, Ymir appears behind her, smiling as she watches Mikasa kiss Eren farewell.[37]

Immediately afterwards, Ymir relinquishes the Power of the Titans from the world. Watching Mikasa kill the one she loves was enough to release Ymir from the love she had for Fritz, who only wanted to exploit her power.[38]

As Mikasa departs from the battlefield, Ymir appears to her. Mikasa understands that Ymir's love for Fritz was a nightmare that she cannot undo; she instead thanks Ymir for bringing the life into the world which allowed for her to be born. Ymir then envisions a different outcome where she lets King Fritz get impaled by the spear, consoling her three daughters, and subsequently vanishes at last.[39]

Abilities

Power of the Titans

The first Titan
Ymir's gigantic Titan
Ymir was the very first Titan and the only one to ever possess the complete power of the Titans; all who came after her merely possessed fragments of her power. Her Titan body was immense, even by Titan standards, and easily towered above the treeline. Using her immense strength, she effortlessly wiped out Marley's forces. She was also very skilled at controlling her Titan, as she performed complex tasks such as building bridges across mountains and cultivating the fields.[40]

It is said that nobody could surpass Ymir, and that because Ymir died 13 years after awakening her powers, no one was allowed to live beyond that; this phenomenon was known as the "Curse of Ymir."[7]

Ymir sculps the Wall Titans
Ymir building the Wall Titans for Karl Fritz
After Ymir's death, her spirit lived on in a world where the Coordinate resides.[41] She was responsible for all Titan transformations throughout history: whenever the power of the Titans was invoked, she built the Titan bodies out of the otherworldly sand.[9] She was also responsible for regeneration and re-sculpted Zeke's body after he was blown up.[42] It reportedly took Ymir a very long time to create these bodies: Zeke said it took her "years" to build him a single human body, but because the world in which she lived transcends time, the process was almost an instant in the physical world.[42] According to Zeke, Ymir could create anything, even chains that represent the "vow of renouncing war."[43]

Ymir was also the source of the Founding Titan's power. From controlling other Titans to creating the Wall Titans to altering the bodies of the Subjects of Ymir, all of the Founding Titan's feats were done by Ymir after she was given the order, either by a scream or in person through the world where Ymir resided.[44] However, because Ymir was Fritz's slave, she only listened to the commands of the royal family; thus, only the royal family could use the Founder's power.[11]

Eren Yeager became the exception to this, as he invoked the Founder on two occasions. The first was when he punched Dina Fritz's Pure Titan and commanded Ymir to make the surrounding Titans attack Dina; after she was killed, he turned them against Reiner Braun.[45] The second was when Eren convinced Ymir that she had a will of her own, freeing her from the royal family's control, and she lent her power to Eren instead of Zeke

Eren Yeager („Ç®„É¨„É≥„Éª„Ç§„Çß„Éº„Ç¨„Éº Eren YƒìgƒÅ?) was a former member of the Survey Corps. He was the main protagonist of Attack on Titan. He lived in Shiganshina District with his parents until the fall of Wall Maria, where he impotently witnessed his mother being eaten by a Titan.[33] This event would lead to Eren's intense hatred towards the Titans as he swore to wipe all of them off the face of the Earth.[34]

Soon afterward, his father, Grisha Yeager, found him and gave him the key to his basement, instructing Eren to find it at all costs and retake Wall Maria.[35] He then injected Eren with a Titan serum.[35]

In the year 847, Eren, Mikasa Ackerman, and Armin Arlert joined the 104th Training Corps. The three graduated with Eren ranking 5th best,[36] and they joined the Survey Corps following the battle of Trost District.[37]

After finding the basement and unlocking his father's memories, Eren learned about the truth of what the Titans are, as well as the history of Eldia and Marley. Eren then vowed to free his home from their true enemy: the rest of humanity that lives across the ocean.[38]

Eren possessed the power of three Titans. From his father, Eren inherited the Attack and Founding Titans.[39] After eating Lara Tybur during the Raid on Liberio, he gained the War Hammer Titan as well.[8]



ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance


00:00

41:20

Human form

Eren's appearance in manga
Eren shortly before graduating the 104th Training Corps
Eren was a young man of average height and muscular build. His facial features strongly resembled his mother's; he had a reasonably long, rounded face and sizable, expressive, gray eyes. His hair was short and black, and his bangs fell in a natural, middle-parted, curtain-type style. After his training and during his time as a soldier, he became very physically fit and muscular, although this was often unseen due to his relatively baggy clothing.[40] After the four-year time skip, Eren grew his hair down to his neck.

Eren was first seen wearing typical townsfolk attire that consisted of brown trousers, a green shirt with string tassels at the collar, a reddish-brown coat, and simple brown shoes. A few years before the fall of Wall Maria, he also wore a black scarf, which he gave to Mikasa Ackerman the day they met. As a teenager, he was often seen in the typical Survey Corps uniform while training. His casual attire consisted of a long beige shirt identical to the one he wore in his first appearance, a maroon sash around his waist, white trousers, and brown knee-high boots. He always kept the key given to him by his father dangling around his neck on a string.[41]

By the time Eren infiltrates Marley in the year 854, Eren had grown visibly taller, and his hair has grown down to shoulder length. He had a slight mustache and goatee, as well as bandages that cover his forehead and left eye. To maintain his cover, he wore the Eldian armband around his left arm, though he had initially worn the armband around his right arm before it got corrected by Falco Grice.[42] After returning to Paradis Island, Eren discarded his Survey Corps attire and began wearing a white shirt with dark pants underneath a simple black mantle.[43] He tied his hair back into a bun and shaved off his mustache and goatee.[44]

Attack Titan form

Armin and Titan Eren
Eren as a Titan
Eren's appearance changes quite drastically when he transformed into the Attack Titan. His height increased to 15 m, his hair grew long enough to graze his shoulders, and his tongue and ears became elongated. His facial features also underwent a transformation; he developed a prominent, hooked nose, his eyes became deeply sunken within their sockets, and his mouth took on an unusual, jagged shape that was unsuited for intelligible speech. Despite this, he was capable of howling and roaring in order to express his exhaustion and anger. In addition, he also lacked lips and flesh on his cheeks, so his teeth were exposed.

Similarly to past Attack Titan holders, Eren's Titan form was well-proportioned and physically fit, sporting a well-defined, lean, and muscular appearance in lieu of the more common pot-bellied or emaciated appearances of regular Titans.[45]

Founding Titan form

Eren's Founding Titan, dubbed the End Titan[9], was drastically different than Ymir Fritz's Founding Titan, or any other Titan for that matter. Initially, much of the Titan was shrouded by the steam from the Wall Titans, but its sheer size was immediately noted, towering over the horde of Wall Titans. What appeared to be the torso was devoid of flesh, resembling an enormous ribcage. The knobs of the backbone and ribs were grossly lengthened; the ribs reaching the ground while the arch of the spine extended far into the sky. The pelvis and legs were greatly undersized however, seemingly useless. Despite this, they were still taller than any Wall Titan. [46]

The upper body seemed proportional with the legs, meaning that they were dwarfed by the "ribcage" (although it was revealed that the "ribcage" arose from the lower back). The head was the only part of the body with much flesh, although it was significantly deformed: both the ears and hair were greatly elongated; the cheeks were missing, exposing the molars; and the bottom jaw was nearly bare, only the lips and chin being present. Like a puppet, the upper body was suspended by sinew, supported by the vertebral knobs like a suspension bridge. Inside the Titan, Eren's head was disconnected from his torso; having been decapitated and rejoined by Ymir's power, it was connected by additional vertebrae to what presumably was his body. Some sinew supports his scalp.

The Titan walked with its "ribcage", undulating the ribs like a millipede's legs. It was fast enough to keep within view of the Rumbling.[47]

Pure Titan form

Eren's Pure Titan form was much shorter than his current Titan form. It was 4 m[12] tall with short, rugged hair and a jagged, lipless mouth that exposed his teeth. His Pure Titan form also had a big head, elongated ears, and an overall stocky build.

ADVERTISEMENT

Personality

Eren vows to kill all the Titans
Eren expresses his desire to kill the Titans
Eren was best described as hardheaded, strong-willed, passionate, and impulsive, which are attributes of both his strong determination to protect mankind and, eventually, his equally strong determination to escape the Walls. Even as a young child, he was so intent on joining the Survey Corps that he argued with and shouted at his mother, referring to the people in the village as "silly" and comparing them to complacent livestock.[48]

Eren cared deeply for his friends and family, risking harm and even death in order to protect them. As a child, he took on larger boys who bullied Armin Arlert and, more tragically, he attempted to lift the rubble that crushed his mother during the Titans' assault in Shiganshina.[49] Eren was also capable of displaying violent behavior in defense of people he did not even know. This was highlighted when he attempted to rescue Mikasa Ackerman by brutally slaughtering two of the human traffickers who had captured her.[50]

After Armin showed Eren a book depicting the wonders of the outside world, he grew to share his friend's curiosity of the world beyond the Walls and decided to see it for himself.[51] This led Eren to develop a scornful attitude towards anyone who was content to live and die within the Walls' confines without ever setting foot outside. As a result of this, he greatly admired the soldiers of the Survey Corps, regarding them as "heroes" and wishing to join their ranks as soon as he became eligible for enrollment. He was quick to take offense when anyone spoke badly of the Corps, and his determination to join them caused friction between himself, his mother, and to a lesser extent, Mikasa.[52]

Eren has a marked lack of self-restraint that often led him into trouble, causing his friends and family to worry about him.[53] His limited self-control was evident in his temper, which often caused him to act recklessly in anger, or say things he himself knew he should not have. This was exacerbated by his tendency to view the world in terms of black and white, where individuals who deny others their freedom were worthless scum, unfit to be left alive.[54] Though he had great compassion, Eren had little in the way of empathy and was prone to taking things at face value, evaluating situations or ideas solely by his own arbitrary perspective and rarely ever thought deeper about them unless someone else pointed things out for him.[55]

Though Eren spoke about eradicating the Titans with seemingly great confidence, his bravado hid deep insecurities. He was often ready to blame himself and his incompetence whenever something went wrong, believing a course of action he took - or failed to take - was the reason for the disastrous results. This was most evident when he blamed himself for the death of the Special Operations Squad at the hands of the Female Titan, and for the deaths of the many veterans that perished in the rescue operation after he had been kidnapped by Reiner Braun and Bertolt Hoover.

Eren asking Historia to eat him
Eren asks Historia to eat him and save humanity
Eren's ordeals since the coup d'√©tat have mellowed his personality considerably. When he discovered the truth about where his father had been the night Wall Maria fell, he was willing to ask Historia Reiss to eat him for the good of humanity.[56] He admitted that he viewed himself as weak, and that his reliance on the Attack Titan proved it. It took a lot of encouragement from his friends for him to overcome this state of despair and regain his passion.

By the time he found out from his father's books that Titans were actually humans who were forced to transform by the Marleyan Government, he seemed to have let go of his hatred against them. When passing by a slow-moving Titan en route to the ocean, he showed no signs of anger or unrest, and instead calmly called the Titan an "Eldian."[57]

Eren possesses great amounts of perseverance, fortitude, and determination. As such, he managed to master the basics of vertical maneuvering equipment, even when his equipment was damaged,[58] and graduate as fifth top trainee in his class despite his lack of natural talent.[59]

Eren had been noted to be quite charismatic and had a talent for delivering impassioned speeches, often unwittingly managing to persuade the mass of his listeners to sympathize with his point of view. Even Jean Kirstein, his bitter rival, had admitted this, as he convinced over half a dozen recruits to consider joining the Survey Corps before the Battle of Trost.[60] Four years later, he made use of this skill consciously, as shown when he easily lifted Falco's spirits and convinced him to deliver a letter outside of Liberio, despite the fact that Eldians were usually forbidden from leaving the internment zone.[61]

Eren locates Willy's sister
Eren figures out the true location of the War Hammer Titan
In the years since the recovery of Shiganshina, Eren had shown remarkable progress in his analytical and tactical skills, both in and outside of battle. Apart from maintaining his cover as a Marleyan soldier for an extended period of time and procuring a method of transporting his letters to the Survey Corps, Eren accurately guessed the source of Falco Grice's injuries and the reason why he wanted to become the next Armored Titan.[62] Later on, he successfully led Reiner into a trap, and in his battle against Lara Tybur, he quickly deduced the true location of the War Hammer Titan.[63] When he was unable to crack the crystal encasing her with his Attack Titan's jaws, he was resourceful enough to use the Jaw Titan's jaws as an improvised nutcracker to kill her and obtain the War Hammer Titan.[64]

Eren was aided in this by his unnervingly stoic and calm demeanor he developed since infiltrating Marley, never losing his composure and usually wearing a blank expression on his face, no matter how dire or stressful the situation may be. Although he admitted to becoming angry when Koslow traumatized Eldian soldiers, he remained outwardly unfazed during the incident. Additionally, he appeared to have become less proud overall, thanking Mikasa for helping him, which he normally used to dislike and criticize her for.[65]

His infiltration of Marley had given him a change in perspective regarding his enemies. After spending time as a Marleyan soldier, he came to understand that his enemies were people no different from his own. Because of this, he deeply empathized with Reiner and the other Warriors who were sent to Paradis Island, letting go of his desire to kill them in revenge for attacking his home and stating that they were simply victims. Nevertheless, he still prioritized his personal mission of destroying Paradis' enemies for the sake of his and his people's freedom,[66] regardless of how many lives were lost on either side. Furthermore, this personal mission had driven him enough that he unleashed all of the Wall Titans and declared he will trample the entire world to exterminate all life outside of the island

Eren was ready and willing to use many unethical means to achieve his goals, such as when he declared war against Marley, making the entire world his enemy. Eren abused the young child Falco's trust, fully aware of his family's precarious situation, and eventually killed numerous of innocent Eldian civilians (including children) as collateral damage in a surprise attack on Willy Tybur.[68]

In spite of this, he seemed to have developed a dislike for war, referring to it as "hell." He believed that, with good reason, no one would want to go to war if they knew the suffering it would put them through.[69] He also showed sympathy for the Eldians living in the world's internment zones, as well as towards Ramzi and his refugee family living without freedom in Marley. While walking through Marley he expressed regret and inner conflict with his future actions towards people outside the Walls as he recognized many of them were innocent people.

Eren's time-serving in the Marley Mid-East War also seemed to have had an effect on his psyche to some extent. While he had shown great sorrow for comrades who have died on expeditions,[70] and had demonstrated a great amount of compassion for his fellow graduates from the 104th,[71] he laughed upon hearing that Sasha Blouse's final words were "meat;" although he changed his reaction and was seen about to cry after Jean Kirstein accused him of being responsible for her death and remembered Sasha's conviction that they would have more sheep and cows after recovering Wall Maria.
