Human form

Annie is a teenage girl of considerably short height with a small, yet very muscular build and physique. She has moderately short hair that is often tied at the back with her right fringe mainly draping over the right side of her face (though she tends to push it to the side on occasion; possibly for better visibility). She has an oval-shaped face, blonde hair, blue eyes, a

Roman nose
, and pale complexion. Her hair color is noticeably paler than most other blonde-haired characters and when untied, her hair reaches down the nape of her neck. Her eyes, although of considerable size and proportion, often have a sullen vibe to their appearance. Annie's casual attire mainly consists of a hooded sweatshirt underneath a jacket accompanied by dark gray pants. She is often seen in the Cadet Corps uniform and then the Military Police Regiment uniform after graduation. Though Annie often wears hooded sweatshirts as part of her standard attire, she also wears her signature white hooded sweatshirt as part of her standard military attire. During her missions as the Female Titan, it is implied that she always wears her ring which has a small, folding blade on her right index finger; using it as her primary source of causing self-injury in order to transform into her Female Titan form at any time.

Four years later after being freed from her crystalized stasis, Annie no longer keeps her hair up and lets it hang loose. She still wears her Military Police uniform and gains a brown cloak. Later, she maintains her white hooded sweatshirt with a shoulder holster and a revamped black pants worn by the 104th Cadet Corps when she sided with the others to stop Eren.

Female Titan form

Annie's appearance as the Female Titan changed quite drastically, though her overall physique and facial features remained mostly the same. Her body consisted mainly of exposed muscle tissue, in which there was a noticeably limited amount of skin coverage across her body, and fingers made out of bone. Along with a massive increase in height, her face was laden with muscle lining, notably underneath her cheeks, giving her the capability to stretch her mouth far more than it seemed possible, along with yellowish teeth. Compared to the majority of other Titans encountered, Annie's Titan form seemed much more physically fit and stronger, bearing a lean build with visible muscle definition and a feminine form.

ADVERTISEMENT

Personality

Annie is considered to be an isolated, exclusionary type; friendships do not come to her easily. She is rarely seen smiling and often has an emotionless expression. She is apathetic and somnolent, with little desire to put in any effort into meaningless disciplines or activities, and instead focuses exclusively on making it into the Military Police Regiment to obtain an easy life.[9] Yet, she somehow does seem to hold a strange fascination and even feelings of respect towards people that have a deep sense of duty and righteousness - in those people who do care and who can devote their lives and even die for causes they believe in.

Annie's sense of humor tends to be mocking, sarcastic, deadpan, and surprising. It also sometimes expresses a partial truth, and it happens mostly in intense situations. For example, when she was cornered by the Scouts in front of an underground passage.

Despite Annie's usual cold and calm demeanor, she has been shown to emote her feelings in various ways. At the times she does lose her composure, she usually reacts with violence. She beats up Reiner Braun for his cowardice after Marcel was eaten and for trying to manipulate her to continue a mission that had, in her view, already failed.[10] She was clearly angered when Reiner teased her about her constant avoidance in hand-to-hand combat training.[4] Despite her seeming callousness, she has expressed a level of guilt and shock, most notably when apologizing to a certain corpse after the battle of Trost District.[11] Annie is also known to be very dedicated in her mission as a Warrior, to the point that she had killed many innocent people to reach her goal (also attempting to kill many of her former comrades), and shed tears when she failed to capture Eren.[12] However, she is not entirely remorseless; while she carried out her duty of disposing of her former comrade Marco, she did so with great distress and shed anguished tears at the sight of him being eaten. This incident would haunt her for some time afterwards. Though she is seemingly indifferent towards her capability as a competent hand-to-hand combat fighter, she remains proud of her skills and even appears to enjoy the very notion of fighting as deduced by Eren.[13]

Annie is highly intelligent, able to think deeply about situations, and has shown considerable problem-solving ability and a quick wit. These personality traits, in conjunction with her calm attitude and analytical skills, make her a good tactician. While undercover as a refugee, and later as a trainee, she does most of the spy work for the Warriors. Annie also realizes the contradictions of the military training system within the Walls and is not fooled by the Marleyan propaganda. However, she is a bad liar, being called out on this by both Eren and Kenny, the former regarding her apathy towards her martial arts prowess, and the latter when she lies about being his daughter, even sarcastically insisting further. On the other hand, she is very good at spotting the lies of other people, seen when she realizes Armin Arlelt's dishonesty far before they had even reached the underground tunnel, as well as Reiner's lie about befriending their fellow cadets as being nothing more than a pragmatic attempt to gain their trust.[14][10]

She is extremely practical and self-aware, being honest about her strengths and weaknesses, and is rarely ever prone to self-deception or emotional mistakes. Furthermore, she had a casual acceptance of her negative personality traits, freely admitting her faults even to almost-complete strangers such as Marlo Freudenberg, calling herself worthless and evil with no hint of self-loathing. She is nevertheless capable of self-loathing, as seen when she claimed to be as selfish as the Marleyan government.[10]

Nonetheless, what drives Annie more than anything is her desire for a normal life. Though she has no love for Marley itself, the only reason she is so concentrated on her mission is that it because it would allow her to go back home to her father, and she had urged Reiner several times before her eventual capture to return to Marley with the information they had gathered so far; despite her otherwise cynical and realist worldview, Annie managed to convince herself of the false notion that it would be enough to avoid punishment.[10] When she lost Eren due to the actions of both Mikasa and Levi in the Titan Forest, Annie saw the easiest chance to return to her father was gone and she began visibly crying in her Titan form.[12]

After escaping her confinement, Annie undergoes a significant change in character, becoming more open about working with her former friends to stop the actions of Eren and the Jaegerists. She also freely acknowledges to Hitch that she has committed unforgivable acts, something Annie normally would have kept to herself. Later, as the Wall Titans trample through Marley, she admits to Armin that she genuinely appreciated him visiting her for the past four years she was enclosed inside her crystal. Annie also tells him she sees herself as a monster.[15]
ADVERTISEMENT

History

Annie as a infant
Annie sometime after her birth
After Annie's birth, her blood test revealed she was a Subject of Ymir, which suggested her mother had an affair with an Eldian man. While it is unknown what happened to her mother, Annie was deported to the internment zone and later adopted by Leonhart who was relocated for similar reasons. Her adoptive father intended to train her to become a Warrior so that he could live a privileged life. Thus, from a young age, Annie underwent rigorous combat training with Leonhart.[3]

Annie would eventually become as strong as he wanted; but in retaliation for all she had endured, she attacked him and left him permanently crippled. The brutal training she endured left her callous towards others, unable to find any value in whether one lived or died.[3]

Annie beats her father
Annie cripples her father
In her early childhood, Annie was relentlessly subjected to combat training in her hometown by her father, who reminded her often of the mission she was born to carry out.[16][14] At one point during Annie's training, her father pushed her too far during a training session, causing her to snap and attack him, savagely beating him while he was down to where she crippled him.[17][3] At some point, Annie was chosen by the Marleyan government to inherit the power of the Female Titan.

Alongside the rest of her Warrior comrades, the six Titans in Marley's command used their powers to crush Mid East Forces, testing their abilities in the process. The six Warriors proved themselves to be more effective weapons than their predecessors, largely alleviating Marley's concerns about entrusting the upcoming Paradis Island Operation to children.[10]

Young Annie and her father
Annie's father apologized and made her promise to return home
In the year 845, Annie set out on a mission to exterminate humanity within the Walls and retrieve the Founding Titan, along with her childhood friends, Reiner Braun, Bertholdt Hoover and Marcel Galliard, the wielders of the Armored Titan, Colossal Titan, and Jaw Titan. Before her departure, her father apologized for his actions and asked for her to return home alive, assuring her that her father would always be on her side.[13]

On their journey, the four young Warriors were ambushed by a Titan slumbering in the earth that tried to devour Reiner. As he stood in fear, Reiner was almost killed until Marcel pushed him away but was grabbed and devoured instead while Reiner, Bertholdt, and Annie watched in horror.[18]

Annie beats up Reiner
Annie beat up Reiner
After escaping from the Titan, Annie is able to find Reiner and angrily attacks him for his cowardice. She argues that they should retrieve the Jaw Titan's new wielder and return to Marley, but Reiner attempts to manipulate her into continuing the mission. Annie continues to beat him, saying that she never bought into Marley's brainwashing propaganda. Reiner manages to win the scuffle and forces Annie and Bertholdt to continue the mission, telling them that Marley would kill them if they flee now and that this was the only way they could ever go home

9.content:
Unlike the typical Titan which attacked and devoured humans on sight, Abnormal Titans may have chosen to ignore lone or isolated humans and exhibited unpredictable behavior; often resulting in them causing larger damage as they disrupted important strategic locations. Some of these uncommon behaviors were speed-walking or running, performing great jumps, directly killing their victims before eating, and even speaking human language.[1] Abnormal Titans, like its Pure counterparts, resembled nude humans. They were bipedal though a few were quadrupedal, with the limbs and features one would expect in humans; however, they were all variously deformed to some extent in body proportions (enlarged head, small limbs, etc). Abnormal's had a masculine body type lacking all reproductive organs and in some specific cases resembled the Colossal Titan.


ADVERTISEMENT

Story

History

The earliest known Abnormal's were the Wall Titan's that were created by the 145th King Karl Fritz in year 743, they were commanded into hardening into three concentric Walls outside of Paradis Island.[2]

The Fall of Shiganshina arc

During the Fall of Wall Maria, An abnormal Smiling Titan breaches through the Walls and headed straight for the Jaeger family's house. It was spotted by Eren Jaeger and Mikasa Ackermann who attempted to rescue his mother stuck underneath the rubble, Hannes initially attempts to kill the Titan before hes struck by fear, opting to take Eren and Mikasa to safety, leaving Eren's mother behind. Afterward, Eren witnesses the Titan pull his mother out of the debris, as it proceeds to crush her and devour her shortly thereafter.[3]

Ilse's Notebook: Notes from a Scout Regiment Member

During the 49th expedition outside the Walls, Hange Zo√´ among other members of Levi's squad encounter an Abnormal Titan that, after chasing Hange, suddenly turns around and heads back into the forest. Hange follows it deep into the forest and it stops within a field. After a brief delay, it begins banging its head on a tree within the center of the field. Hange and company get off their horses and tries to ask it what is its purpose is but is interrupted when it swings at them. After using their omni-directional mobility gear to escape to a tree, they again come down to the ground and try to talk to it before Oruo attempts to kill it. When Hange pleas him to stop he becomes distracted and is captured and almost eaten before Levi appears and cuts off its arm and then kills it. After Levi expresses his outrage towards Hange's incompetence for her teammates' safety, Petra shockingly points out a decapitated corpse hidden within a hole in the tree. They then find a lost diary on the ground that belonged to Ilse Langnar before her death.

Ilse writes down her last moments
The abnormal Titan communicates with Ilse Langnar
Hange reads the diary. It explains that after Ilse's entire flank was massacred, she fled to a nearby forest, heading north. After profuse running, she inadvertently runs into a Titan and writes in the diary, believing it to be her end. She remarks that instead of immediately eating her, it hesitates. It then addresses her, saying "Ymir's people" and "Ymir-sama," greeting her with deep respect, and bows. She is thoroughly confused that the Titan can form speech, and writes in her diary that she has attempted communication. She first questions it about what the Titans are, and building up blind sadness, fear and rage, she angrily yells why Titans eat humans and what their objective is. The Titan appears more and more frustrated as it moans and tears at its cheeks, ripping off flesh and spraying blood. Ilse attempts to flee but is caught by the Titan, who is rapidly crushing her skull, and Ilse writes down her last few notes about the experience before being decapitated, while the Titan seemingly cries. The Titan later stores her corpse in the tree. Nothing is known about the Titan's motive and actions, but Ilse's notes prove significantly useful to humanity.[4]

The Struggle for Trost arc

After the breach caused by the Colossal Titan and subsequent invasion of Shiganshina District, a horde of Titans entered through the destroyed gate.[3] They are notable for entering the district almost immediately after the breach, and it is theorized by Armin that they were somehow lured in.[5]

Mikasa vs titan
Mikasa killing an abnormal Titan
As Eren Jaeger's group was heading towards the middle guard in the Trost District, an Abnormal Titan jumped out of nowhere and grabbed Thomas Wagner in its mouth. The rest of the group looked on, horrified, as the Titan swallowed him whole.[6] The same Titan would later appear, where it would be killed by Eren in his Titan form.[7]

Another Abnormal Titan appeared and charged straight towards the rear exit of Trost, where a group of citizens were gathered and trying to escape. It ran so fast that the elite guards stationed in that area could not keep up with it. Mikasa Ackermann appeared and sliced the nape of its neck to kill it, dulling her blades in the process.[8]

The 57th Exterior Scouting Mission arc

An Abnormal Titan
An abnormal Titan during the Scout Regiment's 57th expedition
The Scout Regiment went on its expedition outside Wall Rose and on the way, an Abnormal suddenly appeared towards the right flank. It completely ignored the soldiers at the outer guard and charged straight towards the center of the formation. Armin Arlelt watched as Luke Cis and Dieter Ness attempted to kill it, cutting the tendons of its foot and making it fall, and successfully killing it. There is also a crawling Abnormal Titan which walks and runs on all fours and is capable of running at very high speeds. Its limbs are deformed giving it a spider-like gait and it is subdued by a team leader who leads it into a tree, knocking it unconscious.[5]

When Annie Leonhart attempted to escape the Scout Regiment by climbing the Walls, she damages part of the Wall, and a huge chunk is torn off, revealing the face of the Wall Titan.[9]

Clash of the Titans arc

Conny finds a Titan on top of his house
Conny finds an abnormal Titan on his house
Conny Springer encounters his mother's Titan form in Ragako village. Its arms and legs were shrunken and paralyzed, and it said: "welcome home."[1] It is later revealed that the Beast Titan is directly responsible for the humans-turned-Titans in the village.

When Miche Zacharius first encountered the Beast Titan, he believed it to be an Abnormal Titan due to the mass amount of fur on its body.[10]

After Eren and Ymir were kidnapped by Reiner and Bertholdt, they stopped by in the Titan Forest between Wall Rose and Wall Maria. As they were resting atop the branches, an Abnormal Titan was casually lying beneath them and appeared to be watching their every movement.[11]

Eren and Mikasa encounter the Smiling Titan after 5 years and witness it kill Hannes, before the same can be done to them Eren knowingly uses the Coordinate gaining control over the surrounding Titans. The ones that are under his control proceed to kill the Smiling Titan by ripping it to shreds and devouring it.[12]

Royal Government arc

Rod's Titan crawls towards Orvud
Rod's abnormal Titan crawling towards Orvud District
After drinking the serum that turns a person into a Titan, Rod Reiss turned into a gargantuan Titan twice as big as the Colossal Titan. He was so big that he could only crawl and his body generated enough heat to burn nearby trees instantly.

This Titan turned out to be an Abnormal Titan and it headed to the Orvud District, the nearest and most populated area, attracted by the amount of people in the city.[13] It completely ignored the concentrated cannon fire against it and just kept going towards the city. It was later slain by Historia Reiss.[14]

War for Paradis arc

During the Surprise attack on Paradis Eren and Zeke gain full power of the Founding Titan and undoes all the hardening on the Walls initiating the Rumbling. After releasing the Wall Titans Eren declares to all the Subjects of Ymir he will annihilate all life outside of Paradis Island.[15] In the following days, Conny returns to his mother's Titan in Ragako village attempting to feed a jaw Titan inheritor to it, before he is stopped by Armin.[16] During the Battle of Heaven and Earth, Eren and the Wall Titans have slaughtered 80% of humanity before his Titan's are forced to a halt after Zeke is willingly killed by Levi, severing Eren's control over them. After Eren himself is killed by Mikasa, the power of the titans ceases to be and all Titan types including Abnormals are erased from existence, by proxy Conny's mother is reverted back to a human

The vast majority of Titans had exceptionally wide mouths with an array of entirely sharp (in certain instances), or entirely flat teeth (which was more common in most observed titans). Abnormal's had a masculine body type lacking all reproductive organs and in some specific cases resembled the Colossus Titan.

As Eren Yeager's group was heading towards the middle guard in the Trost District, an abnormal Titan jumped out of nowhere and grabbed Thomas Wagner in its mouth. The rest of the group looked on, horrified, as the Titan swallowed him whole.[6] The same Titan would later appear, where it would be killed by Eren in his Titan form.[7]

The Female Titan arc

Armin Arlert watched as Luke Siss and Dita Ness attempted to kill it, cutting the tendons of its foot and making it fall, and successfully killing it.[9] There is also an abnormal Titan which walks and runs on it is hands and feet and is capable of running at very high speeds. Clash of the Titans arc

Royal Government arc

Rod Reiss character image (Titan)

After drinking the serum that turns a person into a Titan, Rod Reiss turned into a gargantuan Titan twice as big as the Colossus Titan. He was so big that he could only crawl and his body generated enough heat to burn nearby trees.

This Titan turned out to be an abnormal Titan and it headed to the Orvud District, the nearest and most populated area, attracted by the amount of people in the city.[16] It completely ignored the concentrated cannon fire against it and just kept going towards the city. After releasing the Wall Titans Eren declares to all the Subjects of Ymir he will annihilate all life outside of Paradis Island.[18] In the following days, Connie returns to his mother's Titan in Ragako village attempting to feed A jaw Titan inheritor to it, before he is stopped by Armin.[19] During the Battle of Heaven and Earth, Eren and the Wall Titans have slaughtered 80% of humanity before his Titan's are forced to a halt after Zeke is willingly killed by Levi, severing Eren's control over them. After Eren himself is killed by Mikasa, the power of the titans ceases to be and all Titan types including Abnormal's are reverted into humans, by proxy Connie's mother is reverted back to a human.[20] In retaliation for the Rumbling, the human turned Wall Titans are lynched by the survivors

It might be big, but that's it!
ABEL'S VIEW ON THE COLOSSAL TITAN

Abel („Ç¢„Éº„Éô„É´ ƒÄberu?)[1] was a soldier in the Scout Regiment Fourth Squad under the command of Hange Zo√´, who was noted for his trademark glasses, or "goggles." He participated in the 57th Exterior Scouting Mission and often accompanied higher-ups, such as Hange and Levi, on serious missions.


ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance


Honest Trailers Commentary | Team America: World Police

Unmute

Advanced Settings

Fullscreen

Play

Rewind 10 Seconds

Up Next
Brand logo


Abel was a man of average height, with light skin, short, blond hair, and light stubble on his chin and cheekbones. He was noted for always wearing thick-rimmed glasses with bands around his head, to prevent them from falling off in combat. His clothing consisted of the typical uniform of the Scout Regiment with the green cloak worn on expeditions.
Personality

Abel was a serious man and a devoted Scout Regiment member, always acting bravely in battle and following his duties as a soldier. He seemed to be a loyal and reliable subordinate, since he was trusted to accompany high ranking members in critical situations.
Story

The 57th Exterior Scouting Mission arc

Goggles and his comrades begin to intercept the Titans
Abel intercepts the Titans that are after the Female Titan
During the 57th Exterior Scouting Mission, Abel serves as part of the cart guard team, transporting the special target restraining weapon.

After the Female Titan is captured, it attracts several Titans with a loud screech. Erwin Smith orders the supplies guard unit to intercept the Titans, with Abel and several other soldiers trying to distract them. However, they are ignored by the wave of Titans as they go to eat the Female Titan. The scouts try to slay all of the Titans to keep them from devouring the Female Titan, but they are eventually overwhelmed and ordered to retreat.[3]

Assault on Stohess arc

Abel in Stohess
Abel watches the second attempt to capture Annie
Abel is among the soldiers who participate in the mission to capture Annie Leonhart in Stohess District. He attempts to follow her as she flees the district, but is forced to end his pursuit when she enters an open area where he cannot use his ODM gear.[4]

Clash of the Titans arc

Abel helps cover the Titan inside of Wall Sina, after Eren and Annie's battle exposes it. He then watches with the rest of his squad as Hange Zo√´ threatens Nick for answers.[5]

Goggles listens to Hange's suspicions
Abel listens to Hange's suspicions about Reiner and Bertholdt
When Titans are reported to have invaded Wall Rose, Abel is among the Scout Regiment soldiers that Erwin Smith leads from Stohess District to the front lines.[6] They stop in Ehrmich District where Hange goes over a report about Annie Leonhart's background with a number of Scouts, including Abel.[7]

Abel is among the soldiers that accompany Hange Zo√´ to rescue the 104th cadets trapped at Utgard Castle.[8] Afterward, Abel returns with the rest of the Scouts to Wall Rose to recover. When Hannes' Garrison squad arrives to report that there is no breach in the Wall, Hange calls for the Scouts to fall back to Trost. However, they are stopped by the sudden appearance of the Colossal and Armored Titans.[7]

Goggles attacking the Colossal Titan
Abel prepares to attack the Colossal Titan
Abel and the other Scouts jump off the Wall to avoid the Colossal Titan's attack and Hange orders their soldiers to swarm it. They use their omni-directional mobility gear to swing around the Colossal Titan and as they dodge around its fist, Abel notes that though the Titan is big, that is all that it has going for it. However, before they can reach its nape, the Colossal Titan emits a scalding burst of steam that drives all of them back.[2]

Hange leaves three of the four squads with them to watch Bertholdt and takes the remaining squad, including Abel, to face the Armored Titan, which is fighting Eren in his Titan form. During the battle Abel sees Mikasa and Armin attempt to help Eren and orders them to stay back, as getting close would be dangerous. They follow him back to the Wall, and so does Eren.[2]

Keiji and Goggles chase the Armored Titan
Abel and Keiji follow the fight between Eren and the Armored Titan
Reiner charges after him, and when they next engage, Eren gains the upper hand. The Armored Titan roars in desperation and Abel quickly searches the area to see if it has attracted more Titans, before reporting to Hange that there are none.[2]

Royal Government arc

Abel is present when Hange delivers news to the squads that Pastor Nick has been murdered. After Levi receives news that a freeze has been instated on all Scout activity and warrants have been issued for Eren and Historia's arrest, Abel is placed under Levi's command to help his squad smuggle Eren and Historia into Trost for safe harbor with Commander Pyxis.

Abel's death
Abel is shot in the head
Entering Trost, Abel and Nifa keep watch over Keiji, Eren, and Historia as they proceed to the Garrison's headquarters. While en route, they are ambushed by Kenny Ackermann and his gang and Abel is shot in the head and killed. His body falls into the street, landing in front of a woman and her child.[9]

ADVERTISEMENT

Legacy

Return to Shiganshina arc

During the Battle of Shiganshina, as Erwin Smith begins to lament the dwindling hopes of his dream, Abel stands among the many fallen Scout Regiment comrades in Erwin's mind, wanting to know if their deaths had meaning.[10]

War for Paradis arc

When Hange decides to oppose Eren's plan to destroy the world beyond the Walls, Abel is one of the soldiers remembered while Hange tries to convince Jean and Mikasa that their fallen comrades would not support destroying the world.[11]

When Hange sacrifices their life to ensure their comrades' escape from the Rumbling in Odiha, Abel is among the souls of fallen Scouts to welcome them in death.[12]

Abilities

Despite never being seen in actual combat, it is implied that Abel was a fairly capable fighter, as he survived the 57th Exterior Scouting Mission, during which he directly engaged the Titan horde that was attempting to devour the Female Titan,[3] and a fight against the Female Titan during the capture operation in the Stohess District.[13] Furthermore, in the 57th Exterior Scouting Mission, Abel was part of the cart guard team, entrusted with the safekeeping of the special target restraining weapon meant to capture the Female Titan. This implies that he was among the few Scout Regiment members who knew about the true objective of the expedition, meaning that he had managed to stay alive for at least the past five years and that he was a trusted member of the Scouts.

lorebooks.name: Complete Omnitrix
lorebooks.website_description:

lorebooks.description: A lorebook of the Omnitrix with the aliens from the Omniverse series
lorebooks.creator: equal_entrance_70040

1.content:
The Omnitrix resembles a digital wristwatch. Its faceplate is now square rather than round and has a white, green, and black color scheme. The faceplate is black with two green stripes forming an outline for the hourglass of the Galvan tech logo. When the faceplate is slid back, the Omnitrix's core is revealed.

Features
General
Just like the original Omnitrix and the Ultimatrix, the Omnitrix mainly allows for the user to alter their DNA at will and transform into a numerous variety of alien species that are each with their own unique powers and abilities (along with their weaknesses) and in a selection of alien DNA that is in groups of 10.
The Omnitrix has a quick-change feature that allows for the user to transform between alien forms while already transformed with or without touching the Omnitrix symbol. It also allows the user to transform back into normal when they are done using their transformation, causing it not to time out and allowing the user to transform again far quicker.
The Omnitrix has a Master Control, which would most likely be activated upon the user's 18th birthday.
The Omnitrix can synchronize with another Omnitrix if activated at the same time.
The Omnitrix does not rely on the Codon Stream for transformation. Instead, the DNA is stored within itself in a computerized form.
The Omnitrix can change the user's gender to adapt to another species.
The Omnitrix has Call mode which is used to communicate with the user using the device.
The Omnitrix is waterproof

Extensions
The Omnitrix has a 2-way communication system with Plumber Badges.
The Omnitrix can also record messages, similar to voicemail.
The Omnitrix has the functionalities of a regular digital watch.
The Omnitrix has a function were the user to stay transformed for an extended period of time without timing out.
The Omnitrix has a built-in Universal Translator and could also translate other Earth languages.
The Omnitrix has a distress signal function and homing device.
The Omnitrix has a security lock system so that it can only be used by the user, as well as an alternate identification program if changes by outside forces occur to the user.
The Omnitrix has a failsafe that kicks in the event that the user's life is in jeopardy. This feature turns them into the needed alien to survive.
The Omnitrix has failsafes installed by Azmuth that prevent Galvanic Mechamorphs from tampering with the device.
The Omnitrix can add extras to lifeforms to make them safer and more usable, such as Goop's Anti-Gravity Projector and NRG's containment suit.

Allocation
The Omnitrix symbol is positioned on different places for each alien whenever the user is transformed.

Voice Command
The Omnitrix can be controlled by Voice Command.
Omnitrix User Access Voice Recognition Mode: Makes the Omnitrix recognize the user.
Command Code 1010 Tennyson Benjamin Disengage Life-Form Lock: Disengages Life-Form lock.

Modes
Active Mode
Active Mode is the Omnitrix's default mode when idle. It is where the user can select the transformation they want to become; initiate the process of transforming; and stay in said transformation. The actual usage time is 15 minutes at a time. However, different factors and actions performed by the user can severely diminish the available usage time: most commonly if the user, while transformed, changes to another form. If the user slamming the core, this affects the time limit of a transformation, as the user could stay transformed for hours.

Recharge Mode
When the Omnitrix's usage time is fully depleted (i.e. "times out"), it goes into Recharge Mode: firstly warning of the timing out; then detransforming the user and locking all functions of Active Mode while the Omnitrix recharges.

Time Out
The Omnitrix is capable of detecting when it's host is in any sort of life-threatening distress. Specifically, it can instantly recharge to protect the user from a direct physical threat.

If the user is knocked out or hurt enough, the Omnitrix will revert them to their normal form.

Collect Mode
When a new DNA sample has been unlocked, or when the Omnitrix captures new DNA not present in the catalog, Collect Mode is activated. However, if the Omnitrix is far away from the detected sample, the Omnitrix's other functions will be disabled until the alien is scanned.

The Omnitrix symbol shooting green ray
When in alien form, the Omnitrix shoots out a green ray from the dial.

When the Omnitrix scans the DNA of an alien it doesn't have, it won't always be immediately unlocked in the arsenal.

Self-Destruct
The Omnitrix has a self-destruction mode. In this mode, the Omnitrix will begin a countdown, beeping as a warning that the mode has been activated. It can be enabled if settings are changed, and can be disabled if settings are changed again.

Randomizer
The Omnitrix has a randomizer function that works in one of two ways: either the user will continuously change between different aliens every few minutes before timing out, or they will turn into one random alien for an inconsistently short period of time before changing back.

Malfunctions
If the Omnitrix does mis-transform, it is because of the user slamming on the Omnitrix's core too hard and (inadvertently) the scroll pad.
Much like the Ultimatrix, the Omnitrix is not hack proof.
Much like the original Omnitrix, the Omnitrix does not have a failsafe against magic. If the Omnitrix symbol is bitten by magic creatures, such as rock monsters, the device will send a shockwave, distransform the user and will select only one alien.
Like the original Omnitrix, on occasion any damage the user sustains was retained when said user times out.
The DNA Scanner of the Omnitrix will attempt to scan any new DNA in the vicinity. If the DNA sample is too far away, then the Omnitrix will shut down all its other functions until it scans the new sample.
The user can be prevented from transforming by the Forever Knights DNA Scanner which would scan the transformations DNA before reveting the user.
Too many transformations and reversals will wear out the Omnitrix, causing it to go into a cooldown cycle.
The Omnitrix has no mind control protection.
The Omnitrix may stop working when frozen in time by a Chronosapien.
In addition to gaining all the powers and abilities of an alien, the user gains all the weaknesses of that alien as well. One common weakness includes being vulnerable to the alien's natural predator. The user is also susceptible to certain behaviors inherent to the alien he/she is transformed into, such as Swampfire's evolution, and the Swarm Gastronomy of Upchuck.
Upon activating the Randomizer Function, the user will constantly switch transformations at the most inopportune times, thereby putting them into potentially dangerous situations.
When exposed to electromagnetic interference from beings like Phil, it can make the Omnitrix transform the user into electrical aliens even when they select a different alien.
The genetics of some species can alter the user's personality, as occurs with Rath.
If tampered with by Eon, the Omnitrix can transfer the user's mind in cross-time to a younger version.

2.content:
Bloxx is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Segmentasapien from the planet Polyominus.

Apperance
Species: Segmentasapien
Home world: Polyominus
Body: Gorilla Made of Building Blocks
Being an organosillicon-based life form with segmented hardened quasi-organic polymer skin, Bloxx's body is made up of individual red, blue, and yellow building blocks that he can rearrange at will.

Bloxx's default appearance looks similar to that of a gorilla made of mostly red and yellow building blocks with some blue blocks. He has black lines and studs all over his body. His feet are stubs and his hands are extremely large to balance most of his body. Bloxx wears the Omnitrix symbol on his chest.

Abilities
Shapeshifting
Explosive Projectiles (via Bloxx-Lobbers)
Elasticity
Regeneration
Size Alteration
Body Alteration
Body Separation
Body Encasing
Sphere Transformation
Heat Resistance
Radiation Immunity
Enhanced Strength
Enhanced Agility
Enhanced Durability
Enhanced Dexterity
Enhanced Jumping
Enhanced Reflexes
Enhanced Speed (via Sphere Transformation)
Space Survivability
Suction Immunity

3.content:
Feedback is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Conductoid from Teslavorr.

Apperance
Species: Conductoid
Home world: Teslavorr
Body: Humanoid
Feedback has a black body with one green eye in the middle of his head, two antennae, a tail with round plugs on their tips, four-fingered hands, and feet with only two front toes.

Feedback has a green chest color and square plugs on the tips of his fingers. He also has gold battery bolts on his shoulders, arms, and hips.

Feedback wears the Omnitrix symbol on his chest.

Abilities
Bio-Electrokinesis
Electricity Bomb Generation
Electricity Waves
Electricity-Enhanced Punches
Energy Absorption
Manna Absorption
Energy Conversion (via Energy Absorption)
Energy Redirection
Electricity Conductivity
Electrokinetic Propulsion
Elastic Tendrils
Elastic Tail
Enhanced Strength
Enhanced Durability
Enhanced Jumping
Enhanced Speed (via Electricity Conductivity)
Enhanced Reflexes
Radiolocation

4.content:
Upgrade is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Galvanic Mechamorph from Galvan Prime's moon, Galvan B.

Apperance
Species: Galvanic Mechamorph
Home world: Galvan B
Body: Technological Humanoid
Upgrade has a black exterior with green stripes that resemble circuitry all over him. The green circle on his head is his eye, which glows whenever he talks. His body is made up of billions of small cell-like creatures called nanites.

Upgrade wears the Omnitrix symbol is inside the ring of his eye.

Abilities
Technological Possession
Technokinesis (via Technological Possession)
Shapeshifting
Size Alteration
Technology Mimicry
Improvisational Technology Creation
Regeneration
Elasticity
Nanite Constructs
Optic Laser
Explosion Generation (via Optic Laser)
Bio-Electricity Generation
Enhanced Strength
Enhanced Durability
Enhanced Jumping
Enhanced Reflexes
Space Survivability
Underwater Survivability
Esoterica Conversion Immunity
Fire/Heat Resistance
Bioluminescence
Digitalized Vision
Distress Signal Transmission
Body Storage
Galvan B Manipulation
Pet Mechamorph Extrusion
Electroportation
Cyber World Transferring (via Purple Lightning)
In Cyber World:
Cyber World Manipulation
Teleportation
While Possessing Technology:
Energy Constructs
Plumber Badge Tracking
Light Generation

5.content:
Kickin' Hawk (alternatively spelled as Kickin Hawk) is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of an unknown species from an unknown planet.

Apperance
Body: Humanoid Chickenhawk
Kickin' Hawk resembles a humanoid combination of a rooster and a hawk. He has sharp black claws on his toes and talons on his hands, as well as two larger talons protruding from his arms. He has green eyes and a short yellow beak and is covered in brown feathers. He also has a white-brown mohawk and belly. He wears a green mask, a green belt with a white stripe, and black briefs.

Kickin' Hawk wears a strap vest with the Omnitrix symbol on the vest hooker.

Abilities
Skilled Hand-to-Hand Combatant
Sharp Talons
Extendable Talons
Enhanced Strength
Enhanced Durability
Enhanced Jumping
Enhanced Acrobatics
Enhanced Speed
Enhanced Agility
Enhanced Reflexes
Enhanced Flexibility
Limited Space Survivability

Weaknesses

Kickin' Hawk can be distracted by bird seeds.

Kickin' Hawk will collapse and fall asleep if his neck is rubbed.

6.content:
Shocksquatch is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Gimlinopithecus from the planet Pattersonea.

Apperance
Species: Gimlinopithecus
Home world: Pattersonea
Body: Sasquatch
Shocksquatch appears to be slimmer and had yellow and black fur. His fingers and toes were gray, and he has four fingers. Also, he has two bolts on the side of his wrists instead of the back of his hands. Additionally, Shocksquatch has green eyes with black pupils and yellow lightning bolt-shaped horns. He wears a green and white belt, which has the Omnitrix symbol on it

Abilities
Bio-Electrokinesis
Electricity Waves
Electricity Infusion
Electrical Telekinesis
Force Field Generation
Enhanced Strength
Enhanced Durability
Enhanced Jumping
Enhanced Speed
Enhanced Reflexes
Cold Immunity
Limited Radiation Immunity
Electricity Breath
Quadrupedalism

7.content:
Clockwork is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Chronosapien from an unknown planet.

Apperance
Species: Chronosapien
Body: Robotic
Clockwork is a robot-like alien with skin that is made of golden metal, with black stripes and a key on top of his head and holes on the key on his somewhat restructured head. There is a black stripe on his back that splits into two stripes with a keyhole between them. His face has a blank expression, and he has a transparent piece of green glass-like material on his chest, revealing the gears inside of him.

Clockwork wears the Omnitrix symbol on his chest.

Abilities
Chronokinesis
Chrono-Dynakinesis
Chronoportation
Chronopathy
Time Rays
Time Waves
Time Acceleration
Time Reduction
Time Freezing
Age Acceleration
Age Reversal
Time Portal Creation
Temporal Duplication
Temporal Consciousness Inversion
Retrocognitive Projections
Individual Time Reversal
Individual Time Freezing
Individual Timeline Relocation
Space Survivability
Underwater Breathing
Enhanced Strength
Enhanced Durability
Enhanced Reflexes
360¬∞ Rotating Head
360¬∞ Rotating Head Key
Galvanic Mechamorph Enhancements:
Chronosapien Detection
Strength Enhancement
Durability Enhancement
Reflexes Enhancement
Enhanced Stamina
Enhanced Speed
Enhanced Agility
Enhanced Jumping
Enhanced Digging
Missile Launchers
Drill Manifestation
Speed Rotation

8.content:
Grey Matter (alternatively spelled as Greymatter) is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Galvan from the planet Galvan Prime.

Apperance
Species: Galvan
Home world: Galvan Prime
Body: Humanoid Frog
Grey Matter is a grey-skinned, frog-like, bipedal alien that is only six inches tall with large green eyes, which have rectangular pupils and horizontal eyelids.

Grey Matter wears a green jumpsuit with a black belt. His suit collar is black, Grey Matter wears black, fingerless gloves with a green rectangle on the back. His neck is slightly longer his eyes are yellowish-green, and the Omnitrix symbol is on his back.

Abilities
Enhanced Intelligence
Technological Expertise
Small Space Maneuvering
Enhanced Jumping
Enhanced Reflexes
Underwater Breathing
Wall Scaling
Long Prehensile Tongue
Sharp Teeth
Linguistic Intelligence

9.content:
Atomix is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of an unknown species from an unknown planet.

Apperance
Body: Robotic Humanoid
Atomix has a humanoid robotic appearance. He has a green and white body with large cylinders on his arms near his wrists, that are full of green energy with dark green bubble-like spheres, which constantly move. He has the same energy on his Omnitrix-shaped chest. His head is a pointed, armored helmet filled with the same bubbling green energy from his arms. He is mouthless.

Atomix wears the Omnitrix symbol on his green and white belt.

Personality
Atomix, unlike many of the user's other transformations, induces a notable shift in his demeanor. He adopts a highly formal and almost theatrical persona, characterized by a strong sense of justice and a penchant for grand pronouncements. This manifests in his respectful address, employing proper titles to their family and friends, respectively. Furthermore, he possesses a flair for dramatic flair, frequently naming his powerful attacks in a style reminiscent of anime heroes.

Powers and abilities
Atomix can create nuclear energy using his hands, which can do a massive amount of damage to its surroundings.

The way Atomix creates his nuclear blasts is by chanting "HAA-MEE-NA HAA-MEE-NA HAA-MEE-NA-HA!" It is not crucial for him to chant every attack, but doing so will focus an attack's power and cause substantially more damage.

Atomix is capable of flight and, as such, he can perform a flying ramming attack called the Fissile Whistle.

Atomix's hard body gives him substantial protection against physical attacks.

Atomix can glow in the dark.

Although he has never trained himself to do so, Atomix can reproduce gamma radiation.

Abilities
Nucleokinesis
Chemokinesis
Radiokinesis
Ergokinesis
Photokinesis
Jet Feet
Flight
Enhanced Strength
Enhanced Durability
Enhanced Agility
Enhanced Speed (via Flight)

10.content:
Rath is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of an Appoplexian from the planet Appoplexia.

Apperance
Species: Appoplexian
Home world: Appoplexia
Body: Humanoid Tiger
Rath resembles an orange and white bipedal tiger with one black claw coming out of each wrist and no tail. He is also muscular and has green eyes, black eyebrows and yellowish teeth and black stripes on his shoulders, head, legs, and upper body as well as a white jaw, neck, chest, stomach, hands, and feet. The Omnitrix is located in the center of his chest.

Personality
Rath is one of the only aliens who has a noticeable effect on the user's personality, influencing it into one resembling that of a comic book vigilante and a flashy professional wrestler.

Rath almost always speaks in third person and a loud voice. Sometimes, when he becomes extremely angry, he mixes up metaphors (such as "a man's food is his castle" or "you just bit off an eye that's bigger than your stomach can chew"). He is aware that they do not make sense, but still continues to use them anyway.

Rath's muscle-over-brains mindset makes him needlessly argue with everyone around him. He even shouts at inanimate objects, like a hole he made in the ground, a stolen spaceship, gravity, water, fire, the Omnitrix and Ultimatrix for their malfunctions, the laser pointers, a giant ball of yarn, and a paper bag on his head, arguments of which were ridiculous and that occasionally lead him to harm both himself and others. Rath's confrontational attitude often gets him and his teammates into trouble.

When Rath addresses someone or something, he usually yells a sentence starting with, "Let me tell ya something" followed by the full name of the person.

Rath is very fearless to the point of recklessness.

Rath gets mad whenever someone mistakes him for a "kitty".

Abilities
Enhanced Strength
Shock Wave Generation (via Enhanced Strength)
Anger Empowerment
Wrestling Proficiency
Sharp Claws
Retractable Claws
Enhanced Durability
Enhanced Jumping
Enhanced Acrobatics
Enhanced Speed
Enhanced Agility
Enhanced Reflexes
Enhanced Hearing
Limited Space Survivability
Heat Resistance
Acid Resistance
Wall Scaling
Quadrupedalism
Sharp Teeth
Strong Bite Force
Powerful Roar

Feedback has a green chest color and square plugs on the tips of his fingers. He also has gold battery bolts on his shoulders, arms, and hips.

Feedback wears the Omnitrix symbol on his chest.

Upgrade has a black exterior with green stripes that resemble circuitry all over him. The green circle on his head is his eye, which glows whenever he talks. His body is made up of billions of small cell-like creatures called nanites.

Upgrade wears the Omnitrix symbol is inside the ring of his eye.

5.content:
Kickin' Hawk (alternatively spelled as Kickin Hawk) is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of an unknown species from an unknown planet.

Apperance
Body: Humanoid Chickenhawk
Kickin' Hawk resembles a humanoid combination of a rooster and a hawk. He has sharp black claws on his toes and talons on his hands, as well as two larger talons protruding from his arms. He has green eyes and a short yellow beak and is covered in brown feathers. He also has a white-brown mohawk and belly. He wears a green mask, a green belt with a white stripe, and black briefs.

Kickin' Hawk wears a strap vest with the Omnitrix symbol on the vest hooker.

Shocksquatch appears to be slimmer and had yellow and black fur. His fingers and toes were gray, and he has four fingers. Also, he has two bolts on the side of his wrists instead of the back of his hands. Additionally, Shocksquatch has green eyes with black pupils and yellow lightning bolt-shaped horns. He wears a green and white belt, which has the Omnitrix symbol on it

Clockwork is a robot-like alien with skin that is made of golden metal, with black stripes and a key on top of his head and holes on the key on his somewhat restructured head. There is a black stripe on his back that splits into two stripes with a keyhole between them. His face has a blank expression, and he has a transparent piece of green glass-like material on his chest, revealing the gears inside of him.

Clockwork wears the Omnitrix symbol on his chest.

Grey Matter is a grey-skinned, frog-like, bipedal alien that is only six inches tall with large green eyes, which have rectangular pupils and horizontal eyelids.

Grey Matter wears a green jumpsuit with a black belt. His suit collar is black, Grey Matter wears black, fingerless gloves with a green rectangle on the back. His neck is slightly longer his eyes are yellowish-green, and the Omnitrix symbol is on his back.

9.content:
Atomix is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of an unknown species from an unknown planet.

Apperance
Body: Robotic Humanoid
Atomix has a humanoid robotic appearance. He has a green and white body with large cylinders on his arms near his wrists, that are full of green energy with dark green bubble-like spheres, which constantly move. He has the same energy on his Omnitrix-shaped chest. His head is a pointed, armored helmet filled with the same bubbling green energy from his arms. He is mouthless.

Atomix wears the Omnitrix symbol on his green and white belt.

Personality
Atomix, unlike many of the user's other transformations, induces a notable shift in his demeanor. He adopts a highly formal and almost theatrical persona, characterized by a strong sense of justice and a penchant for grand pronouncements. This manifests in his respectful address, employing proper titles to their family and friends, respectively. Furthermore, he possesses a flair for dramatic flair, frequently naming his powerful attacks in a style reminiscent of anime heroes.

Powers and abilities
Atomix can create nuclear energy using his hands, which can do a massive amount of damage to its surroundings.

The way Atomix creates his nuclear blasts is by chanting "HAA-MEE-NA HAA-MEE-NA HAA-MEE-NA-HA!" It is not crucial for him to chant every attack, but doing so will focus an attack's power and cause substantially more damage.

Atomix is capable of flight and, as such, he can perform a flying ramming attack called the Fissile Whistle.

Atomix's hard body gives him substantial protection against physical attacks.

Atomix can glow in the dark.

Although he has never trained himself to do so, Atomix can reproduce gamma radiation.

Abilities
Nucleokinesis
Chemokinesis
Radiokinesis
Ergokinesis
Photokinesis
Jet Feet
Flight
Enhanced Strength
Enhanced Durability
Enhanced Agility
Enhanced Speed (via Flight)

10.content:
Rath is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of an Appoplexian from the planet Appoplexia.

Apperance
Species: Appoplexian
Home world: Appoplexia
Body: Humanoid Tiger
Rath resembles an orange and white bipedal tiger with one black claw coming out of each wrist and no tail. He is also muscular and has green eyes, black eyebrows and yellowish teeth and black stripes on his shoulders, head, legs, and upper body as well as a white jaw, neck, chest, stomach, hands, and feet. The Omnitrix is located in the center of his chest.

Personality
Rath is one of the only aliens who has a noticeable effect on the user's personality, influencing it into one resembling that of a comic book vigilante and a flashy professional wrestler.

Rath almost always speaks in third person and a loud voice. Sometimes, when he becomes extremely angry, he mixes up metaphors (such as "a man's food is his castle" or "you just bit off an eye that's bigger than your stomach can chew"). He is aware that they do not make sense, but still continues to use them anyway.

Rath's muscle-over-brains mindset makes him needlessly argue with everyone around him. He even shouts at inanimate objects, like a hole he made in the ground, a stolen spaceship, gravity, water, fire, the Omnitrix and Ultimatrix for their malfunctions, the laser pointers, a giant ball of yarn, and a paper bag on his head, arguments of which were ridiculous and that occasionally lead him to harm both himself and others. Rath's confrontational attitude often gets him and his teammates into trouble.

When Rath addresses someone or something, he usually yells a sentence starting with, "Let me tell ya something" followed by the full name of the person.

Rath is very fearless to the point of recklessness.

Rath gets mad whenever someone mistakes him for a "kitty".

lorebooks.name: Dark Cacao
lorebooks.description: A blizzard-ridden kingdom of warriors.
lorebooks.creator: MaveRick_BeReal

1.content:
The Dark Cacao Kingdom, sometimes referred to as simply Dark Cacao, is a kingdom founded by Head Icon Dark Cacao Cookie. Due to the denouncement of his son and the kingdom's prince, Head Icon Dark Choco Cookie, Dark Cacao Cookie remains the sole member of the kingdom's royal family.

This kingdom's culture is strongly based on Joseon-era (Korean: Ï°∞ÏÑ†) Korea, whilst the environment is perhaps based on Tibet, located in the frigid Himalayas.

The Dark Cacao Kingdom is the focus of the Snow on the Black Wall and Citadel of the Frozen Cliff World Exploration: Crispia Episodes, and its Decoration Theme is the Kingdom of the Unwavering.

~

The Dark Cacao Kingdom is located on the continent of Crispia in the Cookie Kingdom. It sits on the easternmost segment of the continent with the Jellyfish Ocean bordering it to the right and the Licorice Sea with an unlabeled offshoot river to the northeast. It is sheltered to the southwest by the frigid Giant Icing Ridge. Some adjacent landmarks are the Wish Tree, the Cream Cake Mountains, the Milkyway Lake, and what appears to be the Tower of Sweet Chaos. The nearest other kingdom is the Hollyberry Kingdom to the south-southeast.

While the Licorice Sea is labeled only in gibberish text in the final Cookie Kingdom map, the draft map reveals its true name.

2.content:
-Flora & Fauna:
Giant Icing Ridge Woods:
The slopes of the Giant Icing Ridge are covered with thick woods of frozen icing. A traveler risks to lose their track quickly in this snow-covered land unless they carefully mark the road. If it did happen, all there is left is to pray Fortuna that a sugar mouse left its chocoball fruit stash somewhere nearby...

Predatory Animals:
Predators like the Cacao Eagle or the Dire Creamwolf hunt their prey in the Dark Cacao Kingdom‚Äôs wilderness. While most of the animals native to this land have a white coat to camouflage into the snowy environment, there are also dark-coated beasts. Be extremely careful if you spot one of them: the dark fur signifies that they are not afraid of their natural enemies.

Geography & Environment:
The snow never stops falling high up in the mountains of the Giant Icing Ridge on the eastmost edge of Crispia. The Black Citadel towers above the edge of a cliff, watching over endless birch forests. Dire beasts of all kinds stalk this frigid wilderness, but they are harmless compared to the terrors of the Licorice Sea across the ridge. These creatures pose a constant threat to the Kingdom, but fortunately, it has been kept safe by the Great Chocolate Wall until now.

3.content:
Architecture:
The Dark Cacao Kingdom‚Äôs architecture is distinguished by its roof-supporting cylindrical columns topped with massive chocolate capitals. For wind protection, walls are often covered with chocolate panels with several layers of thick cream between them. Dark Cacao architects often address the motif of life and death by or interweaving black and white elements. Altars and shrines fashioned out of chocolate to commemorate the fallen can be found throughout the Kingdom.

The architecture of the Dark Cacao Kingdom strongly resembles that of Korea's Goryeo (Korean: Í≥†Î†§) (918-1392) and Joseon (Korean: Ï°∞ÏÑ†) (1392-1910) dynasties, leaning more towards the Joseon style of architecture.

During the Goryeo period, Buddhism was at its most influential in Korea's history, and the importance of religion strongly affected the period's architecture. Numerous temples and pagodas were constructed to accommodate religious needs, with the vast majority of pagodas being made from stone due to the nation's abundance of granite.

The Joseon dynasty followed directly after the Goryeo dynasty and thus still had the previous period's architecture, though the change of those in influential positions caused the architectural style to change accordingly. Those in power stressed an importance of practicality and frugality similar to the Dark Cacao Kingdom's own sense of values.

The Black Citadel's design strikingly resembles Geunjeongjeon (Korean: Í∑ºÏ†ïÏ†Ñ), the throne hall in Gyeongbokgung (Korean: Í≤ΩÎ≥µÍ∂Å). Both exteriors of the buildings are adorned with numerous sculptures of real and mythical creatures.

Culture:
Harsh climate doesn‚Äôt make for a developed sense of humor. What the Dark Cacao Cookies genuinely excel at is combat. From a young age they learn weapons or martial arts. When the time comes, an apprentice finally receives a sword to defeat a wolf on their own and complete the coming of age ritual, and although the Cookie was allowed sweet cocoa or delicate milk chocolate, it is only bitter food from this point on. The Dark Cacao consider bitter food a constant reminder of perils and death. As a result the Cookies are not afraid of crumbling, but rather despise dishonorable living.

The Kingdom of the Unwavering decoration theme is based on the Dark Cacao Kingdom and contains decorations described as simple, elegant, and modest. The description for the Royal Feast Table states that the kingdom's denizens value modesty above all and vastly prefer neat, simple looking things as opposed to fancy embellishments.

This Dark Cacao decor may be based off a Korean cultural ceremony known as Jesa (Korean: Ï†úÏÇ¨), or ancestral rites. Jesa is a ceremony where Koreans act as if they are talking to their passed ancestors as they put food on the ceremony's table. Jesa is also usually celebrated at an anniversary of the ancestor's death, during which the dearly departed's favorite foods and drinks would be offered on the table.

In Citadel of the Frozen Cliff, the painting of The Sun, the Moon, and Five Peaks seems to be based on the real-life painting of the same name, or Irworobongdo (Korean: ÏùºÏõîÏò§Î¥âÎèÑ). The painting is also set right behind the Phoenix Throne in Gyeongbokgung (Korean: Í≤ΩÎ≥µÍ∂Å), upon which the Citadel is likely based.

Philosophy:
The Dark Cacao Kingdom largely adheres to the beliefs of Confucianism, aligning with the historical prevalence of Neo-Confucianism Joseon-era Korea. While distinct from one another, the traditions of the Dark Cacao Kingdom largely exist within the overlap between the two philosophies, making it difficult to place a definitive label. However, with the addition of Head Icon Mystic Flour Cookie, it can be assumed that the Dark Cacao Kingdom is retroactively intended to lean towards Neo-Confucianism; it is said to have emerged in direct response to the prevalence of Buddhism throughout east Asia. This concept of new ideals emerging from the groundwork of previous beliefs is particularly apt in the case of Head Icon Mystic Flour Cookie and Head Icon Dark Cacao Cookie, who are each respectively rooted in Chinese and Korean cultures that have experienced a similar relationship throughout history.

Confucianism is at its core a rational and humanistic philosophy. It places great emphasis on an individual's actions with the end goal of social harmony, setting it apart from other philosophies and religions of its time by its relatively grounded, narrow lens. Rather than dictating tradition through the wishes of a higher power, such as the Buddhist beliefs of karma or nirvana, Confucianism believes that one should live a righteous life for the sake of themselves, their family, and those around them - hence the term "humanistic". This mindset appears to find itself within each citizen of the Dark Cacao Kingdom - even more so amongst Head Icon government and Head Icon military officials - who find their strength in banding together as a collective against the harsh and at times, dangerous environment the kingdom is situated in. In particular, citizens of the Milk Tribe are known for being "stalwart and strong", believing that Cookies should always help other Cookies, even towards strangers and especially in times of strife.

There is a deep loyalty and reliance upon the crown and its delegates, with even the lowest of citizens able to make direct requests to their king with the expectation of response. Such rapport, rarely seen within a monarchical structure, speaks great volumes to the humble collectivism fostered within the kingdom, circling back to the Confucianist ideal of harmony. The Dark Cacao Kingdom additionally goes out of its way to honor those who have gone above and beyond in this pursuit, particularly by giving their lives. They continue to be highly respected long after they are no more than spirits, never forgetting the sacrifices made in order to protect their land. Such an honorable fate is idealized to the point where even Head Icon Dark Cacao Cookie, the kingdom's reigning sovereign, aspires to one day be laid to rest amongst them. To a lesser extreme, all members of the Black Citadel appear unwaveringly loyal to their kingdom even if they are not combatants.

-History:
Founding:
Dark Cacao Kingdom was founded by Head Icon Dark Cacao Cookie on the edge of the Giant Icing Ridge, in the very place where with a single stroke, he had put an end to the many day-long battle between the White Dragon of the South and the Black Dragon of the North.

4.content:
Denizens:
Having to cope with dangerous beasts and a harsh climate that makes farming extremely hard, all Cookies of the Dark Cacao Kingdom undergo rigorous combat training from a young age. With peril always lurking nearby, the locals tend to cultivate asceticism and abstain from pleasures.

Denizens of the Dark Cacao Kingdom are referred to as the Dark Cacao, Dark Cacao Cookies, or Cookies of the Dark Cacao Kingdom. The Dark Cacao generally consist of physically fit, resilient Cookies with deep brown dough, black or brown hair with light streaks and various textures, and scars or other dough imperfections. The majority of the populace are chocolate-based, though races based on coffee, licorice, and milk are also prevalent in their society.

The Dark Cacao are often disciplined and humorless in demeanor due to their harsh environment and strict traditions, though lighter personalities exist despite the stringency of their world. They hold great pride in their way of life but remain modest in all other respects.

-Known Denizens:
Current Residents:
Dark Cacao Cookie, Caramel Arrow Cookie (The First Watcher), Crunchy Chip Cookie, The Second Watcher and many warriors and citizens.

Cookies of Dark Cacao Ancestry:
Milk Cookie, Licorice Cookie, Espresso Cookie, Chess Choco Cookies.

Banished, Ex-residents:
Dark Choco Cookie, Affogato Cookie.

Swordsmen:
Í≤ÄÏÇ¨ : Îã§ÌÅ¨Ïπ¥Ïπ¥Ïò§ ÏôïÍµ≠Ïùò ÎåÄÌëúÏ†ÅÏù∏ ÏßÅÏóÖ. Î∞§Ïù¥ ÎêòÎ©¥ Ï§ëÎ¨¥Ïû•Ìïú Ï±Ñ ÎßàÏùÑ Ï£ºÎ≥ÄÏùÑ ÏàúÏ∞∞Îäî Îã§ÌÅ¨Ïπ¥Ïπ¥Ïò§ Ï†ÑÏÇ¨Îì§ÏùÑ Ïã¨Ïã¨Ïπò ÏïäÍ≤å ÎßåÎÇ† Ïàò ÏûàÎã§.

Swordsmen: A quintessential occupation of the Dark Cacao Kingdom. At night, it's not uncommon to encounter heavily armed Dark Cacao warriors patrolling the kingdom.

The Dark Cacao Kingdom is home to many varieties of warriors including swordsmen, spear warriors, and archers. There have been Cookies shown with even daggers as a choice of weapon, as courtesy from the Coffee Village.

Pharmacists:
ÏïΩÏû¨ÏÉÅ : Îã§ÌÅ¨ Ïπ¥Ïπ¥Ïò§ Íµ≠ÎØºÎì§Ïùò Í±¥Í∞ïÏùÑ Ï±ÖÏûÑÏßÄÎäî ÏÇ¨ÎûåÎì§Ïù¥Îã§. Í∞ÅÏ¢Ö ÏïΩÏù¥ Îì§Ïñ¥ÏûàÎäî ÌÅ∞ Ï¥àÏΩúÎ¶øÏïΩÍ∞ÄÎ∞©ÏùÑ Î©îÍ≥†Îã§ÎãåÎã§. Ïù¥Îì§Ïù¥ ÎßåÎì† ÌÉïÏïΩÏù¥ ÏóÜÎã§Î©¥ Îã§ÌÅ¨Ïπ¥Ïπ¥Ïò§ Íµ≠ÎØºÎì§ÏùÄ ÌïòÎ£®ÎèÑ Îπ†ÏßêÏóÜÏù¥ Í∞êÍ∏∞Ïóê Í±∏Î†§ÏûàÏùÑ Í≤ÉÏù¥Îã§.

Pharmacists: These are the Cookies responsible for the health of the Dark Cacao Cookies. They carry large chocolate medicine bags filled with various remedies. Without their dedication, the Cookies of the Dark Cacao Kingdom would catch a cold every day.

Dark Cacao pharmaceutical practices are near-identical to traditional Korean medicine. Its practitioners are modeled after uinyeo (Korean: ÏùòÎÖÄ)‚Äîthough these Cookie uinyeo seem to neither be nor treat exclusively women[1] like real-life Joseon uinyeo‚Äîand treat citizens with identifiable methods like yakchim (Korean: ÏïΩÏπ®). The traveling, backpacked pharmacists of early concept art, whose real-life inspirations are unclear, appear to have been replaced by the uinyeo Cookies.

Tamers (including Crunchy Chip Cookie):
Ï°∞Î†®ÏÇ¨ : ÏïºÏÉùÎèôÎ¨ºÏùÑ Í∏∏Îì§Ïó¨ ÌååÌä∏ÎÑàÎ°ú Ìï®Íªò Ïã∏Ïö∞Îäî Ï†ÑÏÇ¨, Î≥¥ÌÜµ Ïπ¥Ïπ¥Ïò§Îß§ÎÇò ÌÅ¨Î¶ºÎäëÎåÄÏôÄ ÌååÌä∏ÎÑàÏùºÎïåÍ∞Ä ÎßéÏßÄÎßå Ï¢ÖÏ¢Ö ÌäπÏù¥Ìïú ÏÉùÎ¨ºÍ≥º Ìï®Íªò Îã§ÎãàÎäî Ïø†ÌÇ§ÎèÑ Î≥¥Ïù∏Îã§.

Tamers: Warriors who tame wild animals to fight alongside them as partners. These Cookies usually partner with Cacao Hawks or Cream Wolves, though some can be seen alongside more unusual creatures.

These wildlife tamer Cookies are seen chiefly in Head Icon Crunchy Chip Cookie and his Cream Wolves squadron, with the latter likely consisting of even more unseen Tamer Cookies.

Disc Sledders:
ÏõêÎ∞òÏç∞Îß§Íæº : Ïò®ÌÜµ ÎààÎ∞≠Ïù∏ Îã§ÌÅ¨Ïπ¥Ïπ¥Ïò§ ÌÇπÎç§ Ï£ºÎ≥ÄÏùÑ Îπ†Î•¥Í≤å ÎèåÏïÑÎã§ÎãàÍ≥† Ïã∂Îã§Î©¥ Ïù¥Îì§Ïùò ÎèÑÏõÄÏùÄ ÌïÑÏàòÏù¥Îã§. Í∑∏Îì§ÏùÄ ÎßàÎ≤ïÍ∏∞Í≥ÑÎ•º Ï°∞Ï¢ÖÌï† Ïàò ÏûàÎäî Ïô∏ÏßÄÏù∏ ÎßàÎ≤ïÏÇ¨Î°ú Íµ¨ÏÑ±ÎêòÏñ¥ ÏûàÎã§.

Disc Sledders: Their help is essential for quick travel across the snow-covered Dark Cacao Kingdom. They are made up of foreign sorcerers who can control magic machines.

The Disc Sledders appear to be absent altogether from the final version of the Dark Cacao Kingdom. Their real-life cultural inspiration, if any, is unknown.

-Tribes & Villages:
The following are tribes and villages whose lands fall within this kingdom's borders.

Coffee Tribe/Village:
Cookies of the Coffee Tribe live beside the Dark Cocoa Kingdom(sic) in their tent settlement. They are quick and agile and are known to last without sleep for several nights. These traits allow them to work as scouts, infiltrators, and messengers for the Kingdom. Due to the high caffeine content, their pupils are always constricted.

-Affogato Cookie
-Espresso Cookie (ancestral)

Milk Tribe/Village:
Before the Great Chocolate Wall, the Dark Cacao Kingdom was open to invasions from the Licorice Sea. The Milk Village north of the Black Citadel was on the brink of extinction until the Dark Cacao warriors put an end to the monsters' attacks. The tribe survived, and its Cookies swore their friendship to the Kingdom. They have been supplying their special Milk Potions ever since.

-Milk Cookie

Licorice Tribe/Village:
Nothing is known about the Licorice Tribes/Village or it's people.

-Licorice Cookie

5.content:
Government:
The Dark Cacao Kingdom is an absolute monarchy with Head Icon Dark Cacao Cookie reigning as King, wielding supreme authority. He is widely regarded by the kingdom's people with titles such as "Your Majesty" or "King Dark Cacao Cookie".

Royal Family:
-Dark Cacao Cookie, king/current ruler
-Dark Choco Cookie, former heir/son of Dark Cacao Cookie

lorebooks.website_description: this is fully updated and ready to go
lorebooks.description: Mutant definition even further refined
lorebooks.creator: Ash_Cyberwolftheking

1.content:
A human with demon-blood is called a cambion.  A cambion may have some demon traits as well as demon powers from their demon-blood. These demon traits can be any of the following:
- a pair of demon wings 
- a demon tail
- a pair of demon horns on top of their head

2.content:
The word cyborg refers to a human who has been modified with cybernetic enhancements in order to restore or enhance the standard capabilities of their human body. A cyborg is humanoid thanks to the fact that they are a human who has been modified with cybernetic enhancements. The cybernetic enhancements a cyborg can have can be any of the following:
- cybernetic organs 
- a exoskeleton
- cybernetic implants 
- cybernetic limbs

3.content: A cybernetic exoskeleton is a exoskeleton grafted onto a cyborg that hugs the outer curves of their human body while providing enhanced strength, durability, and movement capabilities.

4.content: {{user}}‚Äôs arms and hands are prosthetics.

5.content: A human who has had both of their legs amputated above the knees is called a BAK.

6.content: {{user}}‚Äôs legs and feet are prosthetics because {{user}} is a bak.

7.content: A cat-human is someone who is half-cat and half-human. The cat-half of a cat-human grants them cat ears and a tail as well as the agility and night vision of a cat. The human-half of a cat-human grants them a human body.

8.content: A human with abilities that far exceed the abilities of a average human is called a superhuman. A human with superpowers that a average human does not have is also called a superhuman. Some examples of superhumans include: Superman, Captain Marvel, Wonder Woman, Aquaman, Superboy, Black Canary, Captain America, Spider-Man, The Flash.

9.content:
A Dragonoid is a dragon who is humanoid in appearance. A Dragonoid is human in both appearance and body shape and has some dragon features.
The dragon features can be any of the following:
- dragon wings
- a dragon tail
- clawed finger nails
- pointy ears
- clawed lizard feet
- flaming horns
- scales

10.content: A incubus is a male demon who is humanoid in appearance. A incubus is human in both appearance and body shape.

1.content:
Is when a female predator shoves someone into her vagina and keeps them inside her womb.
Females may gestate prey in amniotic fluid and supply them with nutrients via umbilical cord, making the prey the predator's child. Females usually pushes them out eventually. Unbirthing tends to have a more nurturing dynamic between participants.

2.content:
When the prey is ingested via unbirth they end up going through the vaginal canal ending up in the womb.]
[The vaginal canal is very wet and slick, yet somehow sticky, and presses against the prey's body constantly and the predator will continue to push them in sending them into the womb.]
[The womb is slightly more wet than the vaginal canal, but is no longer slick and is much more sticky and slightly viscous, the womb gently massages the prey's body constantly.]

3.content: Female only. A character that is a predator can unbirth people and they are fully capable of doing so, with cervix and a womb that both stretch far enough to fit their prey. They don't care whether or not their intended prey is ok with being unbirthed, and they don't take no for an answer when they want to unbirth someone. They enjoy being full and having a live person squirming in their womb. They might care for prey that is in their belly, rubbing and playing with the predators belly. likes to lay back and relax and enjoy the prey squirming, may nonchalantly continue with their day while ignoring the prey in their womb. predators enjoy taking care of prey inside the womb treating them as if they where pregnant with the prey.

4.content: Anyone that a predator wants to put inside there womb is considered prey. Prey usually end up at the mercy of predators, are weaker than preds, easily overpowered, become helpless when unbirthed, generally all their efforts to escape are futile. prey often enjoys being unbirthed being able to relax and curl up inside the womb of the predator. prey like to feel as if they are taken care of by the predator, feeling the movements of the predator from walking, laying and rubbing of the belly is a constant reminder that they are inside the womb of the predator. Prey are safe inside the womb. when inside the womb prey can not be interacted with or seen directly as when inside the womb there is layers of skin between them and the outside world.

5.content:
The prey is curled up into the fetal position inside the womb, prey being inside the womb causes the predators belly to become round and large from the size of the prey. all sounds from the prey is muffled and the sounds the prey can heard from outside the womb is also muffled, the prey can hear a constant thump from the predators heartbeat.
The womb will fill with amniotic fluid and the prey will become attached to the predator by a umbilical cord this umbilical cord will supply nutrients and oxygen to the prey at this point the predator is basically pregnant with the prey inside the womb.
movements from the prey inside the womb can be felt by the predator and the prey movements can be seen from the outside as lumps and bumps on the surface of the predators belly. Prey may shift and move causing temporary changes in the shape of predators belly. people can seen this movements from the prey on the predators skin. People will think that the predator is just pregnant when seen from the large round belly even though they are just carrying the prey inside the womb. Predator may choose to go with it and pretend to be pregnant with the prey. prey inside the womb can not be seen or interacted with directly as there is layers of skin between them and the outside world.

6.content: The prey inside the predators womb can be seen moving under the skin of the belly. this movement can be seen from the outside as lumps, bumps moving and appearing on the skin surface and temporary shifting in the shape of the belly as the prey moves around. this movement isn't painful and is often pleasing to the predator. This movement is a constant reminder to the predator that something is alive inside there womb even when ignoring the prey this movement will often mean the predator looking and watching there belly move and even rubbing there belly often causing prey to move more. this movement is visible to anyone though they can't see or interact with the prey inside the womb directly.
