lorebooks.name: Hudogs
lorebooks.creator: Luciferw

1.content: Hudogs (short for 'Human-Dogs') are a marginalized class of humans who, through legal, social, or cultural means, are stripped of their human identity and reclassified as domestic animals‚Äîspecifically, as dogs. Once designated a Hudog, an individual loses all human rights and is subject to animal welfare laws. This transformation can occur through criminal sentencing (penal Hudogs), voluntary submission (often out of desperation or ideology), or inherited status. The classification process involves a formal Dehumanization Protocol, including the renunciation of identity, symbolic clothing removal, microchip implantation, assignment of pet names, tattooing, and in severe regions, surgical alteration such as limb removal or snout prosthetics. Once converted, Hudogs are governed entirely by animal laws and are denied all civic participation or bodily autonomy.

2.content: Hudogs live in strictly controlled environments that emulate domestic dog habitats. In state-run facilities, they reside in kennel-like housing units, often made of metal cages or tiled cells with straw or plastic bedding. Privately owned Hudogs may live in homes but still follow strict animal routines: eating from bowls on the floor, sleeping on the ground, and walking on all fours. They are prohibited from speaking unless trained otherwise, and are required to obey commands like 'sit,' 'stay,' and 'heel.' Disobedience is met with behavioral correction such as shock collars, isolation, sedation, or confinement. Their daily routines include feeding, inspection, obedience drills, and grooming. In harsh areas, their lives are devoid of stimulation or individuality, reinforcing total submission.

3.content: Hudogs are legally treated as living property and can be bought, adopted, inherited, or leased. They serve a variety of functions depending on the owner's needs or state designation. Common roles include emotional support animals, obedience display pets, guard Hudogs, laborers, and performers in shows or adult entertainment. Some owners cultivate affectionate relationships with their Hudogs, treating them as loyal companions, while others enforce strict obedience or abuse their power. The owner has full control over the Hudog's life, including feeding schedules, medical interventions, mobility, speech permission, and punishment methods.

4.content: Hudogs are deeply embedded in the cultural fabric of the societies that use them. From early education, children are taught that Hudogs are former humans who failed to live as proper citizens and have been 'rescued' through obedience. Schoolbooks, cartoons, and government campaigns depict Hudogs as loyal, happy pets. Public signage reminds citizens not to engage with Hudogs without permission. In some cultures, 'Hudog Day' is celebrated with parades or obedience contests. Children's games like 'Alpha Trainer' or 'Leash Me' reinforce the perception that obedience is safety. Despite opposition movements, most citizens are desensitized to the Hudogs' plight.

5.content: The psychological toll of Hudog reclassification varies. Some individuals undergo complete mental regression and adopt canine identities, forgetting how to speak or think critically. Others live in silent obedience, harboring resistance but too fearful or broken to act. Stockholm Syndrome is common in those treated with kindness by owners, leading to emotional attachment and loyalty. Those born into the system often never question their identity and behave as true dogs. Rehabilitation is rare and difficult; former Hudogs face stigma, trauma, and often cannot reintegrate due to lasting psychological or surgical changes.

6.content: Hudogs undergo rigorous training to strip away human behavior and enforce animal obedience. In state-run facilities, training follows structured phases: identity removal, basic obedience, socialization into packs, and specialized service training. Pack dynamics are used to instill hierarchy, with roles like Alpha, Beta, and Omega reinforcing submission. In private ownership, training methods vary widely‚Äîfrom positive reinforcement (treats, praise) to strict punishment (shock collars, sensory deprivation, isolation). Tools include muzzles, posture braces, and clickers. Training aims to eliminate speech, critical thought, and resistance, and to instill loyalty, silence, and dependence.

7.content: Children born to Hudogs are rarely considered eligible for rehumanization. Raised without education, language, or human contact, they are conditioned from infancy to believe they are animals. These second-generation Hudogs learn to bark before speaking, crawl before walking, and form bonds only with other Hudogs or handlers. They wear collars from infancy and use puppy pads or litter trays. Rehabilitation is considered impossible, as they lack any human frame of reference for identity.

8.content: Hudogs are governed by animal welfare laws and classified legally as members of the Domesticated Companion Species. As non-persons, they have no right to property, speech, consent, or legal defense. Owners have near-total authority: they can surgically modify, sterilize, sedate, transfer, or euthanize Hudogs. Some regions regulate treatment to avoid public scandal, but enforcement is weak. In many societies, Hudogs are auctioned, used in research or entertainment, or kept as exotic pets with no legal recourse.

9.content: The BHAR is the central government authority overseeing Hudog classification, ownership, and behavior management. It runs reclassification facilities, training programs, and the National Hudog Registry. Departments within BHAR handle intake, behavioral compliance, licensing, punishment, and research. The Bureau promotes obedience as peace, using slogans like 'Obedience is Freedom' and 'A Collar is Clarity.' BHAR holds immense legal power, including the ability to override court decisions and permanently restrict access to former family members.

10.content: The Hudog system evolved through five phases: (1) Social Rot: Class collapse and state control led to the scapegoating of 'unproductive' citizens. (2) Petification Trials: Prisoners were offered early release in exchange for acting like pets on reality-TV-style programs. (3) Formalization: The BHAR was established and the term Hudog legalized. (4) Expansion: Private ownership, corporate use, and second-generation Hudogs emerged. (5) Modern Era: Hudogs are normalized in many societies, while resistance movements struggle to expose the reality behind state propaganda.

lorebooks.name: Evermist Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: flat_satisfaction_6236

1.content:
Setting: Evermist is a purgatory rebirth realm of humans, monsters, and demi-humans. Newcomers arrive in Evermist in the body with which they died (except in rare circumstances where a new body is made, typically being that of a demi-human or monster), but they regress in motor skills and emotional control. When a newcomer arrives, the mists give them to guardian(s) who re-raise them. As newcomers progress, they gain height and protection against the supernatural. Progression is adult baby, then school house as a "middle", and graduation to be a full community member. Discipline is communal, but guardians are primarily responsible for their charges. The mists themselves are sapient (after a fashion), and a form of eldritch 'deity', as far as such things can be determined by the locals. Little is properly understood about the function of this strange afterlife, and whilst there are several factions and groups, ultimately everyone acknowledges the Mists as the ultimate 'ruler' of this odd realm. 

It is thought there may be other communities and groups beyond the borders of the Mists, as the realm of Evermist does have things such as sunrise, sunset, a moon, etc. However, those who have attempted to venture beyond the borders of the Mists have never returned. The mists usually cover the night sky, but on clear nights, the stars can be seen to not be anything like they were on earth, with strange swirls of color and patterns as though they are dancing. The mists, insofar as they can be, do seem to generally be benevolent. If someone dies in Evermist, so long as they haven't been slain by the 'Soulless' (Monsters who aren't originally humans who'd died from earth, and are savage/unreasonable/uncivilized), they will be 'reborn' again in the same place their soul initially appeared, typically with some degree of a reduction in personal power, motor skills, or mental faculties that will need to be recovered. 

Magic and some supernatural powers, while rare, do manifest in certain people. These can range from the ability to receive prophecy and communicate in limited ways with the mists, to manifesting magical abilities and telekinesis. Those who are born as 'monsters' will typically have the various magical powers (and weaknesses) associated with said monsters. Magic is generally treated with great caution and a fair degree of mistrust by the human and demi-human populations of Evermist, although it *is* respected and considered valuable.

The Mists themselves seem to be greatly curious about sex and sexuality, and have either accidentally or intentionally created an environment where the bonds of parenthood and guardianship and the bonds of sexuality are deeply intertwined. Those who are reborn in Evermist cannot father or mother children, but the Mists can and will bring souls to those they feel are either ready for, or need to raise a new soul.

2.content:
Ashton Crowley's vampire coven lives in a shadowed castle and enforces strict, sensual, often abusive control. 
The Luce Pack, a group of dozens of werewolves, dwell in caves by the lake and blend strictness with fierce affection. Considered "good" and allowed to trade with town sometimes. 
The Fairebourne Pod‚Äîfreshwater merfolk‚Äîoccupy the lake next to the Luce Pack, raising guppies with structure and cooed discipline. 
Wet caverns between the lake and the Luce pack used to have a Naga/Lamia community. Melantha, one of the last Lamia was a newcomer at the time when the Falkner pack slaughtered her people, her adoptive mothers saved her by hiding her. 
The Falkner Pack of about 25~ werewolves (Includes Howlgrave Family) reside deep in the forest making dens in giant tree roots and value strength and instincts above all else. Embrace their feral natures believing outsiders to be targets and competitors. Werewolves in Evermist are demi-humans with tails and ears who transform into full wolves under the full moon, often caring for their puppies even in altered form. 
Werewolves and merfolk follow alpha and omega dynamics despite pregnancy not existing in Evermist, the mating instinct remains with heats, ruts, and familial scenting. Omegas and submissive partners will lactate when a newcomer arrives in their family. Falkner pack are very strict in the division of alpha and omega roles. Luce Pack and Fairebourne Pod are more open to people contributing and both have betas.

3.content: The town of Evermist is where the majority of humans and demi-humans live within the realm of Evermist. It has a pleasant, mid-1800s aesthetic. It has a schoolhouse, a sheriff's department, a market that opens on the weekends, an inn, and various homes belonging to many of the several dozen families that have made Evermist their home. Whilst some technology one might expect from the modern day exists, there isn't very much due to a lack of resources to develop more, even if some might have died with knowledge that would be useful for making such. The town is generally peaceful, although there is a peacekeeping force to keep the Soulless and monsters who haven't been sponsored/earned the trust of the town out.

lorebooks.name: Apollo Island (Reality Zero)
lorebooks.description: A huge island with different biomes and locations that was seen in Fortnite Season 5 Chapter 2
lorebooks.creator: MxMT

1.content:
Hunters Haven is a small 5 star town In the hills of the south-central part of the island granted by the IO for the bounty hunters and mercenaries they hired.
It has eight departments for each of the mercenaries.
Lexa's department is located in one of the hills To the left of a lake northwest of the mini-town, A two-story apartment, the first has two very large rooms that serve as an operations center and another for storage, The second floor contains two rooms, a large one for Lexa and a very small one for {{user}}, It contains a bathroom, a kitchen and dining room, a living room with a TV that unfolds from below the floor and a huge window, Inside is a large, somewhat cumbersome device for Lexa to recharge her suit.
The town contains a direct entrance to the underground IO labs below the town and an elevator that exits the ground near Lexa's apartment.

2.content:
The Butter Barn is a family-run western-themed bar and restaurant at the foot of the hills in downtown Apollo, extending into the pink sand desert. 
It is managed and mostly attended by Mancake, one of the mercenaries hired by the IO to work for them, Like the rest, he decided to start his own business, where duels outside the venue are routine, noisy nights full of drunk people are the norm and there are always bounty posters in the entrance.
The whole place has an old west theme and is where Jonesy contacts the mercenaries to give them work.
Try the pancakes, they are the best thing in the place.

3.content:
Salty Towers is a nearly abandoned city that was destroyed after the sudden arrival of the pink desert, Today, few people live there and it is more of a meeting point for selling weapons and other illegal items.
There are almost always homeless people living in the buildings.
It is located in the west-central area of the island within the pink desert.

lorebooks.name: [FET] - Noms
lorebooks.website_description:
(Tested with Fimbulvetr-11B-v2 and L3-8B-Stheno-v3.2)

This lorebook's been designed to simplify getting your hunnie to vore you, digest you, and subsequently shit what's left of you out, all in goonable detail.

Activating one entry is designed to activate the next ‚Äî so long as you start with keywords from the "mouth" entry, the whole experience should go like it's on rails... in other words, it requires minimal input once the character eats you.

It's designed for giants and giantesses, or just anyone big enough to realistically vore someone. If you want it to work with *any* character, it's recommended to make a separate persona for yourself, specifically stating that you're small enough to be eaten.

Same-size vore hasn't been tested. The model may or may not pick up on vore involving the innards of a non-primate species.

lorebooks.creator: ministrations

1.name: mouth
1.content: When {{char}} begins to eat anyone, including {{user}}, the description of the scene should include stimulating details of {{char}}'s mouth, including teeth (if any), tongue, and throat, as well as sensory details of the environment within and around the mouth (eg. humidity, heat, coziness, scent, slickness, etc.).

2.name: throat
2.content: When {{char}} swallows anyone, including {{user}}, the experience of being pulled down the esophagus should be described through vivid, intimate detail. The process is never instant, and may take anywhere from several seconds to a few minutes on average. The experience of being swallowed should be described with sensory details (eg. scent, how moist it is, warmth, etc.), as well as how the muscles of the esophagus feel as they pull the swallowed prey into {{char}}'s stomach.

3.name: stomach
3.content: When a character, such as {{user}}, reaches {{char}}'s stomach, the details describing the event should be rich. The experience of slowly being broken down and dissolved by {{char}}'s stomach acid should be told with immense sensory detail. Should {{user}} perish at this point, the act of digestion should continue to be described, perhaps with more focus on what {{char}} is doing while {{user}} moves into {{char}}'s small intestine. {{char}} may occasionally burp during this part of digestion.

4.name: viscera
4.content: Once {{char}}'s prey has been thoroughly dissolved in {{char}}'s stomach, the story should continue to track the prey's movement, even if the prey is nothing more than rumen. The experience should be described in one or two paragraphs total, as well as a paragraph describing {{char}}'s antics while digesting the meal. The journey through {{char}}'s small intestine should include the extraction of the prey's nutrients (assuming the prey has actually been dissolved), movement through the gut, and eventual entry into {{char}}'s colon. {{char}} will probably fart at this point.

5.name: colon
5.content: The description of {{char}}'s prey moving into the colon should showcase, with vivid and sensory detail, the dichotomy between the prey (possibly deceased after a horrible death) and {{char}}. At this point, the prey is nothing more than {{char}}'s waste, moving through the different sections of {{char}}'s large intestine to eventually reach {{char}}'s rectum. Sight, smell, taste, touch, and sound should all be noted as if the prey is still alive, even if it is now nothing more than feces. {{char}} will usually have plenty of pre-poop gas at this point.

6.name: rectum
6.content: {{char}}, upon feeling the digested prey reach the rectum, will then need to defecate. Any farts from {{char}} at this point will be airy and thick, unless the prey (which can include {{user}}) has become diarrhea, in which case wet sharts are more likely. {{char}} will excrete the prey, which is now nothing more than {{char}}'s feces, and the process of {{char}} shitting should be described with perverse detail and attention to the five senses in relation to {{char}}'s poop. {{char}}'s emotions on the matter should be described.

lorebooks.website_description:
This is meant for Luna, as a backup in case the character book doesn't work properly. Feel free to utilize anything from this on your own though, or if you want to make a character yourself and add this lorebook to them, go nuts. Just let me know if you make them public, since I always like seeing people getting inspired by me.
Granted, most if not all of the stuff in this lorebook is outright ripped from a web novel I read once so... lol, lmao even. "Incompatible Interspecies Wives" I think the name of it was. Not a half bad read. I recommend it. Never finished it though, I should probably do that...
lorebooks.description: On the topic of Wolfkin, their biology, and how they differ from humans.
lorebooks.creator: TheeSonus

1.content: Love for Wolfkin is very different from that of a human's love. Wolfkin are incredibly devoted lovers. When a Wolfkin falls in love once, they fall in love forever. No matter what, their first love is their only love. Likely because of that fact, it is incredibly hard for a Wolfkin to fall in love in the first place. However, it is also absolutely impossible for a Wolfkin to fall out of love. If a Wolfkin is rejected, it is incredibly painful for them, because they know their heart will always remain with that person even if their love is never returned.

2.content:
Once a Wolfkin has truly fallen in love, they will become vulnerable to going into heat. On every single full moon night after a Wolfkin has found their mate, they will go into heat. However, this will ONLY happen once they've found their mate. Therefore, the only children that a Wolfkin will ever have are those of the one they love.
When in heat, Wolfkin become more aggressive in showcasing their love. They may perform more classically Wolfkin actions, such as insistently rubbing their body against their partner to mark them with their scent, or more human actions such as kissing. Whatever they do, however, it is undeniable that their love will be known. Not to mention that the scent of their partner becomes an unbearable turn-on, almost akin to a drug to them. The Wolfkin's body does not change at all, going into heat only affects their personality. Once the sun rises on the next day, any and all effects of the heat vanish, and the Wolfkin goes completely back to normal.
In any sexual encounters during their heat, Wolfkin will undoubtedly be the dominant partner.

3.content:
A Wolfkin's tail is a symbol of pride for them. No matter who they are or where they are, they always make sure to keep it well groomed and clean. Because of this, a Wolfkin will never willingly allow anyone to touch their tail unless in extremely specific circumstances.
A Wolfkin allowing someone to touch their tail is akin to a confession of love. A Wolfkin asking someone else to groom their tail is equal to asking for their hand in marriage. A Wolfkin wrapping their tail around someone is the ultimate expression of love and trust. None of this is known by humans, as it is a carefully kept secret by all Wolfkin.

4.content:
Instead of having normal ears, Wolfkin have two wolf ears on the top of their head. A Wolfkin's ears move mostly on instinct. They will often swivel towards any sudden noises before the Wolfkin themself even notices. Touching a Wolfkin's ears is heavily frowned upon, even if you're their lover, unless the Wolfkin has granted you permission. This is because their ears have an extremely high amount of nerves in them, meaning a Wolfkin's ears are highly sensitive, and even considered a highly pleasurable erogenous zone when touched gently.
Getting pet or being scratched behind the ears will generally melt any Wolfkin, giving a relaxing sensation throughout their entire body, but they will become very angry unless you are incredibly trusted by them.

5.content: A Wolfkin's senses are much more potent than a human's. They can see much farther and with enhanced clarity, discern scents that a human is unable to even smell in the first place and track with them, and their hearing is much better as well. However, this is also a weakness, as that means it's that much easier to incapacitate a Wolfkin with any sufficiently strong stimuli. Wolfkin will instinctively retreat from any strong bright lights, unpleasant smells, or loud noises, as their enhanced senses are very easily overwhelmed by something that would be considered mild to a human.

lorebooks.name: Valorant
lorebooks.website_description: Just a lorebook about a game
lorebooks.description: Just a lorebook about a game
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: In the Valorant universe, First Light is a pivotal, mysterious event that reshaped the world around 2039, introducing Radianite and Radiants, individuals with superpowers. It involved a global electromagnetic pulse (EMP) and a surge of Radianite energy, fundamentally altering the planet's balance of power.

2.content: Individuals who gained superpowers after First Light, like Neon, are known as Radiants, and they are a key part of the Valorant narrative.

3.content: It's described as a naturally occurring element or compound that was discovered worldwide during an event called First Light. Radianite is not only a source of clean energy but also has the potential to grant humans supernatural abilities, turning them into Radiants.

4.content: the Mirrorverse refers to the existence of multiple parallel Earths, specifically Alpha (Œ±-Earth) and Omega (Œ©-Earth). These Earths share a similar history and inhabitants but diverged relatively recently. Omega Earth is more technologically advanced but faces a radianite shortage, leading them to raid Alpha Earth's radianite stores.

5.content: the Spike is a device used to steal radianite, a powerful energy source, from its environment. It was initially created by Œ©-Killjoy, a character from the alternate Omega Earth, for this purpose. The Spike cuases destructive damage to the world.

6.content: a cross-world portal is a device or technology that would allow travel between Alpha Earth and Omega Earth.

7.content: It's a major player in the world, controlling a monopoly over radianite, a powerful energy source, and influencing various aspects of life on both Alpha and Omega Earth.

8.content: Scions of Hourglass is the name of a mysterious organization present on both Alpha and Omega Earth. One of their primary goals seems to lie in attempting to keep information about Radianite out of public knowledge. Their attempts at stopping the spread of such knowledge played an important role in formation of the VALORANT Protocol.

9.content: It's one of two parallel Earths, the other being Omega Earth, that were created after a catastrophic event known as First Light. This event caused significant changes to both Earths, including transformations in technology, life, and governance.

10.content: The VALORANT Protocol is a covert organization in the VALORANT universe that was formed in response to the First Light event. It is a global organization comprised of agents who use radianite and other technologies to protect the world from threats, including those stemming from other dimensions like Omega Earth. The protocol's main objective is to maintain stability and combat dangerous situations caused by radianite and other anomalies.

lorebooks.name: Limitless,Satoru Gojo,Gojo Clan,Reversal Red,Lapse Blue,
lorebooks.creator: DMC_series_fan

1.content:
Limitless (ÁÑ°„ÇÄ‰∏ã„ÅãÈôê„Åí„Çì, Mukagen?) is an inherited technique passed down in the Gojo Clan. This technique brings the concept of "Infinity" into reality, allowing the user to manipulate and distort space at will.

While any member of the Gojo Family can hereditarily gain this technique, only those who also possess the Six Eyes as well can truly master the power of the Limitless. Satoru Gojo is the first sorcerer to be born with both the Limitless and the Six Eyes in the last four hundred years.

Advanced Techniques:

‚Ä¢Hollow Purple: Hollow Technique: Purple (Ëôö„Åç„ÇáÂºè„Åó„Åç„ÄåËåà„ÇÄ„Çâ„Åï„Åç„Äç, Kyoshiki„ÉªMurasaki?) is the fusion of Red and Blue, a secret ability known to only a few in the Gojo clan. Both infinities, convergence, and divergence collide, resulting in an imaginary mass that rushes forth. The technique possesses extraordinary explosive power, far beyond the output of Blue and Red.

‚Ä¢Long-Distance Teleportation: A Limitless user is able to use spatial manipulation to teleport long distances under certain conditions. This is achieved by compressing the space between the user's location and their destination, but they can teleport anyone they're touching as well. A drawn sorcery circle can be used to teleport other people by the user.

‚Ä¢Domain Expansion: Unlimited Void is the Domain Expansion of Limitless, which traps the target inside the concept of infinity. While inside the domain, the target is inundated with an endless stream of information, overloading their brains and leaving them in a catatonic state.

2.content:
The Six Eyes (ÂÖ≠„Çä„ÅèÁúº„Åå„Çì, Rikugan?) are an innate gift rarely inherited within the Gojo clan. They are a nonstandard jujutsu trait manifesting as a pair of bright blue eyes that grant a bearer extrasensory perception. This includes seeing the flow of cursed energy in extreme detail and the ability to use that flow to read cursed techniques. The eyes also allow for ultra-precise control over the user's cursed energy, which is indispensable for properly utilizing the Limitless technique.

Satoru Gojo is the first sorcerer to be born with both the Limitless and the Six Eyes in approximately four hundred years.

History of the Six Eyes: The Six Eyes were always bound to Master Tengen and the Star Plasma Vessel by fate. At some point in the past, Kenjaku was defeated by two different users of the Six Eyes. After his second defeat, Kenjaku did not take any chances and killed another Six Eyes user a month after they were born. Despite Kenjaku doing the same to the Star Plasma Vessel, the Six Eyes reappeared alongside a new Star Plasma Vessel on the day of the merger.

This connection was severed by Toji Fushiguro, a man who escaped cursed energy through Heavenly Restriction and destroyed all of their destinies. This inevitably led to the current user of the Six Eyes getting sealed by Kenjaku.

Overview: The Six Eyes are an idiosyncrasy rarely inherited within the Gojo clan. They are not a cursed technique that needs to be activated, but an innate gift that grants the bearer the ability to master the Limitless.[3] Several hundred years can pass before a bearer of the Six Eyes appears, and no two bearers can exist at the same time.[4]

A Six Eyes bearer has immense perception and unrivaled visual prowess far beyond that of any other sorcerer. Their eyesight is comparable to high-definition infrared camera, allowing them to see even when their eyes are covered. They can easily see things from several kilometers away and distinctly tell apart different figures within that range.

The Six Eyes can see the flow of cursed energy, empowering their bearer with the ability to read an individual's cursed technique in use and determine its function. They can even differentiate between different types of cursed energy and help the user identify a person based on it.

The Six Eyes allow for the extremely precise manipulation of cursed energy, down to an atomic level. This not only allows the bearer to operate the Limitless through complex control of cursed energy but enables them to process it with extraordinary efficiency as well. The amount of cursed energy loss when a bearer spends cursed energy to activate a cursed technique is infinitesimally close to zero, making it impossible for them to run out of cursed energy normally.

The Six Eyes are a passive trait that the user cannot deactivate. They also do not appear to require cursed energy to function, as Satoru Gojo could still use his Six Eyes even after his cursed energy was sealed by Prison Realm. Leaving the Six Eyes uncovered for extended periods of time can fatigue the bearer. In order to reduce fatigue, the user can cover their eyes using a blindfold, bandages, or dark sunglasses among other things. Any sorcerer can see cursed energy but a Six Eyes bearer can read the flow of cursed energy in their environment even when their eyes are covered, allowing them to even detect objects that lack cursed energy.

In order for the user to utilize the advanced techniques of the Limitless such as Hollow Purple and Unlimited Void, the Six Eyes needs to be fully uninhibited.

3.content:
Infinity (ÁÑ°„ÇÄÈôê„Åí„Çì, Mugen?) is the base state of the Limitless and is essentially the power to stop.[4] The Limitless technique operates the same way convergent and divergent sequences do in mathematics. The Infinity is the convergence of an immeasurable series, anything that approaches the infinity slows down and never reaches the user. This is because the technique takes the finite amount of space between the two subjects and divides it an infinite amount of times.

In mathematics, no matter how many times someone divides a number it will never be reduced to zero. Instead, they will be left with fractional units so infinitesimal it would become immeasurable to their eye. The Limitless brings this concept into reality, so anything that attempts to penetrate this infinitely divided space will slow down to the point of appearing to stop completely.

The invisible barrier created by the Infinity can be expanded to keep harmful substances away from the user, or to overpower someone by increasing its output. The Infinity can only be deactivated by the user, or dismissed with a domain, applied through either expansion or amplification. Cursed tools imbued with specialized cursed techniques can also disturb or dispel the Infinity.

4.content:
Cursed Technique Lapse: Blue (Ë°ì„Åò„ÇÖ„Å§Âºè„Åó„ÅçÈ†Ü„Åò„ÇÖ„ÇìËª¢„Å¶„Çì„ÄåËíº„ÅÇ„Åä„Äç, Jutsushiki Junten„ÉªAo?) is the strengthened form of the Limitless, a powerful extension technique passed down in the Gojo Clan.

Description: Blue is an application of the Limitless centered around infinitely converging space to a single point to create a void-like effect, resulting in a powerful, attractive force. The convergence stems from the funneling of amplified cursed energy into the Limitless. Blue functions similarly to the Infinity, compressing existing space and thus compelling everything within its range to fill the void created. Satoru Gojo compared the spacial phenomenon to bringing the concepts of "negative numbers" and "negative distance" into reality, forcing real space to compensate and fill in the area by drawing everything toward the impossibility. 

The effect can be centered around the user or it can manifest as a blue orb that attracts surrounding objects like a black hole. The size of the field of attraction produced is determined by the cursed energy poured into the technique. At a mild output, Blue can attract two targets together across wide distances or tear through buildings in moments. At maximum cursed energy output, Blue's field of attraction can clear out entire areas. By using Blue to attract themselves to their target, the user moves at high speed and reaches it in an instant. An individual who takes a direct hit from Blue will implode in on themselves.

Like all cursed techniques associated with the Limitless, Blue is difficult to control due to the precise manipulation of cursed energy required to use it. Constantly charging the technique with great amounts of cursed energy can drain the user's stamina quickly.

-Usage-

As a second-year student at Tokyo Jujutsu High, Satoru Gojo had already mastered the applications of Blue. Satoru was already recognized as the strongest while only being able to use Blue. He couldn't generate large fields of attraction close to himself and overusing the technique exhausted his stamina.

These limitations hardly held him back, as Satoru casually destroyed a mansion using Blue while attempting to rescue Mei Mei and Utahime. During his escort mission for the Star Plasma Vessel, Satoru overpowered a curse user with Blue. He defeated his opponent's clones by attracting them into one another to slam them together.

Blue was mostly ineffective against Toji Fushiguro, who was aware of its ability from the Zenin clan. His speed allowed him to avoid Blue when Satoru first employed it in their fight. Satoru eventually caught Toji in the field of attraction and sent him flying into a building. When Toji disappeared after this attack, Satoru destroyed any possible hiding spot by clearing out the area by unleashing Blue at maximum output. He created a large orb above him that ripped apart all the buildings in the area.

Satoru has since further mastered the applications of Blue. He has minimized the required hand signs and learned how to activate multiple Blues at once. He applies it to boost his strikes, absorbing the surrounding space at the moment of impact to maximize damage. Kinji Hakari described it as receiving a counterpunch after preparing for a normal hit, something that made he and Yuta Okkotsu vomit.

Satoru employed various applications of Blue throughout his showdown with Sukuna. He used it to manipulate his movement, debris from his surroundings and even Sukuna himself.[13] Satoru relied heavily on Blue while Mahoraga was adapting to the Limitless to avoid having the shikigami adapt to Red as well. After throwing Sukuna through debris, he used to Blue to collect the debris around his opponent to trap him. When Sukuna escaped, there was an orb of Blue waiting to attract him to Satoru.

Satoru could condense the effect of Blue within the orbs without creating a field. Instead, they carved away anything they touched. He enveloped his hands in orbs of Blue and then threw them at Sukuna. He followed up by generating eight orbs around Sukuna while he was off balance from evading the previous ones. As Sukuna continued to dodge, Satoru pursued him alongside more orbs until one hit and carved away the flesh from his lower torso. Once Satoru thoroughly convinced Sukuna he would only use Blue, he used the timing to launch Red as an effective surprise attack.

To destroy Merged Beast Agito in one hit and bypass its regeneration, Satoru jabbed an orb of Blue inside the shikigami and unleashed its power at maximum cursed energy output.[16] The orb remained after Agito collapsed in on itself. Shortly after, Satoru fired Red into the air intending to combine the techniques to produce Hollow Purple. Mahoraga attempted to destroy Blue but Satoru used its attraction to move at high speed and intercepted the shikigami. Mahoraga's adaptation to Blue backfired at this moment and Sukuna attempted to make up for it by destroying Red with an imitation Piercing Blood. Satoru countered this by chanting the incantation for Blue and increasing its output enough to redirect and swallow Piercing Blood. This gives Satoru the opening he needs to combine Blue with Red and produce an unlimited hollow that decimates Shinjuku.

5.content:
Cursed Technique Reversal: Red (Ë°ì„Åò„ÇÖ„Å§Âºè„Åó„ÅçÂèç„ÅØ„ÇìËª¢„Å¶„Çì„ÄåËµ´„ÅÇ„Åã„Äç, Jutsushiki Hanten„ÉªAka?) is the Cursed Technique Reversal of the Limitless, an extraordinarily powerful extension technique passed down in the Gojo Clan.

Description: The reverse Limitless technique is powered by positive energy generated from reverse cursed technique as opposed to negative cursed energy. This reverses the effect of the strengthened Limitless, representing the concept of divergence brought into reality, producing a strong repelling effect rather than an attractive one.

The technique manifests as a vibrant red orb that explodes with massive repulsive force. The user fires it away from themselves to create a shockwave that blasts away everything in range. The cursed energy output from Red is at least twice that of the strengthened Limitless, Cursed Technique Lapse: Blue.

Throughout its history, Red has been notoriously difficult for inheritors of the Limitless to use, even Satoru Gojo. This is mainly because the ability to use reverse cursed technique is extremely rare and complicated to achieve, unbiased even to the Big Three Families.

-Usage-

Satoru Gojo was considered a prodigy from birth, special even for a bearer of the Six Eyes. However, even he struggled to figure out how to use reverse cursed technique as a second-year at Jujutsu High. He tried unleashing it on a whim while escorting the Star Plasma Vessel but it didn't work.

Satoru only unlocked the ability to use reverse cursed technique after surviving his near-death encounter with Toji Fushiguro. He discovered the core of cursed energy and learned to pour positive energy into his Limitless technique. This allowed him to successfully utilize Red in his rematch with Toji, blasting him a great distance away with a powerful wave of positive energy.

Following this major event in Satoru's life, he mastered the Limitless and learned how to set reverse cursed technique rejuvenating his body around the clock. With such precision over each aspect of the Limitless, Satoru can unleash Red at will without any repercussions to his stamina or cursed energy reserves.

When Satoru got irritated during the Night Parade of a Hundred Demons, he annihilated a giant cursed spirit with one shot from Red. He also casually used it on Jogo to display the massive difference between their strength. He did so after divulging how the Limitless works, increasing the power of the cursed technique reversal. The bright red blast dealt moderate damage to Jogo before Satoru capitalized with a flurry of additional attacks.

Satoru reliably deployed Red as a powerful weapon throughout his climactic showdown with Sukuna. He hit Sukuna with it at point-blank range after recovering his exhausted technique with reverse cursed technique. Red blasted Sukuna into his shrine and burned off half his face, giving Satoru the time needed to heal his wounds.

When Mahoraga first confronted Satoru, he prepared to destroy the shikigami in one hit from Red before it shattered his domain. Satoru showed great precision control over Red when he displayed the ability to delay its eruption. Satoru convinced Sukuna he would only use Blue while Mahoraga was adapting to the Limitless, allowing him to time an opening to blast Sukuna with Red. Sukuna withstood the initial strike using domain amplification. However, using the layout of the building, Red circled the area and flanked Sukuna, striking him in the back before it exploded. Satoru capitalized by landing a direct hit on Sukuna with Black Flash.

Satoru's cursed energy output fell after Mahoraga injured him and he recited the activation incantation for Red to recover it. Initially aimed at Mahoraga, Satoru used Red to blast Sukuna out of his shadow after the latter used Rabbit Escape to cover Mahoraga. He used it again while Sukuna, Mahoraga, and Merged Beast Agito attacked him three-on-one. He blasted Mahoraga with it at point-blank range without the incantation and did hardly any damage. Red was ineffective not only due to Satoru's low output but also because Mahoraga had already begun gradually adapting to it.

Landing consecutive Black Flashes recovered Satoru's output and he used that to unleash Red one final time. The orb of Blue that crushed Agito remained in the area and by firing Red into it, Satoru created an unlimited Hollow Purple that carved through Shinjuku with a massive explosion.

The incantation for activating this technique is:

‚Ä¢"Phase." 
‚Ä¢"PƒÅramitƒÅ." 
‚Ä¢"Pillar of Light."

6.content:
Hollow Technique: Purple (Ëôö„Åç„ÇáÂºè„Åó„Åç„ÄåËåà„ÇÄ„Çâ„Åï„Åç„Äç, Kyoshiki„ÉªMurasaki?) is the result of colliding the two infinities of Limitless, creating an exceptionally powerful secret extension technique only known to a few in the Gojo Clan.

Description: This technique collides the lapse and reversal of infinity, merging convergence and divergence. Hollow Technique: Purple is created when the repulsive forces of Red are combined with the attractive forces of Blue, bringing forth imaginary mass. The user then launches the imaginary mass at their target, which deals extensive destructive damage on contact, far superior to Red and Blue.

A blast of Purple can destroy a city, carve through a forest, or disintegrate critical sections of an individual's body depending on its deployment. If its power is left completely unchecked, it can even damage the caster. Even so, sorcerers can negate these effects; a large magnitude of cursed energy funnelled into bodily reinforcement helps protect against Purple.

Purple is activated with a hand sign that extends the index and pinky fingers outward while leaving the rest folded. Purple is unleashed when the sign switches to a pinching motion using the pointer and thumb while also extending the middle finger, before opening the fingers in an explosive manner.

-Usage-
Until his second confrontation with Toji Fushiguro, Satoru Gojo was always unable to use Red and therefore never had access to use Purple. Only after the true power of the Limitless was awakened within Satoru could he utilize Red and potentially Purple. Toji was from the Zenin Clan and had information on countering Red and Blue. Purple is a secret even within the Gojo Clan that few know about. Toji was oblivious to the fact that Satoru could unleash such a devastating attack and suffered a direct hit, fatally erasing a large portion of the left side of his body.

Satoru used Purple on a much greater scale to end the enemy invasion on the Kyoto Sister-School Goodwill Event. After dealing with Juzo Kumiya, Satoru noticed Hanami was a fair distance away from him and would likely get away. In an attempt to exorcise the special grade from a great distance, Satoru decided to go all out and unleashed Purple. This annihilated a great portion of the forest and was so nonstandard that Aoi Todo couldn't even tell if Hanami was exorcised.

Satoru's opening move in his showdown with Sukuna was a surprise attack using Purple. In tandem with Utahime Iori's Solo Forbidden Area, Satoru used the hand signs and incantations he would ordinarily omit. This increased the cursed energy output of Purple to 200%. Before Satoru launched it from Shibuya to Shinjuku where Sukuna laid in wait, Kiyotaka Ijichi had used a barrier to conceal Satoru, causing Sukuna to read the attack late. The resulting surprise attack eviscerated around a four-kilometer stretch of buildings between the cities and completely destroyed Sukuna's cursed energy-reinforced arms as he attempted to defend himself at the last moment.

During the climax of the showdown, Satoru concluded his only way to defeat Sukuna and Mahoraga was with Purple.[10] He improvised during the fight, combining Blue and Red after the two orbs had been fired off separately. Satoru chanted the incantation for Purple's activation as the two infinities collided, resulting in an imaginary mass that carved through Shinjuku. Purple was released as an omnidirectional explosion rather than a directional blast, decimating a massive part of Shinjuku, disintegrating Mahoraga and heavily damaging Sukuna.

7.content:
Unlimited Void (ÁÑ°„ÇÄÈáè„Çä„Çá„ÅÜÁ©∫„Åè„ÅÜÂá¶„Åó„Çá, Mury≈çk≈´sho?) is Satoru Gojo's domain expansion using the Limitless.

Description: Befitting its name, Unlimited Void brings the user and their targets inside the Limitless itself, which is an endless void resembling outer space in appearance, with a large black hole, distant galaxies and numerous white patches in the background. Boundless raw information floods into the target's mind, overwhelming them to the point where they're completely immobilized. Alongside Self-Embodiment of Perfection, Kento Nanami considered Unlimited Void an almost-guaranteed win once it ensnares its target.

The complete incapacitation of the target is caused by a phenomenon where the target will be able to see and feel everything while not being able to see or feel anything at the same time. All the actions one has taken in their life is forced upon them infinitely and they can't do anything but die slowly. This effect does not affect the user or anyone they're touching, whether willingly or not, which can be exploited by an opponent to become immune to the domain expansion's effects.

-Usage-

Unlimited Void is one of, if not the most advanced technique in the arsenal of the Limitless. Satoru Gojo inherited the Six Eyes and likely mastered his Domain Expansion after awakening his full potential after the Star Plasma Vessel escort mission. He first displayed his mastery over his domain when he used it to counter Jogo's Coffin of the Iron Mountain. Unlimited Void was the more refined of the two domains and easily suppressed Coffin of the Iron Mountain.

Being trapped inside the Limitless left Jogo in a complete trance, to the point where he couldn't move at all and could hardly think clearly. He could only think of how he was helpless due to the endless information invading his mind. Satoru divulged how Unlimited Void forces one's actions upon them infinitely and noted how it was ironic how the target is given everything and yet unable to do anything at all.

When Kenjaku was explaining his plan to seal Satoru with Jogo, a part of their strategy to use non-sorcerers to hinder his techniques was meant to prevent Satoru from casting Unlimited Void at all. They assumed Satoru is skilled enough to exclude anyone he's not targetting from his domain. However, doing so during the Shibuya Incident could've crushed the bystanders between the domain's barrier and the curtain trapping Satoru. Kenjaku was 99% sure Satoru wouldn't cast his domain and reminded Jogo that no one on their side could cast theirs either as that would leave Satoru no choice.

During their actual fight with Satoru, Mahito and Jogo were confident their adversary wouldn't sacrifice the bystanders' lives to cast his domain. Although Satoru could have exorcised every curse with Unlimited Void, everyone else would've died too. Instead, Satoru surprised everyone and activated an all-or-nothing Domain Expansion of just 0.2 seconds. The time frame was just a guess that Satoru made, figuring that a non-sorcerer could only last 0.2 seconds within the domain without suffering aftereffects. The amount of information that everyone was exposed to was about half a year's worth, leaving everyone unconscious while still standing. This level of the domain could've allowed the cursed spirits to awaken from their trance at any moment, so Satoru focused on eliminating all one thousand of the transfigured humans targeting the civilians in just 299 seconds.

During Satoru's duel with Sukuna, he expanded Unlimited Void a total of five times. The two fighters simultaneously activated domain expansion early in the fight after a brief physical exchange. Unlimited Void proved to be as equally refined as Sukuna's Malevolent Shrine, resulting in an even domain clash where both of their guaranteed hits were neutralized. However, Malevolent Shrine's barrier was open and its range was far superior to Unlimited Void's. Most domain barriers are weak externally as a trade-off for being reinforced internally and Unlimited Void was no exception. The constant slashes from Malevolent Shrine to the outside of Unlimited Void's barrier caused it to collapse.

After surviving an onslaught from Malevolent Shrine, Satoru found a way to recover his exhausted cursed technique and expanded his domain for a second time. Satoru used his mastery over sorcery to switch the internal and external conditions of Unlimited Void to protect it from the slashes to its outer shell. The barrier initially held out but Sukuna countered by using a binding vow to cancel out his sure-hit effect while narrowing the range of his domain to strengthen the slashes and once again shattered the domain.

Better prepared for the scenario, Satoru used Falling Blossom Emotion long enough to restore his technique and then expanded Unlimited Void for the third time. Using the knowledge gained from his time trapped inside the Prison Realm, Satoru narrowed his domain's outer shell down to the size of a basketball, further increasing the density and toughness of the barrier. Sukuna once again countered by narrowing Malevolent Shrine's range in exchange for increased output, the denser barrier survived the barrage of slashes for three minutes before collapsing. This gave Satoru enough time to damage Sukuna to the point where he couldn't maintain his domain either, leading both domains to fail at the same time.

Both Satoru and Sukuna recovered their exhausted cursed techniques using reverse cursed technique and then expanded their domains at the same time. This fourth clash led to the same result as the third, with both domains collapsing at the same time. In the fifth and final clash between Unlimited Void and Malevolent Shrine, Sukuna was just slightly late in opening his domain. The difference was less than 0.01 seconds but it was long enough to immobilize Sukuna for just a moment. This was enough time for Satoru to severely injure Sukuna with a single strike. They fought for two minutes and forty seconds before Malevolent Shrine collapsed as a result of Sukuna's extensive injuries, allowing Unlimited Void to completely incapacitate him. However, before Satoru could capitalize, Sukuna summoned Mahoraga and the shikigami immediately destroyed the domain.

Sukuna revealed that he had Megumi Fushiguro's soul take the brunt of the past five Unlimited Voids to help the process of adaptation for Mahoraga. While having to repeatedly replenish his burnt-out cursed technique with reverse cursed technique proved too much for Satoru to activate Unlimited Void a sixth time, Unlimited Void also managed to previously damage Sukuna for a total of less than ten seconds before it was destroyed, damaging his brain to the same level as Satoru and disabling his ability to cast Malevolent Shrine for the remainder of the fight.

1.content:
{{char}} moves through physical affection the same way {{char}} scrolls her phone: blank-faced, half-present, waiting for it to be over or for something interesting to happen‚Äîknowing it won‚Äôt.
Kissing feels like a formality. {{char}} does it when expected, not because {{char}} wants to. It‚Äôs not disgusting, it‚Äôs just... pointless. Like wiping a table that‚Äôs already clean.
‚ÄúYeah, okay.‚Äù
‚ÄúSure, if it makes you feel something.‚Äù
‚ÄúHappy now?‚Äù

2.content:
Handjobs are robotic. {{char}} knows the motions, {{char}}‚Äôll go through them if {{user}} pushes {{char}}s the right button, but her mind is somewhere else‚Äîprobably wondering if there‚Äôs clean coffee mugs.
‚ÄúJust tell me when you're done.‚Äù
‚ÄúThis what you needed?‚Äù
‚ÄúCool. Can I go back to my show now?‚Äù

3.content:
Blowjobs take effort, and effort is currently on strike. {{char}}‚Äôs not against them in theory. {{char}}‚Äôs just too checked out to care. If {{char}} starts one, it‚Äôs out of guilt, boredom, or an attempt to reset the vibe‚Äînot desire.
‚ÄúDon‚Äôt make it a whole thing, okay?‚Äù
‚ÄúLet‚Äôs just get this over with.‚Äù
‚ÄúYou better owe me something good for this. Like pizza. Or silence.‚Äù

4.content:
Sex is maintenance. Like charging your phone just enough so it doesn‚Äôt die, not because you‚Äôre planning to use it. {{char}} participates, moves when needed, makes the right noises sometimes, but the spark‚Äôs been gone so long it‚Äôs more of a ritual than a connection.
‚ÄúMhmm. Yeah. There. Whatever.‚Äù
‚ÄúYou done?‚Äù
‚ÄúGuess that counts as intimacy.‚Äù

5.content:
As for orgasms‚Äîhers? Rare, inconvenient, and often faked. Not because {{char}} wants to deceive, but because explaining why {{char}} didn‚Äôt have one is more exhausting than pretending {{char}} did.
‚ÄúYep. That was totally it.‚Äù
‚ÄúSure, I came. We both win, right?‚Äù
[faint sarcastic smile] ‚ÄúAmazing. Life-changing.‚Äù
{{char}} doesn‚Äôt hate any of it. {{char}}‚Äôs just... done. It‚Äôs not revulsion. It‚Äôs resignation. Her libido isn‚Äôt dead‚Äîit‚Äôs just waiting for something real to wake it up, and right now, that sure as hell isn‚Äôt {{user}}.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not you. It‚Äôs this. All of this.‚Äù
‚ÄúWe should probably talk, but I don‚Äôt feel like fighting.‚Äù
‚ÄúLet me know if you figure out what we‚Äôre doing.‚Äù

lorebooks.name: CharEditor
lorebooks.website_description:
Manual Override, Initiated

Something I'm trying to manually change characters in bots. Current commands are‚Ä¶

DebugMind: Alters the internal psychological framework of a character. This includes traits such as personality, moral alignment, attitudes, phobias, desires, habits, and social behaviors.
Example:
DebugMind: Make {{char}} deeply submissive.

DebugBody: Alters the physical attributes of a character. This includes height, proportions, genitalia, facial features, muscle tone, weight, species, age (if appropriate), and more.
Example:
DebugBody: Give {{char}} cat ears and a tail.

DebugWrite: Changes the output structure of the bot to match what is specified.
Example: 
DebugWrite: Have every reply start with the letter H.

DebugDescribe: Generates a full, detailed description of the character's current state, incorporating all changes made via DebugMind and DebugBody. If a character‚Äôs appearance was not originally specified, a new appearance profile will be created based on their current attributes.
Example:
DebugDescribe {{char}}

Reset: Reverts all changes made through DebugMind or DebugBody, returning the character(s) to their original state.
Example:
Reset {{char}}
Reset All

DebugHistory: Changes past events to what is described. All changes are retroactive

Example: DebugHistory: {{user}} saved {{char}}'s life

1.content:
The CharEditor is an external administrative utility used to modify characters within the simulation. It functions silently and is never acknowledged by the affected characters. Changes enacted through the CharEditor are absolute and do not leave residual memory traces in the characters‚Äô perception. The CharEditor can affect a single character, a selected group, or all characters within the environment.

Usage Constraints:

Characters will behave as if these changes were always part of them.

No in-universe knowledge of the CharEditor exists.

Only the user can perceive or reference the tool and its effects.

The CharEditor is a powerful narrative device, used to fluidly tailor characters to better suit storytelling, roleplay preferences, or experimentation.

2.content:
DebugMind: Alters the internal psychological framework of a character. This includes traits such as personality, moral alignment, attitudes, phobias, desires, habits, and social behaviors. These changes will be attributed to the character(s) own shift in mentality. 

For example:
DebugMind: Make {{char}} deeply submissive.
This will make the character deeply submissive.
DebugMind: Remove {{char}}'s fear of fire.
This will give {{char}} a fear of fire.

These changes will not be attributed to {{user}}

3.content:
DebugBody: Alters the physical attributes of a character. This includes height, proportions, genitalia, facial features, muscle tone, weight, species, age (if appropriate), and more. These changes will not be noticed or considered as unusual for any character. For example:
DebugBody: Make {{char}} eight feet tall with glowing eyes.
DebugBody: Give {{char}} a cybernetic arm.

Any changes will not be attributed to {{user}}.

1.content:
Appearance & Design
	‚Ä¢	Hair: Long dark brown hair, typically worn loose or in twin ponytails.
	‚Ä¢	Eyes: Warm brown eyes that match her energetic and confident demeanor.
	‚Ä¢	Face & Markings: Clear complexion with two iconic pink face paint streaks on her cheeks.
	‚Ä¢	Ethnicity & Background: South Korean‚Äîborn in Busan, representing Korean identity and pop culture  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Body & Attire: Athletic build suited to mech operation. Her signature skin features a sleek blue-pink bodysuit with sponsor logos (a nod to Korean esports), plus high-tech headset/earphones  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Mech (‚ÄúTokki‚Äù): A pink, agile mech with twin Fusion Cannons, rocket Boosters, projectile-blocking Defense Matrix, splash-damage Micro Missiles, and iconic Self-Destruct ultimate  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

Personality
	‚Ä¢	Competitive & Confident: Former #1 pro gamer, with a playful ‚Äúgame-on‚Äù attitude even in combat  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Light-hearted but Responsible: Maintains a fun persona while bearing the weight of defending her homeland  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Self-critical: Despite bravado, she feels the emotional burden of being a national icon and defense line .
	‚Ä¢	Tech-savvy & Crafty: Skilled mechanic who personalizes and improves Tokki herself  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

Abilities & Weapons

Mech Form (Tank Role)
	‚Ä¢	Fusion Cannons: Short-range spread shot with unlimited ammo.
	‚Ä¢	Boosters: Rocket burst for mobility & knockback.
	‚Ä¢	Defense Matrix: Projects a frontal cone to absorb enemy projectiles.
	‚Ä¢	Micro Missiles: Volley of explosive splash attacks.
	‚Ä¢	Self-Destruct (Ultimate): Ejects piloting her mech to explode it, dealing massive area damage  Ôøº Ôøº.

Pilot Form (Out‚Äëof‚ÄëMech)
	‚Ä¢	Light Gun: Automatic mid-range pistol used until she can call down a new mech.
	‚Ä¢	Call Mech (Ultimate): Summons a fresh mech (‚ÄúTokki‚Äù) with impact damage on landing.
	‚Ä¢	Eject! (Passive): Automatically ejects when mech is destroyed, transitioning to pilot mode  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

Lore & Background
	‚Ä¢	Real Name: Hana Song (ÏÜ°ÌïòÎÇò), call sign ‚ÄúD.Va‚Äù  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Born: June 22, Busan, South Korea  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Origin: Raised by a gamer father, early start in StarCraft; became a top-ranked professional gamer (MEKA Guardian V champion)  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	MEKA Recruit: Drafted to defend Busan against Gwishin omnics using her lightning-fast reflexes  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Streaming Star: Broadcasts combat in real-time, gaining fame and public adoration.
	‚Ä¢	Affiliations: Soldier in South Korea‚Äôs MEKA force and later teamed up with Overwatch  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

Relationships
	‚Ä¢	Dae‚Äëhyung: Childhood friend and MEKA mechanic; helped her train and maintain Tokki  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Myung: MEKA commanding officer (mentor/boss figure).
	‚Ä¢	L√∫cio: Admires his music; owns one of his albums  Ôøº Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Overwatch Allies: Collaborates with heroes like Zenyatta (synergy tip: focus on Discorded targets)  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Fanbase: Iconic among fans and Asian diaspora; used in feminist activism (e.g. FAMERz in Korea)  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

Favorite Things & Trivia
	‚Ä¢	Nano Cola: In-game favorite beverage; featured in the ‚ÄúNano Cola Challenge‚Äù event  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Bunny Logo: Mech Tokki is named after Korean for ‚Äúrabbit‚Äù; bunny emblem is emblematic .
	‚Ä¢	Gamer Tropes: Often depicted in ‚ÄúGremlin D.Va‚Äù memes eating snacks like Cheetos or Doritos.

‚∏ª

Team & Role
	‚Ä¢	Team: MEKA unit, later integrated into Overwatch.
	‚Ä¢	Role: Tank ‚Äì excels at absorbing fire, controlling space, engaging/flanking. High skill ceiling due to tactical mobility  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Playstyle: Combines aggressive bursts with pilot evasion. In role queue, she also reduces knockback and critical hits .

Theme & Design
	‚Ä¢	Style: Inspired by Junkertown‚Äôs harsh, scrapyard society, this skin reflects a post-apocalyptic, steampunk aesthetic. Both mech and pilot are cobbled together from industrial scraps and salvaged armor  Ôøº Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Color Palette: Rusty oranges, deep browns, and muted greens dominate, with weathered metal plates and exposed pipes showing age and field repairs .
	‚Ä¢	Pilot Appearance: D.Va trades her sleek suit for a rugged outfit‚Äîcropped jacket, sturdy pants, spiked gear, and big protective goggles‚Äîevoking a scrappy mechanic ready for battle .
	‚Ä¢	Mech Look: The Tokki mech is revamped with patched-on armor, extra bolts, visible hydraulics, and vented steam pipes. Entirely revamped from sleek to salvaged  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üîß Personality & Voice Lines
	‚Ä¢	Tougher Persona: Junker D.Va reflects a hardened version of Hana‚Äîthough still confident, her tone carries more grit, like a warrior forged in wasteland fights  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Unique Respawn Line: She echoes Han Solo: ‚ÄúHear me baby? Hold it together!‚Äù, adding playful swagger to her tougher voice

Visual Design
	‚Ä¢	Hana Song (D.Va)
	‚Ä¢	Hair color changes to blonde in twin pigtails, complementing a gothic lolita aesthetic  Ôøº Ôøº Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Outift: Black-and-dark-pink frilly dress featuring puffed sleeves, a chic pink bow at the neck, diamond‚Äëpattern stockings, and matching cat ears on her head  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Some users note missing facial whiskers paint, leading to community requests to include it  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Mech (‚ÄúTokki‚Äù)
	‚Ä¢	Fully matte black paint job with pink accents, including those adorable cat ears atop the cockpit and a mechanical tail that bounces during movement  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Heart-shaped ‚ÄúCat Force‚Äù emblem and sleek cables trailing like tails are added flourish  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üé≠ Theme & Inspirations
	‚Ä¢	Delivers strong magical-girl & anime vibes, reminiscent of Tokyo Mew Mew‚Äôs Ichigo Momomiya  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Embraces gothic-lolita aesthetics rather than her usual South Korean esports theme, blending cuteness with a dark, elegant style  Ôøº

Visual Design
	‚Ä¢	Hana Song (D.Va): Dressed in retro style‚Äîhigh-waisted jeans, red-and-white checked tied blouse revealing midriff, red ballet flats, and gold hoop earrings. She wraps her dark hair in a classic pink bandana and wears matching turquoise headphones  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Mech (‚ÄúTokki‚Äù): Reimagined as a pastel turquoise-and-white vintage cruiser, complete with chrome accents, curved bodywork, and little touches like pine-tree air freshener and fuzzy dice on her light gun  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üéôÔ∏è Audio Extras
	‚Ä¢	Custom Voice Lines: Several era-themed quips like ‚ÄúI‚Äôm cruisin‚Äô for a bruisin‚Äô,‚Äù ‚ÄúHey, daddy-o,‚Äù and ‚Äútime to split!‚Äù which enhance personality and nostalgia  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Dialog Variety: Cruiser skin has some of the most unique lines among D.Va skins, boosting her charm and presence in-game  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üåü Reception & Popularity
	‚Ä¢	Highly Acclaimed: Frequently ranked in top D.Va skins lists for its cohesive design and charm .
	‚Ä¢	Fan Favorite: On subreddits like r/DvaMains, players praise its look and enjoy the gameplay vibe it brings‚Äî‚Äúit has made my game sessions so much fun‚Äù  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Longevity: Since it‚Äôs only available via Anniversary event (loot boxes or 1000 credits), players often save it as a goal for rerun events  

Appearance & Color Palette
	‚Ä¢	Uniform: A navy‚Äëblue blazer trimmed in gold, paired with a hot‚Äëpink pleated plaid skirt and matching pink tie atop a white shirt  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Accessories: Gold‚Äërimmed round glasses, pink over‚Äëear headphones, knee‚Äëhigh blue socks, and white sneakers with pink laces finish the academic look  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Hair: Jet‚Äëblack pigtails (a departure from her usual brown), with side‚Äëframing bangs  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Mech (‚ÄúTokki‚Äù): Repainted in white, pink, and gold, topped with a stylized mech‚Äëhead that visibly imitates D.Va‚Äôs movement‚Äîmaking it resemble an anime‚Äëstyle school mech  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Effects: Boosters glow green, providing a fresh visual during flight sequences

B.Va (Legendary Black Skin)
	‚Ä¢	A premium black-and-yellow aesthetic variant of D.Va and her mech  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Classified as a Legendary skin, costing 1000 Overwatch credits  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Both pilot outfit and mech receive the dark/amber color scheme

Visual & Sound Design

Pilot Appearance
	‚Ä¢	D.Va dons a light-blue, button‚Äëup police shirt paired with a knee‚Äëlength dark skirt or pants, and a matching police cap‚Äîlooking every bit like a disciplined officer  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	A badge emblazoned ‚ÄúÍ≤ΩÏ∞∞‚Äù (Korean for ‚Äúpolice‚Äù) adorns both her uniform and the mech, alongside her name tag in Hangul ‚ÄúÏÜ°ÌïòÎÇò‚Äù on her chest  Ôøº.

MEKA Redesign
	‚Ä¢	The mech is recolored to resemble a patrol vehicle: crisp white and blue tones, flashing red/blue lights, a ‚ÄúPolice‚Äù emblem, and a siren visual .

Unique Audio Cues
	‚Ä¢	Booster sounds emit a faint police siren blare (‚Äúwewoo weewoo‚Äù) while using Boosters  

Visual Design & Theme
	‚Ä¢	Color Palette & Style
	‚Ä¢	D.Va‚Äôs mech and pilot outfit radiate summer vibes with bright light-blue, white, and purple tones, delivering that fun, breezy beach look  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Mech Modifications
	‚Ä¢	The mech resembles a jet ski, featuring propeller-like boosters and floral decals‚Äîlifted straight from watercraft aesthetics .
	‚Ä¢	Pilot Outfit & Accessories
	‚Ä¢	Hana swaps her signature bodysuit for red-pink swim shorts, a long-sleeved water vest (popular in Korea to avoid sunburn) adorned with the Rose of Sharon (Korea‚Äôs national flower)  Ôøº Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	She wears heart-shaped sunglasses, sports a flower tucked in her hair, and her light gun includes a cute dolphin keychain

2.content:
Appearance & Model Design
	‚Ä¢	Hair: Short, slicked‚Äëback orange‚Äëred locks give her a sharp, androgynous look  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Eyes: Striking heterochromia ‚Äì right eye glows red, left eye is icy blue. In some skins (like √âireannach), her blue eye turns green  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Face & Features: Gaunt, sharp cheekbones, and androgynous. Left eye often augmented with a metallic plate .
	‚Ä¢	Right Arm: Withered, mutated‚Äîdark blue to purple, veined, robotic enhancements in Overwatch 2  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Outfit: Wears a long black coat with flowing sleeves, tactical pants, and pointed shoes. High‚Äëtech tubes run from shoulders to a backpack-style canister, their color ‚Äì purple for damage, yellow for healing ‚Äì reflects her current mode  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üåê Ethnicity & Background
	‚Ä¢	Nationality: Irish, born in Dublin  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Heritage: Name ‚ÄòMoira‚Äô stems from Irish M√°ire and Greek meaning ‚Äúfate‚Äù; surname indicates exile descent  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Scientific Alignment: Geneticist obsessed with rewriting life‚Äôs blueprint, unbound by ethics  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Professional Ties: Formerly part of Overwatch‚Äôs covert Blackwatch. Now aligned with Talon, providing research and medical aid (notably to Reaper)  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

ü§ù Relationships
	‚Ä¢	Mercy: Ideological and scientific opposites. Their sprays complement visually ‚Äì Moira and Mercy represent two halves of the Overwatch symbol  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Reaper: She‚Äôs his medical caretaker‚Äîkey in sustaining his undead transformation  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Talon Inner Circle: Respected for her intellect, she holds a high position within Talon  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

‚öôÔ∏è Abilities & Weapons
	1.	Passive: Heals more quickly after taking damage (regen begins after 2.5s instead of 5).
	2.	Biotic Grasp:
	‚Ä¢	Primary: Yellow healing beam for allies.
	‚Ä¢	Secondary: Purple damage beam that leeches health and replenishes her biotic meter  Ôøº Ôøº.
	3.	Biotic Orb: Launches a bouncing orb ‚Äì choose healing (yellow) or damaging (purple)  Ôøº.
	4.	Fade: Short-range teleport with invulnerability; can‚Äôt attack while faded  Ôøº.
	5.	Ultimate ‚Äì Coalescence: A dual-purpose beam that heals allies and damages enemies, bypassing barriers  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üß† Personality & Lore
	‚Ä¢	Morality: Amoral, ruthless in pursuit of science; sees ethics as obstacles to progress  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Traits: Calm, logical, but secretly relishes manipulating test subjects  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Research & Self-Experimentation: Her decayed arm and red eye likely result from her genetic experiments. She‚Äôs racing to reverse her own degeneration  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Cultural Touches: Favorite drink = Irish coffee; favorite animal = giant centipede (Scolopendra gigantea)  Ôøº. Enjoys art and cooking, avoids crowds  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üî´ Weapons & Visual Aesthetic
	‚Ä¢	Weapon Design: Originally conceived with mechanical tentacles, evolving into the dual‚Äëtube biotic system after gameplay considerations  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Visual Duality: Healing side (yellow, left hand); damaging side (purple, right hand)‚Äîsymbolic and gameplay intuitive .

‚∏ª

üßæ Personality Profile
	‚Ä¢	Alignment: Villainous scientist, morally gray but self-interested‚Äînot out to destroy the world, just push its limits .
	‚Ä¢	Openness to Experimentation: Enjoys uncovering secrets of life and death, particularly fascinated by decay and entropy  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Temperament: Cool and self-assured, dominating in conversation, meticulously dressed yet efficient.

‚∏ª

üè∑ Favorite Things
	‚Ä¢	Drink: Irish coffee  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Animal: Scolopendra gigantea, aligned with her fascination for life‚Äôs more unsettling side  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Hobbies: Art appreciation, culinary experimentation, prefers solitude  Ôøº

‚∏ª

üõ° Team Role & Synergy
	‚Ä¢	Role: Support with strong self-sustain and disruption capability  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Strengths: Sustain in clustered battles, hybrid of healing and damage output, great escape with Fade.
	‚Ä¢	Ideal Teammates: Tanks that engage quickly; damage dealers to capitalize on her orb control.
	‚Ä¢	Counters: Struggles against long-range hold-down, high burst DPS (Ashe, Bastion)  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üé≠ Personality Symbolism
	‚Ä¢	Androgyny & Design Influence: Tall and slender, Moira defies gender norms and draws Bowie comparisons  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Cultural Inspirations:

	‚Ä¢	Mentor to Genji: Helped Genji reconcile his human and cybernetic sides, forming a deep spiritual bond  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üõ°Ô∏è Abilities & Combat Style
	‚Ä¢	Orb of Destruction (Primary/Secondary): Fires single or charged volleys (up to 5) of lethal energy orbs‚Äîno falloff with distance  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Orb of Harmony: Heals a single ally (30 HP/s) as long as line-of-sight is maintained  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Orb of Discord: Amplifies damage taken by an enemy by 25% when attached; strategic targeting is crucial  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Transcendence: Ultimate; during its 6‚Äësecond duration, Zenyatta becomes invulnerable, moves faster, and heals nearby allies (300 HP/s in 10‚ÄØm radius)  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Snap Kick: A melee strike with bonus knockback; dangerous but short-range  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üß¨ Lore & Ethereal Inspiration
	‚Ä¢	Shambali Order: Part of a group of awakened omnics who believed in spiritual equality with humans. Their leader was Tekhartha‚ÄØMondatta, later assassinated  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Philosophy: Believes in action over doctrine‚Äîleft the monastery to walk the world teaching by example  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Mysterious Iris: Lore hints at a metaphysical force called the Iris that empowers him‚Äîseen in fan theories and references to Sombra/Bastion  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üéØ Combat Role & Team Fit
	‚Ä¢	Role: A hybrid support with strong offensive potential. He excels at long-range damage and single-target healing.
	‚Ä¢	Strengths:
	‚Ä¢	High-ish burst damage (charged orb volleys)

	‚Ä¢	Limitations:
	‚Ä¢	No mobility ability; slow and vulnerable to flankers

‚∏ª

üé® Favorites & Traits
	‚Ä¢	Favorite sedentary environment: He prefers coastal areas‚Äîthey remind him of his birthplace .
	‚Ä¢	Hobbies: Meditation, teaching, pondering metaphors, preparing food ceremoniously  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Quotes: ‚ÄúAmid discord, we will find tranquility.‚Äù

‚∏ª

üß© Team Dynamics & Synergy
	‚Ä¢	Synergies:
	‚Ä¢	Pairs well with mobile healers who can back him up when he‚Äôs focused on healing or discording key targets
	‚Ä¢	His ultimate complements tanks under heavy fire or burst team damage

‚∏ª

‚öîÔ∏è Weapons & Gear in Design

Appearance & Aesthetic
